Reviews.Title: “OK OK laaaaaahhh”
Reviews.Author: Irvansaid
Reviews.Content: This is our last stop on our 24 days European honeymoon trip. The room on the 7th floor was regularly sized (I expect more for the price) though designed very well, it was new or so I was told. The room also smelled wonderful, my wife whose nose is very discerning was quite happy about this. I loved the bathroom, it was spacious, clean with good water pressure. Luckily we didn't get the noisy room from the renov they're doing like so many others have said here, we were loving the balcony even though the view was abysmal. The bed was comfortable BUT it was not king size. King is 180x200 cm, the bad was clearly 160x200 ( yes, I took the time to measure it). As the result,... my wife nearly kicked me out off bed at 3 in the morning. The amenities were by Bvlgari, a standard for an upmarket hotel. Location was "awesome" everything was within walking distance. Chanel boutique downstairs, I thought i mentioned that, because branded fashion boutiques choose their location very carefully. Now....when I checked out there was a charge of 14 Euros for minibar, which I inquired because I never took anything from minibar. turned out it was for the coffee capsules they have in the room, yes they have nespresso machine which was a delight, but they didn't tell us that they're going to charge for the capsules at a very high price. There was a nespresso shop just across the street, I would have bought my coffee capsules there if I knew they were charging for coffee in the room. Charging for coffee in the room? tchk tchk tchk...seriously idiotic for a hotel this caliber. Alright, room was nice, a little larger would be better, bathroom was great, balcony was great, I thought the room rate I paid included breakfast but apparently not, I don't know who's fault is that. Luckily, there's a nice cafe just around the corner. All in all, as my wife and I usually said to each other when things are so-so, OK OK laaaaaahh.

Reviews.Title: “Majestic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LindajNewCity
Reviews.Content: Please be aware that they are doing construction at The Majestic and it was very loud. The hotel will not tell you this. Also we had no window view so you couldn't tell if it was day or night. Which was strange considering our room was a upgrade. Not sure if all hotels are like this in Barcelona but be aware that if you drink coffee in your room there was a charge. Great location!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nostalgic Visit”
Reviews.Author: DavidS43
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel a long time ago and to go there again was just pure nostalga, even though the the interior of the hotel has changed significantly. We advised when booking in that we had been given an upgrade re the type of room, we thought that this was a good start, even though I thought the package included breakfast it did not (related to the place we found have breakfast this turned out to be a bonus). The main problem turned out to be that the upgraded room was next to a room that was being renovated, early the next morning we were awoken drilling, hammering etc, the fact that the staff put us next to this room knowing that it was going be noisy was appalling decision

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location/helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: LostInSpace
Reviews.Content: We're leaving this hotel in the morning. It has met all our expectations. The front desk has been more than helpful with advice with our various needs...restaurant advice, hair salon services and today they produced from under the reception desk a roll of bubble wrap we needed. We weren't here to shop but the hotel is located on the "right" street for high-end shopping. This neighborhood has block after block of beautiful buildings in every direction. The hotel is a block from the Rambla de Catalunya, a broad avenue devoted to pedestrians. There are lots of restaurants in the area. Two we really liked are not listed but were excellent: Dry Martini and La Taberna del Clinic. Both were recommended by my wife's niece who lives here and we found them to warm, inviting and serving excellent food.

Reviews.Title: “5 star prices, 4 star service”
Reviews.Author: essjay2730
Reviews.Content: Booked an extended weekend trip to Barcelona and took advantager of some points we had accrued with an online booking agent to book a Deluxe Premium room at the Majestic. I'm not intending to write war and peace on this one so here are the +'s and -'s... Positives.. We had a double deluxe premium that was a well appointed room, nice furnishings, good sized bathroom, good tv, comfortable bed, loads of storage, safe, dressing gowns, slippers, overlooked a backstreet - awful view but quiet. Efficient reception staff - good concierge that recommended a good restaurant within 10mins of the hotel Location is awesome - you couldn't be better placed - in walking distance of all the main 'must do's in Barcelona. Roof bar area is small and the pool is tiny but it has great views of the City and is a great place to relax in the evening after a long day of sightseeing and unwind with a drink. Negatives: Astronomically priced - they charged for everything - 2 drinks at the bar one evening was €28! You had to pay for the coffees in the room - they were €3.85 each and what made that worse was the house keeping didn't replensih the sugars or milks every day. Wi-fi wasnt free, even in the lobby - we were told an outside company runs iit for the hotel and they charge - we didn't ask how much - we were too afraid. We paid €80 for two sandwiches, 3 beers and 2 glasses of cava... We actually went to the Mandarin Oriental one night down the road and their bar was awesome and cheaper! No idea what the restaurant was like as we opted not to eat there - we looked in one night at about half 8 and there was one person in there - we opted for a bar meal which was actually pretty good but it is hard to get a club sandwich wrong. Service was hit and miss - if you were in the right place at the right time you would get served promptly and with a smile, otherwise you had to throw yourself in front of the waiter/ barman to get their attention. We waited on the roof bar for 30mins to get served one afternoon - not helped that the poor waitress seemed to have to go down 10 storeys to get the drinks back up to the roof bar - there's a bar up there but maybe too early on in the season for them to open it yet there were a lot of guests up there. One time on the roof I ordered a beer and before I had even finished it i was told quite rudely by the waitress that I needed to pay for it now. I didnt argue and had no problem, but i was planning on having another as were due to leave and had half an hour to kill but after her attitude we promptly left. Steam room/ sauna are not complimentary and there is a charge - again, too afraid to ask. We ate over the road every morning and got a cappucino and chocolate croissant for 2 for about €10 - again, didn't want to be over charged for eating in the restaurant downstairs - dont know how much it cost but breakfast in the room varied from about €20 to about €40 dependent on what you ordered. I'm by no means tight but we felt these charges were disproportionate to the experience. This is a good 4 star hotel with a nice relaxed feel to it but it needs to sharpen up its service and look at its pricing.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 star service”
Reviews.Author: Padster1
Reviews.Content: I have given this hotel 4 stars overall predominately for the location and quality of the room, be aware this is no way a 5 star Hotel. We have stayed in numerous 5star hotels across the world and this was our third trip to Barcelona but our 1st stay at The Majestic. We stayed over Easter so they may have been busy but on arrival at check in the staff were almost rude, showed no interest in us just said sign here and gave us the key. No introduction about the hotel and facilities, I had to ask where breakfast was and how much. When we were finally taken to our room despite requesting a king size bed we had twin beds and as we were tired we didn't make a fuss but the porter said they would sort it the next day - they didnt! However a nice touch was the bottle of cava that was in the room to celebrate our Anniversary. The following day we arrived back from a day of sightseeing and shopping to find our room had not been serviced - at 4.30 pm! When I called housekeeping they said we have until 5pm to do it - no apology. We decided to go up to the roof top bar for a glass of wine whilst they were cleaning the room and there were a number of people up there as the weather was glorious but a lack of any staff to take orders, my husband had to go inside and call from the Spa for someone to come up, this took a long time. It's not really what you would expect of a hotel supposedly 5 stars. Breakfast in the restaurant was 19E each - don't bother there is a lovely cafe across the road with delicious coffee, fresh orange and pastries at a fraction of the price. Again on price it is outrageous that you are charged for a capsule of coffee in the room, 5 star hotels provide this for free - there is a nespresso shop across the road from the hotel and 12 capsules costs the same as 1 from room service! To top it all on Saturday my husband tried to book a restaurant with the conceirge for our anniversary but he was on the phone and waved his hand at us. One of the check in staff said he would do it, took the details said he would call us to let us know and guess what no call! When my husband went down to enquire the response was they were full but again no apology as to why he didn't let us know or even a recommendation for somewhere else which is what most hotels of this standard would do. My husband was furious and another guest in reception at the same time was also complaining about the shocking service. I love Barcelona and we have lots of good time memories here over the years but this hotel needs to sort out service with a smile!

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Irishshango
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel in a beautiful city The Pool on top if the roof is an added attraction Breakfast is also very good Located in a good part of town The open top tour bus stops outside the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but maybe not 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: Firstgogirl
Reviews.Content: This is a very attractive hotel with nice rooms on a luxurious street. I am not sure it is a 5 star, I would call it a 4+. I resent having to pay a fortune for wifi in my room when I am already paying for a premium hotel. Yes, there is wifi available in the business center but I travel with my laptop and want it in my room. There is a coffee maker in the room but watch out- it is $3.5 euros to make yourself a cup of coffee. And that is not made very clear. It is there and you may assume it is free - it is not. I found the breakfast nice but it was a buffet and not made to order. Again, for a 5 star I would expect my breakfast made to order and not scrambled eggs on the buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad breakfast”
Reviews.Author: kinyo92000
Reviews.Content: We didn't stay at this hotel, so I can not review for the entire hotel experience. The last day we stayed at Barcelona, we decided to have breakfast at at 5 stars hotel, which seems from the outside and the reception as a magnificent hotel!! But the breakfast was really disappointing, since 8 out of 10 items were not fresh (pastries, croissants etc) and the variety of items were quite limited. I wouldn't recomend it.

Reviews.Title: “5 stars is about attitude!”
Reviews.Author: lovewhite
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed in this hotel for 3 nights break. It is not 5 stars GL hotel. It is very good 4 stars or average 5. Main downfall is unfriendliness of staff. In general there is no friendly smiles and not very tidy looking uniforms. All this putting down hotel rate at list one star lower. We are always staying in 5 star properties and I noticed that it is staff that mainly makes your stay, not even hotel facilities. In a hotel like this you expect to be recognised and looked after. It seems that staff in Majestic was never trained to do so. The only person who was very helpful was a concierge who directed us to restaurants and other places. Hotel facilities are not bad. It is very clean. Room is very very small, but has a good size bathroom and nice bath products bathrobes and slippers. Room has good flat TV and coffee machine, but this is where the problems started. Tv kept loosing signal every half minute. When I rang receptions twice, nobody came and fixed it, so we had no Tv. We used a coffee machine and only at check out we find out that you have to pay for coffee 3.50! It is not clearly stated unless you look at the bar price list, so be beware . Shortly after arriving we went to have a look at spa and pool and we never came back. Pool is tiny and it is on the open air and water is not heated, so it is not useful unless you are there on summer. Internet wifi is outragely expensiv, 15 euro per day. Breakfast was ok. Food nice enough but very limited choice for this range of properties. Worst part about it was that staff would never approach you with tea or coffee. You actually have to run after waiter yourself and ask him to bring you whatever you need. I never saw it anywhere else. Good point is location. This street is one of the best to stay in Barcelona. Overall I would recommend to stay in this hotel if you have a good deal and it is reasonable priced. But do not expect top notch 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: anaconda01
Reviews.Content: Travelled with a group of nine couples to celebrate my husbands 40th birthday to Barcelona and the majestic provided us all with luxurious rooms. Alas the hotel bar and food proved to be too pricey for our budget forcing us to eat out, which we did with ease due to the plentiful supply of restaurants and bars all within easy walking distance of the hotel. The roof top terrace provides stunning views of the vista that is Barcelona, although cramped at times due to its popularity the swimming pool is nothing more than an over sized foot spa. Overall would recommend for that special celebration but if on a limited budget would suggest you do your research first.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: YoungIrishman
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed here for 2 nights. Location could not be better! The hotel is positioned on the premier street in Barca. A night time drink on the rooftop terrace is a must.....what a view! We stayed in the apartments across the street from the hotel. They were spotless, roomy & modern. A little welcome pack of tea/coffee biscuits would have been nice when we arrived but maybe I'm being picky. The apartments would be perfect for families. It would be difficult to find a better place in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay”
Reviews.Author: evie_g23
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, very smart, clean with polite and attentive staff. Room was also great, good size with comfortable bed. Had the best hot chocolate ever (room service). Great location, able to walk everywhere. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jodi a
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 2 years in a row, pre/post cruise. Although we liked it the first time enough to come back, the 2nd time was after the renovations had been completed and this time we were THRILLED. Beautiful modern rooms with an amazing shower, Nespresso coffee machine in the room, rooftop pool, delicious buffet breakfast and within walking distace to so many things. The rates were relatively reasonable (for Europe) as we booked far in advance and took advantage of their extended stay promotion.

Reviews.Title: “for a family or a couple”
Reviews.Author: pcarvalho
Reviews.Content: twelve people, including kids, on the Residence. No complains. Rooms in the Hotel, couples and kids, gentle and helpfull. Confortable, very good service, marvellous shower. I'll be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: vbm6
Reviews.Content: Excellent location within walking distance of everything, and I mean, everything. The concierge is very informative and know all the good places to eat. It would be worthwhile checking with them about restaurants and anything else. One even found me an optical shop where I could buy contact lenses! It is worth upgrading to a room with a view as the internal rooms, in spite of their size, are dark and look onto a construction site at the moment. B&B does not include room service breakfast so be warned. The management kindly reimbursed my breakfast expense as no one told us that breakfast was only available in the dining room. This is my third stay at the Majestic and I will definitely return and recommend it to anyone travelling to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with expensive extras”
Reviews.Author: no818528
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in November and received what I expected from a 5 star property with regards to location and luxury. The rooms were more than sufficient in comfort and size. What I found difficult to accept was the 15 Euro per day charge for internet usage. With technology today being what it is, and with most hotels now including free wi-fi, I am unsure why this hotel feels they need to charge such an exorbitant amount? Full buffet breakfast at 19 Euros is standard for the type of hotel. Dinner in the "Condal" was very good, but once again very expensive, along with drink prices in the bar area. I know mini-bar prices are always high, but I am still trying to recover from the price of a small can of nuts that my room mate ate! I am all for the 5 star so-called luxury properties, but would probable feel better if they were a little more flexible in the extra charges. With room rates already being on the high side for such properties, do they really need to go overboard for anything extra? Maybe they do!

Reviews.Title: “Love our stay at Hotel Majestic”
Reviews.Author: chad2001
Reviews.Content: We got moved here after its 3-star "sister" hotel at the top of the Ramblas could not offer us the room we had booked. (There was a big convention when we were in Barcelona). So, effectively, it's a free upgrade for us! We love our room on the 8th floor at Hotel Majestic. It even has a couple of skylights with remote control shades. It is a very nice hotel. Breakfast was excellent. We were extremely happy to have been moved here. Location is excellent, about 10-15 min walk from Las Ramblas but within easy walking distance from a couple of Gaudi's attractions. Public transportation is practically "next door" (buses, taxi stand), or only half a block away (subway). I would definitely recommend this hotel to my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - lovely view from the roof top!”
Reviews.Author: orangecat1
Reviews.Content: We held a company event here. Overall, quite good – clients seemed to really like it. Nice rooms, nice gym and nice lobby bar. Centrally located. Breakfast was ok, rooms are small but modern and clean. The roof top patio is very nice and gives a great view of the city!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: pweath
Reviews.Content: This Hotel has the perfect location. It is two blocks from the Gaudi Museum. It is lavish, beautfiul and well appointed. The service is excellent. The rooms are large and lovely. The bedding is top notch. Stayed one night before catching a ship. Absolutely close to everything in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful old world comfort”
Reviews.Author: joanne17221
Reviews.Content: We were so lucky to have stayed at this hotel. The service was grand, the room comfortable and bright. It was close to Las Ramblas and the Gotic area,yet central to travel to other sections as well. I would stay there again without hesitation

Reviews.Title: “Nice location not enough services”
Reviews.Author: wjsinfrance
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel in the very best location in Barcelona. However there are literally no services provided other than basic hotel services. The staff was very very nice but there just isnt enough of them. Forget about asking for any concierge services like reserving tickets or on-line check-in as I was not sure that Internet even works in the hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Service Can't Be Beat”
Reviews.Author: Sandy C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Majestic 2 days pre-cruise and 1 day post cruise. Had early check-in requests both times and although we were advised that the hotel was full on those 2 occasions, the manager of the hotel was able to get us into our room within an hour of check-in both times. The staff was extremely accomodating and all requests were filled within minutes. It was my birthday during our first stay and we received complimentary flowers, champagne and strawberries. On our second stay, we received more champagne and nuts along with a card welcoming us back to the hotel. The location of the hotel can't be beat!!

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel, 1 star service”
Reviews.Author: JamieT8175
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a conference. The hotel is very well located on one of Barcelona's main streets, near some of the Gaudi attractions. Being 5 star, everything looks nice and the rooms are comfortable, albeit very small. However, the service is far from 5 star. We arrived on an overnight train at about 10am and asked for the possibility of an early check in. The manager wasnt very helpful and we didnt get our room until 2pm. Drinks here are ridiculously expensive - 6 Euro for a lemonade! This must be one of the only hotels in Spain where you have to pay for wireless internet. The lifts were inadequate for the amount of rooms and stairwell was unavailable. Our dinner in the hotel was terrible, but this may have been a 1 off as the buffet breakfast and lunch was OK. My girlfriend booked a spa treatment, but came away more stressed because of the building work going on in part of the hotel, so not relaxing. The hotel management didnt want to know about it when we complained. After travelling Spain for 4 weeks, this was the most expensive hotel we stayed in, but the only one we were unhappy with.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: dhowbad
Reviews.Content: Hotel is beautiful. Perfect location for being in the center of the city. Roof top bar is beautiful but be prepared for some very pricey drinks. Rooms are recently remodeled, well done and very comfortable. Service is excellent. Would have given 5 stars if internet was provided and their bars weren't so expensive. For the room price internet should be provided. Recommend going to the roof bar and sipping a drink it awesome, for just everyday drinks get them for 1/5 the cost at the outside cafe a few 100 feet in any direction.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but beware of an early arrival”
Reviews.Author: Beep77NewYorkState
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the Hotel Majestic several years ago and when planning another cruise from Barcelona, I mentioned to our travel agent that we would like to stay at the Majestic for the two nights before our cruise. We had an overnight flight from NY and arrived at the hotel very tired and in need of someplace to rest and freshen up. We were told that our rooms would not be ready until 3 pm! My husband decided to just stay in the hotel lobby and rest. We [my daughter and neice] decided we would try to shop but fatigue caught up with us and we returned to the hotel. We inquired several times about our rooms but were told that they would not be ready until 3. In the meantime, we noticed that a great many people were registering and being shown to their rooms. The desk staff was quite indifferent to our requests, I hope they didn't mind people sleeping in their lobby. Their location is very good but the hotel was quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: mumiller1
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in wonderful area-close to shopping, dining and Gaudi sites. The rooms are small, but well appointed and well utilized. The staff was accommodating and pleasant. The breakfast buffet had a large variety of different foods and taste to choose. Free wifi in the business center.

Reviews.Title: “Best Shower! Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: JMM1975
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 9:30 a.m. and we checked in immediately... Huge perk when you are on an over night flight. We had one of the newly renovated rooms, comfortable bed,awesome bathroom, all marble with the best shower, ever! We were on the 7th floor and all rooms on the 7th floor have a private terrace with tables, and seating. The Roof top pool/bar was small but nice, with excellent views of the sea and city. At night it turned into a candle lit lounge w/ DJ. Really nice! Great Location, friendly staff, very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Best Shower! Comfortable room, great location”
Reviews.Author: Eponagirl
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Majestic was a fine place to stay right in the action of Barcelona. It is a clean hotel with great service. All of the staff that we encountered from Front Desk, Consierge, Housekeeping, Room Service, Spa, etc. were really wonderful, friendly and helpful. If they cannot speak English, they will find a staff member who does (most of them do speak English though) We've traveled several places in Europe and the US over the years and by far the Hotel Majestic has the BEST shower of anywhere we've stayed...a rain shower with lots of water pressure! The only way it could have been better was with jets on the walls. The marble bathrooms were well appointed and the mirror doesn't fog up. The room itself was very clean, comfortable beds, TV, wireless internet (for a daily fee), mini bar, safe, separate little walk in closet. Our room was tucked away and had skylights instead of windows, which I actually liked because the noise level from the street was a little lower. (everyone else we traveled with had windows) This is not say it was a noisy hotel, it's just right in the city and noise is to be expected. The location is great for getting around on foot, trendy upscale shopping around the hotel (Gucci, Channel, Hermes, etc), a small cafe across the street and many restaurants within walking distance. Taxis were very reasonably priced and easy to get. The hotel itself has a Michelin Star restaurant, but we did not get a chance to try it out this visit. Up the street a few blocks was a great restaurant if you crave something familiar- Da Greco Italian restaurant. Very friendly, great Italian food and they often give samples for the table to try. If you happen to hear of a restaurant called Dontell (has a laundry storefront and was told to us to be a hip trendy place by the locals) DO NOT GO THERE. Not sanitary or ethical in the kitchen (which you can see openly with the glass walls) That's all I'll say on that one. Avoid! The rooftop is where the spa is located. I've been to better hotel spas, this one was simple...but they do their best with what they have. There is a SMALL rooftop pool and bar. Great views of the city though and others that we traveled with frequented that area at night for a drink and cigar. Overall a very comfortable, convenient, clean visit at the Hotel Majestic. Would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Apartments”
Reviews.Author: SCenturion
Reviews.Content: Spent a week across the Majestic at their full service apartments. Clean, modern, private, and comfortable right on Psg de Gracia. I cannot comment much on the hotel services or staff other than reception desk and concierge who were always helpful. An excellent alternative to the typical hotel experience. Like having your own Pied a Terre in Bcn. The architectural widow on the first floor became my favourite pastime as life passes you by below on PdGracia.

Reviews.Title: “Good 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2010traveller83
Reviews.Content: Good 5 star hotel. Rooms including bathroom are spacious and clean. Beware however which room you get. Make sure its not the construction site side because views werent pleasent and no privacy when curtains are open. Overall very good hotel in a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good food, great spa”
Reviews.Author: QAnnBan
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff are not friendly and the hotel is overpriced for what you get -pay extra for internet service. Food is good but again the staff is not friendly. The view from the spa is great and I had a great facial and massage.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: flyin4fun
Reviews.Content: Do not hesitate to stay at Hotel Majestic. It is beautiful, lush, cozy and classy. They have left nothing to chance. We were so jet lagged and yet when we walked into this hotel, it was so colorful and energizing that we forgot we'd just landed. The rooms are tastefully decorated and the baths make you feel like you're in a spa. The beds were very comfortable and rooms were incredibly quiet. The location is perfect for strolling the sidewalks. Gorgeous area. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs. Worst hotel I've stayed in during 6 months of travel."”
Reviews.Author: MonsieurPoirot
Reviews.Content: The charge for using internet in your room is 50 euros. Per person. Everything else in the hotel follows from that. This is one of the worst hotel experiences I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: randsacks
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We had a good sized room, with a balcony...and the breakfast was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place but service could be better”
Reviews.Author: 312578Helen
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the beautiful city of Barcelona and checked into our hotel. We chose to stay in an apartment instead of rooms in the hotel because we were 6 people of which the 4 were kids. What I was unaware of was that when you stay in their apartments you have to pay extra for a cleaner to come in and clean the apartment otherwise you clean it your self? I found this odd. They also do not provide you with tea coffee milk etc as they do in the actual hotel rooms which we had to check into for 4 hours, when we were departing as the check out time is 10 am and we had to vacate our apartment and check in time at the same apartment is 3pm. After much arguing and back and forth I was given a room for 4 hours although I was told they do not normally do this... and I was charged half the rate of what is normally charged for a room. This was very disappointing as I have never experienced this kind of behaviour in 5 star deluxe hotels. The hotel and apartments were stunning but the reception staff could do with an attitude adjustment as they were generally unhelpful and unfriendly and generally disdainful. The rest of the staff in the hotel such as the porters etc were extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: mervenadir
Reviews.Content: great highlight of my Barcelona trip! spacious room, quiet clean, and the best thing about this place is its unbeatable location. very close to the best attractions of town. also, definitely visit the roof pool bar. amazing views, you can see all the way to the beach and teh magnificent monument; la sagrada familia is right infront of you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Annalene
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Barcelona for 1 week and opted to stay in the Majestic Residence, apartments across the road from the Hotel Majestic, with access to the hotel facilities such as pool etc..... The apartments are huge, with full kitchen facilities and well equipped for a family of 4. Loved the nespresso coffee machine. We liked the apartment and it’s in a fantastic central location - we walked to all the main sites and it’s in the heart of the shopping district. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jennifer k
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights on Aug 26th and 27th. Great room, large and very clean with lovely bath products. We did find the walls thin (could here the TV in the next room and in the morning the sounds of doors banging closed could be heard quite loudly). On the plus side, we stayed here after finishing a 12 day cruise and we got to the hotel at 9:00 am and they were very gracious in giving us our room at that hour. It was most appreciated and we found the staff to be very polite and helpful. The location is great, many fine shops and restaurants right out the front door. The exterior is also very beautiful and has a Chanel Store located right next door. Very classy neighbourhood. We would definitely stay here again when Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Celebrated our daughters 18th here, had a fab time!”
Reviews.Author: TessDunmow_Essex
Reviews.Content: we flew into Barcelona and spent 4 wonderful days enjoying Barcelona and all that it has to offer.... 4 days isn't enough so we will be back! The Hotel Majestic was fabulous, we felt properly pampered for check in to check out, nothing was too much trouble. If I had a criticism it was that the rooms were small for a 5 star but they were beautifully appointed with spendidly comfortanble beds and sumptious bathrooms. We didn't eat in the hotel but the food on offer for breakfast was plentiful and varied, so there is something for every taste. Barcelona itself is so diverse and a Green Bus tour or 3 are a must! If you only have time for one attraction, go see the Sagrada Familia, its visually stunning, inspirational and takes your breath away!

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: beckhutt
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend surpised me to a weekend away to this hotel , we had a suite and it was fantasic , Hotel was classy , Staff were very lovely and helpful. Spa was great aswell. Would def go back to this hotel - FAB GETAWAY HOTEL :-)

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotell with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Tozca
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights in April/May of 2011 in a Junior suite with balcony. We booked early so we got a good deal. The hotel has several bars and restaurants and one of them Drolma has a Michelin star. The suite was spacious and kept spotless. The staff are friendly and attentive. We arrived by taxi one day when it was raining and the doorman met us with umbrellas by the taxi. The hotel also has a spa. No free internet in the room, which we found strange in a 5 star hotel. There are a few computers in the business room, but those were mainly occupies by kids on Facebook or playing games. The roof top bar has a beautiful view of Barcelona and also a swimmingpool.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING and ELEGANT and PERFECT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: scarr416
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, perfect location, helpful staff. Could not have been more perfect!!!!

Reviews.Title: “the worst room ever”
Reviews.Author: Donald F
Reviews.Content: My preferred urban room was dingy and minute and had not been painted in years. We had to put our luggage on chairs. or near the entry. The furniture was thirdhand.and the bathroom unsatisfactory. Even the sheets and blanket seemed old. I went downstairs to complain and asked for a different room. The front desk person said that was what my travel agent had booked and made no offer to change the room (quite uncooperative). The looby was nice and I imagine the spa was also, but I sleep in the room. All this for $500 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great City”
Reviews.Author: silversandsmilf
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during our Jully 11 honeymoon. We absolutely loved this hotel. Perfect location, the Ramblas was an easy and beautiful walk as well as shopping and several great restaurants. The room ,while small, was beautifuly appointed, sparkling clean, and had really nice marble bathroom (the shower has incredible water pressure). The hotel itself is tatesfully decorated. The view from the rooftop pool/bar area is fabulous! We got some great shots of the cathedral and Barcelona. The only compalint I have was room service was outrageously expensive. Outrageous. But other than that is was perfect. We hope to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: 4tay4
Reviews.Content: we booked this apartment which is just across the road from the main hotel. the location is absolutely unbelievable. we cannot recommend the accommodation highly enough. 5* recommended. very large and well equipped - would like to have stayed longer. well done Majestic

Reviews.Title: “Great service, location and rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Charliep57
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. Arrival was great front desk and valet very efficient. We had the cheapest room but it was newly refurbished with a little sitting area. The bathroom all in white marble with an amazing shower and the toilet area separated from the rest of the bathroom. The location is excellent. We walked all over the city, to the Gaudi cathedral and to the port area. Lots of walking but a very nice, chic and safe area.

Reviews.Title: “unbelievably overrated.”
Reviews.Author: HarrietRobinson
Reviews.Content: Room totally ordinary, bathroom same. Concierge service so inconsistent - and in that area you need great and urgent advice. Sometimes huge queues of swarming teenagers trying to check in with 1 or 2 reception/concierge staff to cope with it. Also kids rushing up and down the corridors Sunday and Monday night late right outside our room - not too good... In great location, but absolutely would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, I would definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: SDBLima
Reviews.Content: This was very nice hotel located on the Paseo de Gracia and near La Rambla. The rooms were spacious, with very nice bathrooms. The breakfast was very good and was included with our room.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need for a great stay in Barcelona!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jjkaye
Reviews.Content: A party of four of us stayed at the hotel for three nights, before cruising. We had a warn welcome, slic and professional check in . The room was well appointed with an exquisite bathroom. The room offered all you could wish and more for a short break. The rooftop terrace is idyllic and a great place to watch the sunset after a busy day in Barcelona. In breakfast there was a great choice and served impeccably, however you are sat inside and by choice we do like to sit outside, but the room was bright and well air conditioned. The location is fabulous and you are next to the main station , if you wish to travel out of Barcelona. I would like to thank all of the staff and congratulate them on a great hotel / thankyou John and Julie Kaye. Nicholas and Joy Laister.

Reviews.Title: “NOT FIVE STARS”
Reviews.Author: Magazinedude
Reviews.Content: Wow really, Five Stars, Front desk acted as if they were doing us a favor while there. The hotel is in a very good location. Thats about it!! The spa is pathetic, the massage was horrible! Really loud room and paper thin walls. Maybe the staff should all take a trip to a Four Seasons Hotel and see how to treat people!!

Reviews.Title: “Majestic Rooftop Views...not so majestic service!!”
Reviews.Author: KBP05
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Majestic Barcelona from 1st July 2011 for 5 nights. The first 2 nights were spent with friends in a triple Junior Suite which was huge by any standards. It had the most enormous bathroom with 2 showers which was perfect for 3 girls! No complaints whatsoever. Following the 2 night stay, I then moved into a deluxe premium room on a double occupancy basis as my husband had flown in to join me and the hotel had no junior suites available. This room was pretty small but perfectly equipped in every way with a good sized bathroom. The best thing about this room was the stunning Japanese style balcony with a sofa set and plenty of room for sunbathing! Stunning!! Do note that we stayed on the 7th floor on the NEW side of the hotel....there is a 7th floor on the old side which is nowhere as nice so make sure you specify to the hotel that you want the new side. However, I must comment on the noticeably slack service received in the Rooftop Bar and the lobby lounge....not 5 star by most standards and the waiters did not speak English at all. On one occasion, we were seated at a table but not served for 30 mins...we left without drinks and were not asked why we were leaving. However, the views from the Rooftop Bar made up for any faults and one of the day waiters was very generous in refilling our champagne flutes without charge when he had accidentally spilled a glass on our table. Also, the check in time is 3pm which can be pretty inconvenient for early flight arrivals. I would advise leaving your luggage with the concierge, popping into the 10th floor spa where you can freshen up and enjoy a drink and snack at the Rooftop Bar before popping out for lunch at the nearby Tapa Tapa (to the left of the hotel on the Paseig de Gracia) and probably the best tapas bar in the whole of Barcelona! Also, check out time at the hotel is 11am but you can request a free check out up to 1pm if they are not busy. The buffet breakfast was great - all the usual suspects including comp cava which was a nice Spanish touch. The only other thing that bothered us slightly was the rather brash, abrupt manner of the front reception staff but, with hindsight, we feel that may just have been the 'Spanish' way! They came across as rushed as they were very busy when we checked in and not very welcoming. The location of the hotel was unbeatable - right in the centre of the city within easy walking distance to Placa Catalunya and La Rambla. The hop on / hop off touristic bus stop was a few steps from the hotel (to the right) and, for the ladies & interested gents, the Chanel boutique is located next door to the hotel with Gucci & LV right after that! All in all, a thoroughly enjoyable stay and would definitely return although may try the Mandarin Oriental a few steps from the Majestic (to the left of the hotel) on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but far from a five star.”
Reviews.Author: Mari39
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a week while on vacation. The rooms where ok yet far from five star in my opinion. We did upgrade as soon as we arrived, after reading all the reviews I did not want a room looking at a brick wall. Our room was on the 7th floor center front of hotel, it was a pretty nice view. The room was ok and I say this because it had older carpet and looked a little run down but to be expected in an older hotel, I guess? The beds were two twins pushed together (not ideal for couples wanting to snuggle) but were comfortable. My understanding this is normal for Europeans. You could not sit in bed to long without it moving (bed is on wheels) away from the wall. It was always very clean, and the maids did a good job, toiletries where not always stocked (just observation), yet really did not use them much since I brought my own. The walls are quite thin considering we could hear the people in the room next to us. On our last night we were up until early morning hours because of this. The staff were ok, kind of short, and if you ask for any recommendations on places to see or do it was pretty pointless in asking considering the answer was always the same, stating not really sure. As for the wifi we were given an hour free, and then paid like 7 Euros for 45 min, to check in back home with the kids. After that rain out we went to the front desk to inquire about more internet time and were told it was free for guests in the conference room. Not thrilled to find this out after having paid for it! The roof top bar had awesome views; however $45 for 4 drinks was a bit too pricey. If I was asked if I would stay at this hotel again, probably not, but overall was just ok.

Reviews.Title: “We were very happy and would return....”
Reviews.Author: rlisicki
Reviews.Content: We arrived around 300PM. Very modest wait to check in, we had booked a suite, however the hotel had oversold. We received an upgrade to one of the apartments and only had to wait a few moments. The room was very large, with an amazing terrace offering beautiful views. The room was clean, and well kept during our stay and we liked it very much. The hotel location is outstanding, very short walks to numerous sites and hotspots and we liked our stay there very much and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: VincentJames32
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the hotel Majestic and were very happy with everything. The rooms are big, the service is very good, but the hotel is a bit expensive considering what you get. We were recommended the Hotel Arts, but we liked the location of this hotel better.

Reviews.Title: “Not great - mostly unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: dvargo_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here at the end of a wonderful european vacation that included France and Italy. While the location was very good, we felt the staff to be less than welcoming. In all of our different vacations over the years, I have to say that this was the first time I felt a hotel staff to be so cold. We are by no means demading guest, but all in all the service was par at best. For a hotel of this reputation, I was not expecting this. They did do what needed to be done, but without friendliness, smiles or enthusiasm. To add to this when we checked out, we didnt get a thank you, a how was your stay or even do you need help with your luggage? very strange. There was one staff member at the front desk who was very helpful, giving us excellent advise on restaurants, but he was the only one that seemed to actually enjoy speaking to guests in general. It seems that most guest enjoy this hotel, we just didnt.

Reviews.Title: “Over the Top”
Reviews.Author: edwfla
Reviews.Content: Over the Top Hotel. Jr. Suite 2 rooms just renovated. Living room and Large comfortable King Bed. Standard double small but ok. Roof top pool and Bar very nice with great view of City. Staff was very accommodating and did everything possible to full fill any request. Their English was minimal. Location was excellent - only a few blocks from La Rambla and plenty of cafe's in the immediate area. Expensive Hotel - but worth it. All in all - a great stay

Reviews.Title: “very muy bueno!”
Reviews.Author: pllamas
Reviews.Content: i just stayed in the Majestic with my family. Being myself a hotelier i am always very critical with the hotels where i stay. i have to admit that Majestic exceeded my expectations. location 10 over 10, very well designed rooms and bathrooms. the best shower experience I ever had in the lots and lots of hotels where I have stayed in my life. Great water flow! very well trained staff and very polite! will defintely stay here in my next visit to this city that am starting to like evrytime more. congratulations to all!

Reviews.Title: “My worst experience in a five star”
Reviews.Author: Rajan08
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Majestic for three nights at the end of May. 30 minutes after checking in I called the front desk to find out the whereabouts of my bag. They had no clue what I was talking about but promised to call back. 15 minutes later and no calls back so I went down to the recption desk to loacte my bag. They wanted to know if I was checking in or out. I spotted my bag in the corner and voluntered to take it up myself. On the seond day when I returned to my roon midday there was a deafinng sound of drills and jackhammers and my entire room was shaking. I called reception they did not know what was happening. Long story short they were tearing down the room adajecent to mine but did not bother to inform me as a matter of fact reception were not aware of the on going construction. They moved me to a bigger room right away. I have just received a 28 Euro charge on my cc from the Majestic hotel with no explaination. I did not have any meals at hotel nor did I use their mini bars and I had paid for the everything when I checked out. I will just charge that to the worst experience and forget about it as my protest is going to fall on deaf ears. It is a shame they have such a nice property but it is so poorly run. With unemployment in Spain at 21% I am sure they can find better help. There are better luxury hotels in Barcelona so spare yourself the agony of staying at the Majestic

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: PierreLeGuide
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, and well located on main chic shopping street, about 10 blocks north of Old City. Room was very spacious, with enormous bathroom. A number of good restaurants in vicinity. Staff was accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Pre-cruise stay was a delightful way to begin our vacation!”
Reviews.Author: jano18
Reviews.Content: Our cruise departed Barcelona for a luxurious tour of the Mediterranean; I chose Hotel Majestic in Barcelona, and highly recommend it. I contacted the hotel approximately one week prior to arrival to ask for an early check-in as we flew overnight to Spain, arriving in the morning. We were able to check in and get a little nap time before setting out on the Hop-On Hop-Off bus which stopped two blocks away. Great room, great location, and very lovely environment in every way. The front desk was very pleasant, and all of our needs were taken care of precisely and efficiently. Our room had a view of the Gaudi-designed residence on the Block of Discord. Lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but be careful what room you get”
Reviews.Author: Meri007
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Majestic in Barcelona in May, 2011. Great location, great service, great breakfast but our room was depressing. When we arrived, a gentleman was requesting another room from the front desk but was told there weren't any rooms they could give him. That's when I knew we were not going to get a nice room. Our room was in the back of the hotel right next to the emergency exit which they left open 24/7, room 612. I closed the emergency exit door before going to bed because I felt unsafe. The room was dark, dingy and felt like you were sleeping in a closet. It had no view, the window was frosted glass so you couldn't see out and when you opened the window you would see a wall. Although, the bathroom was nice and spacious. They have a lovely rooftop bar with a small pool with an excellent view of Barcelona. It was quite beautiful. We would spend our evenings after dinner up there because we didn't want to be in our room. I peeked into another room that a maid was cleaning and it was spacious with a view. So they do have nicer rooms. I would stay here again but make sure I get one of the nicer rooms. It's near the La Rambla, many shops and cafes and close to the subway. We had a nice time despite that our room was not what we expected. Also, they provide free internet and a nice gym. Tip: We took the RENFE train to Passeig de Gracia Blvd. from the airport. Easy to get to, subway right down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: mm156
Reviews.Content: Cons: Awful service, overrun by throngs of cruise ship passengers. Staff seems overwhelmed and does not cater to guest needs. Pros: Close to Mandarin Oriental (where we are about to move to) We had booked two Urban Delux rooms confirmed by our travel agent. When we were checking in, they told us we were booked in lower Classic rooms and did not care what our itin said. I travel internationally for a living so know my way around hotels and how things are booked. They kept arguing with us but finally had to admit they were wrong but they did not have our confirmed room class. I cant start to even tell you all our troubles with the front office staff. They would not allow us to contact the General Manager, so Ms. Ravasi shame on your staff. I would not recommend this hotel at all and have already contacted the Preferred Hotels folks as I dont think the Majestic is worthy of their lable. This is not a five star hotel at best two stars so save yourself the trouble and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good service and nice room”
Reviews.Author: debsisco
Reviews.Content: I booked this online after reading several reviews of guests that booked through expedia. Went through the hotel webiste and found several pricing promotions that my travel consultant did not have access to. Since we were arriving early in the morning from a cruise, I requested a morning check-in if possible. We arrive at the hotel around 10 a.m. and were able to check in immediately. I opted to pay a little extra for one of the rooms in the new part of the hotel, one of the Deluxe Urban rooms, and the room was very nice and modern. The bathroom was great, the A/C was great, but the closet space for hanging clothes up was smaller than what we had on our cruise ship. It would have been adequate for a business traveler, but since we were returning from a 16 day cruise, it was a bit cramped. I probably should have opted for a different room, but all in all the room was very nice and had no complaints. People were very friendly and we really enjoyed our stay there. We did not dine in any of the restaurants, but the room service was quick and efficient. Make sure to check out the bar on the roof with the pool, they serve wine and champagne every day and it has an amazing view. The hotel was only a few steps from the "Hop on Hop Off" Tourist bus stop which made is extremely easy to sea all of the sites. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL HOTEL--RUDE FRONT DESK!!!”
Reviews.Author: OPBAUS
Reviews.Content: IT LOOKS LIKE A FIVE STAR HOTEL BUT HAS A FRONT DESK LIKE A NO STAR HOTEL.. After a wonderful Wind Star Cruise we ended up in Barcelona looking forward to the Majestic Hotel, but it wasn't to be. We arrived befor check in time, eventhough the hotel had been informed of the Cruise's arrival time. And rather than a "why don't you relax in the longue greeting", we were told that it wasn't open. We sat in the bar and after about two hours were told to come to the front desk where an older clerk whose chest was covered with metals told us they were upgrading us to a suite, suddenly said that our room was not ready and that it would be a few more hours. We waited and waited and waited and finally our unhappy room clerk with all the little metals gave us a room.. The room or suite was fine, but the phone didn't work and we didn't get a call because of it. It's really a fine hotel but I would never stay there again because of the front desk!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: mywonderfuljourneys
Reviews.Content: We spent a week here in Hotel Majestic and can say that it has the best location in stylish Pg De Gracia, close to many tapas bars, stylish shops and amazing architecture. We walked everywhere enjoyed the rich art and architecture this city has to offer. The room we had on the 7th floor was small but comfortable with nice bathroom and was kept impeccably clean, the housekeeping was excellent and prompt. The buffet breakfast had a great range and quality with excellent service staff. We enjoyed drinks up at the rooftop terrace with lovely views of the city.The front of the house staff were helpful but could be more friendly. Overall a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and amenities”
Reviews.Author: Vikas05
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels you can stay at Barcelona. Though the price is high during Mobile World congress, it makes up by its excellent location, breakfast and rooftop spa. Room size is small but comfortable. Overall I will like to stay here again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Nice days in a lovely place”
Reviews.Author: chris_ozil00
Reviews.Content: Just I want to share with you my last days in Barcelona. I stayed in this hotel with my family for 2 nights and we are still exciteds for the good choice! We reserved one apartment for ourselves in the middle of the city and was much better than an hotel room. The staff service was excelent, one young guy called John explain us all the apartment facilities and attend you in all of the stay, he recommend us good restaurants and nice places to visit! he makes our stay definitely easier for the language. I will recommend for all of you this Hotel, the location is the biggest advantage (near to Gaudi monuments and near to downtown) but also the acomodation and the good service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AdrienFauteux
Reviews.Content: The room was very small and we certainly over paid because we got the Hotel throught Royal Carabean and we would have got a much better rate on our own. The hotel is very nice but it is a old building well kept. The breakfeast was one of the nicest we had and was include with the price of our room . the staff was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “nice location”
Reviews.Author: fred1012
Reviews.Content: staff first class view from room poor woken up with workman second time we have stayed prior to a cruise food very expensive for what it was have had better for less beds were to hard

Reviews.Title: “very dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: sarahsupplisteak
Reviews.Content: my partner got us this trip as part of my christmas present ,on arrival i was imprest great location and looked nice outside, staff on desk were really nice ,but what a dissapointment when we got into our room when we undone the window all we saw was pipes and drab walls .we had to leave this window open at night because room felt very closesd in . if the people in rooms next to us had a shower you could here them so when they came in late at night it was horrible and we could nt get back tosleep as room was so hot with heating off and no proper window.all except for the room was great lovely staff on bar and on desk location great .

Reviews.Title: “A disapointment: nothing 5star about that!”
Reviews.Author: AliasIrene
Reviews.Content: 1. The rooms do not resmble what is advertised in the website. No view from the sml windows, small room, not that confortable bed. The website does not depict reality. 2. There is a pool advertised, but NOT functionning in the winter. Of course, this you only discover hen you get there. 3. Rich breakfast, but expensive and in the basement. no window or view. 4. On top of the overall dissatisfaction, we got a note on saturday evening saying that on sunday, there would be no water from 10h00 to 18h00 for maintenance reasons. Could they not do this during the night? At 09H15 when I entered the shower, while I was shampooing, the water was cut. After repetitive phonecals of my husband to the reception, and 15 minutes later, the water run again, but it was brown. I had to shower off the shampoo with freezing water from bottles in the minibar. This is not what I call 5 star hotel service. NO VALUE FOR MONEY. We left with a feeling of disappointment; on s'est fait avoir.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic experience for some Kiwi Travelers”
Reviews.Author: NZSHYGUY
Reviews.Content: Wanted a luxury hotel in a great location and got it. It was everything I hoped for. The rooftop was amazing, views pool, DJ's, awesome!!! The drink prices were amazing too but I guess that is how it goes, very expensive drinks on the rooftop bar. This is a hotel for peole that want a great experience and dont mind paying for it. There were so many fantastic resteraunts close by (I think Qu Qu was our favourite and we ate there twice). Hope I get to stay there again as had a great time and the breakdast was also very good. Best things were the locatiojn and the roofto views. I think worth paying for.

Reviews.Title: “A good location wasted”
Reviews.Author: eddy71
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Majestic for 4 nights with my wife in October while attending a congress in Barcelona. First let me say that this hotel has an exceptional location, right on the shopping district and everything is accessible easily, this gives it a very good plus. The staff were all quite nice and very professional, no fault there. We stayed in Room 806, it was adequate in size and the bathroom was really large and comfortable, no window view whatsoever. It was clean and the house keeping team was very vigilant so again no problem there. The breakfast was made of the traditional dishes, but included everything and it was fresh. The lobby was wide and comfortable with lots of areas to relax The major drawback of this hotel is the bad quality sound proofing, ie you can hear everything wether up, down or in the rooms on the same floor. this was quite bothersome at night when one would wake up at a multitude of noises coming from different rooms. The quality of sleep suffers severely. This is big set back. I really don't understand how this can happen in a 5 star hotel!!! I had friends in different rooms (attending same congress) and the complaint was the same for all. In general i think it's a shame that the hotel is wasted on such a complaint but to me this is crucial. i don't think i would stay there again next time in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Not good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Brenda096
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Majestic, in room 312 as I recall, in early October, 2010. Despite its 5 star rating (and I agree, the amenities are indeed lovely), we feel the hotel lets its guests down in the most important way: the rooms. Room 312 is a bit of an afterthought of a room: long, narrow, overcrowded with furniture, causing us to bump into it and each other. Its windows open up onto a sort of walkway, so obviously you can't have it open...but the glass is frosted over, giving the room a sort of creepy, claustrophobic quality. There is no ventilation in the bathroom. But the worst of it was that, right next door, jackhammering was going on all day. We complained twice, over two days, asking for another room. Trouble was, by the time we got back from our booked sightseeing tours in the afternoon, apparently all the other available rooms were taken. Luckily, the workers don't work on Saturday! In all fairness, our complaints were logged onto their computer, and when we checked out, we were given a 20% discount on the first night--but just the first night. The piano bar is quite lovely and relaxing, and we really didn't mind the breakfast room. The buffet there was perfectly adequate. And the rooftop bar is very pleasant for drinks in the late afternoon/evening. However, the Majestic remains the most expensive hotel we stayed at in Spain and was by far the least enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “There is ONLY one hotel to stay at in Barcelona and the Majestic is it!”
Reviews.Author: eliteinter
Reviews.Content: The Majestic is a beautiful boutique hotel on the "Champs Ellysee" of Barcelona". The best location possible to see Barcelona as everything is in walking distance and you are surrounded by history. The staff and service are amazing and on top, there is a spa, pool and bar with a magnificant view of the entire city. I cannot wait to go back to Barcelona and will always stay at the Majestic!

Reviews.Title: “spacious,clean,excellent service and restaurant”
Reviews.Author: brucerosa
Reviews.Content: stayed at the majestic for one night before cruising. wonderful spacious room,clean and up to date.great for travelers that are use to classy rooms. would return on a drop of the dime!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: jldvirgo
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night prior to a cruise, and I wish I could have stayed longer. We arrived early, and could not get early check in. After travelling overnite 8 hours on the plane from the states, this was a disappointment. So, tired as we were, we set out to see some of the sights. We returned at 3 pm and checked in. Well, after booking this trip months in advance, I was disappointed to be shown to a SMOKING ROOM! I smelled the stale odor of cigarettes as soon as I walked into the room...ugh! I went back down to the lobby to protest, and was immediately given another room on the 5th floor, front of the hotel with a fabulous view. The room was huge, a junior suite, with a KING size bed, sitting area, and beautiful marble bath with whirlpool tub and full shower. Also, Bvlgari toiletries, fluffy white towels, and BATHROBES! The bed was super comfortable, the room beautifully decorated. If I go back to Barcelona, i will definitely go back to The Majestic.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: julieame
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Majestic for two nights prior to a cruise. The hotel is in a fabulous location on the Paseo de Gracia. The rooftop pool is small, but the views at the pool and rooftop bar are amazing. The rooms are very typical for a European hotel at this price level, although the beds are the most comfortable I have experienced in Europe. What really made the hotel shine, however, is the incredible service of the front desk and concierge staff. They went far beyond what would normally expected in order to make our stay comfortable and enjoyable. I will return to the Hotel Majestic in the event I retrun to Barcelona, and will unequivocally recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Having read some of the reviews I was apprehensive but there was no need”
Reviews.Author: gladtobehome039
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a stay of 2 nights at the Majestic and have absolutely no complaint. We were a party of 7 and the reception staff were helpful and efficient unlike a lot of other service people that we came across outside the hotel who were downright rude. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The maid did a really good job. An iron and board arrived within minutes of a request as did a travel adapter.The rooms looked over the car park or faced concrete walls but as we were in the middle of a city I was not expecting scenic views. The curtains are heavy enough to let in light but block the view. There was building work going on outside but we were out most of the day and when in the room found it not at all obstrusive. I had a relaxing and pleasant stay and I would have no problem staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “We recently stayed at the majestic hotel...”
Reviews.Author: MrsAliSimpson
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the majestic hotel for 10 nights for our honeymoon. On arrival the staff at reception upgraded us free of charge simply because we were staying so long! The location was perfect and during our stay, we felt we had thoroughly taken in most of the barcelona highlights. The staff were all exceptionally pleasant, polite and extremely helpful. The service on the roof was excellent and the sushi was amazing. I will certainly be recommending the majestic to anyone planning to stay in barcelona, and will certainly return when in barcelona again. We couldn't have asked for a better honeymoon! Mr and Mrs Simpson, from Glasgow

Reviews.Title: “Be ashamed Majestic! Selling non existing rooms!”
Reviews.Author: ThenHePackedAndLeft
Reviews.Content: I wanted to have a room with a private terrace for some hot&sunny days in Barcelona. The fact, that Majestic has got some rooms with a large private roof terrace was the only reason why I booked this hotel, as I usually stay at Casa Fuster. Hotel Majestic sent me a written confirmation: ''a De Luxe Room with a private terrace''! When checking in I received a key for a room on the 6th floor. Knowing that the de luxe rooms are all located on the 9th floor, I reminded the unfriendly, arrogant lady behind the desk, that I have booked a room with a terrace. She told me, that I have been upgraded. I told her, that I don't want to be upgraded, I just want to have a room with a terrace. ''You have got a junior suite (NO terrace!) facing the Paseo de Gracia, You should not complain, but be very grateful for what we have decided to give You, as we also have got junior suites facing the backyard''. What an attitude - I say!!! I can only agree with the previous TA member (review Jul 27.) ''Worst hotel service in Europe''! The truth is: hotel Majestic sold me a room that doesn't exist. The entire 9th floor, as well as the whole eastern wing of the hotel, has been closed for rebuilding already for months and will remain closed for several months to come. The rebuilding is causing a lot of noise to certain parts of the hotel - be warned! Selling a room that doesn't exist is a crime, isn't it? Hotel Mandarin Oriental (next door) has got lovely rooms with a terrace - a fact that I found out too late, otherwise I would have left Majestic immediately. Finally, even hotel Majestic has got at least one person with the right service attitude: my special thanks to the tall&slim guy who took care of the roof terrace area during the morning and afternoon hours. Great service & wonderful friendliness! However, one great person is not enough for even thinking of staying at this so-called five star hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Service in all of Europe!”
Reviews.Author: SoCalTravel123
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent 3 weeks in 5 different countries in Europe. We loved all the hotels we stayed at except for the Hotel Majestic. Although language was a problem in almost all of the other countries, the staff at the other hotels bent over backwards to take care of us. At the Hotel Majestic we were able to speak Spanish and they spoke English, so language was not an issue. The staff was just rude and not helpful at all. We had simple requests, coffee at breakfast, directions, etc. and we were either ignored, given misinformation or they were put out when we asked for anything.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Rooms”
Reviews.Author: ph7719
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is excellent, right in the middle of the city but on Passeig de Gracia, which is much preferable to La Rambla. The staff was friendly and the rooms were very nice (we had a Junior Suite, which had a bathroom with two sinks and two showers, great for getting ready in the morning). The panoramic view of the city from the pool is amazing, both during the day and at night, which made our stay even more enjoyable. My only complaint is the internet, which is not great and requires getting a password from the front desk to use their business center (wi-fi is not included), and even this causes stress as the connections are mediocre at best (which made checking in for the flight home difficult). However, the hotel is very reasonably priced and all factors considered I would most definitely stay here if in Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “Most impressive service I have yet experienced”
Reviews.Author: Shekamu
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Majestic for one night with my spouse and small baby after we decided to change from another hotel in Barcelona which was disagreeable. Initially we got quite a small room and there was no space to move around much but were transferred to a much more spacious room once we asked for a cot. This came with a baby bottle warmer and a set of baby toiletries. Our own bed was two twins stuck together which some may dislike but I don't think it makes much of a difference and the bed is bigger. The interiors are starting to look a bit dated but are still acceptable. The bathroom had a sliding door separating the sink from the WC and shower. Was happy to see a 'normal' tap which didn't need separate hot/cold water adjustment and there was a hairdryer, good toiletries and sanitary bag disposal. The location is fantastic, right in the centre of Passeig de Gracia, the main shopping street and very close to a train station. There is also a terrace cafe/bar and pool. The best thing is the service, which makes up for some of the small disadvantages. The doorman was always smiling, playing with the baby and would inquire about our day trips. The bellman carried 3 heavy suitcases for us all the way down the stairs of the nearest train station, waited while we bought tickets and then brought the bags to the door of the train itself! Service at the restaurant at the ground level was also very good. We were able to ask for foods not listed on the menu and it was served. The business centre has computer access for free for guests of the hotel. Reception were very helpful for concierge enquiries. Coming from Dubai, we are used to extra services at hotels but I can't think of one that can top the Majestic. 5 stars for their staff, location and value.

Reviews.Title: “Majestic is great!”
Reviews.Author: swcjlc1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Majestic after learning about it on TripAdvisor. It is an excellent hotel with great views from the rooftop pool area. It is centrally located and in proximity to great shopping, sight seeing and restauramts. We had a room on the eighth floor so there was little noise from the busy street below. The room itself was average size and the bath was on the small side. Although the hotel is very nice we felt it was a little too expensive for what you received. We definitely would consider staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “we loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: tracyk45
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed for five nights at the Majestic just last week. Our room was a junior suite and it was very large, well decorated and comfortable. The beds were wonderful and the sheets sooo soft and nice. The bathroom has a separate WC and shower which was great for two females who didn't want to share everything! We even used the entry way closet for clothes so didn't have to try to squeeze both wardrobes into the one in the bedroom. The location is wonderful, especially if you are a Gaudi fan as two masterpieces are within blocks. There are many very good restaurants within walking distance as well. The staff at the front desk are excellent!! The metro is close as is a very nice cafe for breakfast, since we did not have that included in our room charge. Also free use of computers and Internet in the business center, though wireless for the iPad cost extra (so we didn't use it). Definitely some place I would return to on my next trip! (The downside for us was Drolma, which we did not really enjoy on our last night, and for which we paid a lot!)

Reviews.Title: “very nice and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: zoeloeAalter
Reviews.Content: We were a little concerned to book this hotel regarding some of the rather disappointing reviews. Booked it anyway because of promotion (3 nights for price of two for parents and child 13 y). Hotel is very well located at passeig de Gracia, metro is a few steps from entrance. There is even a train stop in that metro station, so you can reach the hotel from airport with train and only have to walk a few metres with luggage. We had a large classic room, very clean. The extra bed for our son was good and firm (which can be a problem in some hotels). The room had no special view (along small street) but had good sound-isolated, so sleeping was no problem at all. For the anniversary of our son, we received a nice surprise in the room after a long day of sightseeing: strawberry's dipped in chocolate and a bottle of cava. Breakfast was good and with lots of choice. As it was not our first time in Barcelona (super city) and we know how to go around, we did not need any service from reception. The pool and terrace on top are rather small but very clean and nice with great view over the city. One minor point: in that periode (half may) pool was not heated and it should be. Overall we were happy with this hotel and the football game Barcelona/valladolid (title game for FCB) made our trip perfect. We would book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location!”
Reviews.Author: sheyingermany
Reviews.Content: The location was great - in the heart of everything! The room and service was what would be expected from a 5 star. The bathrooms were large with two WC areas - marble floors, etc. The bed was big and the sheets were incredible - I could have slept for hours. The breakfast was really good with a great choice of local produce, fresh fruits and baked breads.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury boutique hotel with exceptional service in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: fmtrv
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the first week of September in 2009 with my two small children (ages 3 and 1) and my husband. We used to live in Catalayuna and had never heard of the Majestic so I was a little anxious, but now I can't imagine staying anywhere else. I had reserved two rooms and called ahead to make sure they were adjoining. Even though there are very few such configurations in the hotel, I explained the situation with the children and they made sure that we had what we needed. The rooms were tiny but had stunning views of the Sagrada Familia and as we had paid a very reasonable rate and had two rooms, I was pleasantly surprised. We were starving, and luckily there is 24 hour room service. We ordered and they brought out some incredible food along with chocolate milk for the kids. They brought up a beautiful crib for the baby complete with luxury linens and a toiletry kit with baby shampoo and sponges. The bellmen were great and there was easy parking. The following morning we realized we could walk to EVERYTHING--Gaudi houses, La Rambla, shops, cafes, etc. And the splash pool on the rooftop was just pefect for the kids. Front desk staff was helpful and courteous--let us have a late checkout and then helped us with the car--location was superb and hotel was nice and quiet. We have stayed at the Arts and Le Meridien before, but honestly, there is no better location in Barcelona than the Majestic.

Reviews.Title: “No Longer Majestic”
Reviews.Author: spencerusa
Reviews.Content: On paper, this is a five star hotel but it is teetering on the edge. The one standout feature of this hotel is the front-of-house staff. Many have been working at the hotel for years, their pride in the hotel is evident and they know everything there is to know about Madrid. Too bad that the owners of the hotel are not backing their employees up by reinvesting in the facilities. After accessing your floor via an undersized elevator (a common European problem), you will find the need to take several steps up and then several steps down en route to your room. Each floor has the feel of a rabbit warren. Once in your room, you will be pleasantly surprised by the sound insulation.that is a real plus and often a mark of an old hotel. Howver, when you expect a queen bed and you find two twin beds pushed together, it is all rather an old joke. The food offerings in the minibar were inadequate and no complimentary water was provided. The bathroom was reasonably spacious but, unfortunately, there was no stand-up shower, just the plain old bathtub. Whatever its name and hoiwever many stars are on the lobby wall, this is no longer a five star hotel. Breakfast is served in a nondescript downstairs restaurant. The buffet is adequate but nothing special. On my most recent visit, I received the wordt capuccino that I can remember, poisonously bitter coffee topped with a non-existent froth. No English language newapapers on offer either.

Reviews.Title: “Lack of fresh air in the room”
Reviews.Author: webster1000
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had booked some weeks in advance and spent 5 nights in room 435 commencing 1 May 2010. Unfortunately our stay was spoiled by one factor. We prefer plenty of cool air in our room at night. During this period there were two quite cold and rainy days in Barcelona.
