The air conditioner in the room was set to maximum air flow and minimum temperature throughout our stay. However, the airflow on the hot days was pitiful and it reduced to zero on the two cold days. I approached the front reception managers twice and was told on the second occasion that the air conditioning system was switched off completely because the temperature outside was cool. There was NO airflow available from the system - not even fresh air from outside. In fairness the double glazed windows could be opened but this was impractical for two reasons: 1) the noise from the street below was very loud with the window open and it continued all night; 2) each part of the double glazed windows opened separately and awkwardly, with no way of setting the opening or stopping the two frames from bumping into one other. It is obviously not expected that guests should open the windows. At the price one would expect to be able to set air flow volume and temperature all year round. On the other hand, the Majestic is fantastic for location (150 metres to a Metro and 10 minutes easy walk to La Rambla) and comfortable in most other respects. So, if you don't mind stale air in your room overnight, it is a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, above expectations!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoDavidO
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Majestic for a long weekend with some friends. As requested we all stayed on the same floor. The hotel was very very, well located, classic decorated rooms, well appointed with all amenities as you'd expect. The terrace on top of the hotel was nice, nice cocktails but a little expensive as you would expect for a 5 star hotel, but still very nice. It was the staff who made all the difference for our weekend, nothing was ever too much trouble and all requests met with a smile - very refreshing for European hotels! The rooms were not the cheapest, but I felt we got reasonably good value considering we had booked a package with dinner at the Drolma a great culinary experience. Would recommend this hotel if it's your first trip to Barcelona as it's nicely located in the middle of Paaseo d Gracia.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, but nothing special!”
Reviews.Author: atherir
Reviews.Content: I paid the rock bottom "early bird" price for the room, and was a little concerned that we would end up in a broom cupboard somewhere, so I was pleasantly surprised at the size of the room. We had plenty of space and a small seating area. The room decor was fairly plain, and certainly didn't suggest 5 star standards as there was nothing terribly luxurious about it. All was fine, but nothing stood out, and the room facilities were just the norm of a good (not great) hotel. The bed was pretty hard, and the doors must be really thin, because we could clearly hear any noise that passed by our room. The thing that struck me the most was the fact that the service was no where near 5 star standards. The staff at the front desk and in the bar weren't rude as such, just completely indifferent and made little effort. I'd go as far as to say that they were a little snotty. The staff need to show service that reflects the prices the hotel charges, otherwise all you're paying for is mediocrity! The door staff and porters, however, were really lovely. The location is fabulous, and whilst there isn't a great deal to complain about at this hotel, there is nothing fantastic either. I'll try somewhere else when we return to Barca.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: O2BCyrus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Majestic one night before moving to Hotel Murmuri (change in travel plans/reservations meant we had to split hotels). Majestic was fine, though rooms were not as spacious at the Hotel Murmuri and our "upgraded" hotel overlooked an adjacent fire escape in an alley. Bed was comfortable and room was clean, though small. Staff was very nice and helpful. Location was superb! Located right by Le Pedrera (Casa Mila) and Casa Batllo, as well as lots of upscale clothing and jewelry stores, fun restaurants, etc. Diagonal Metro is right across Passeig de Gracia from Diagonal Metro, which is very convenient. The tourist bus stops 1 block away.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great value 5 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: RanAustralia
Reviews.Content: You couldnt ask for more from this 5 star luxury hotel.Its position is perfect with a 5 minute walk to the Ramblas and Placa Catalunya. The rooms are big for European standards.Its great value for what you pay. The staff are very helpful. We were in room 723 (7th fllor facing the main street and wow what a view!. We were initially concerned re the potential noise level but were happy to see that the rooms are double windowed so no noice comes through!Both windows can be opened and sitting on the balcony is divine.Without a dought would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent”
Reviews.Author: Dilbert61
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at this Hotel no matter the reason for my trip (Business lo Leisure). This time we stayed for two nights and as usually we enjoyed our stay. The staff, the premises, the room, the food, everything is superb. I recommend without hesitation this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Luxe?”
Reviews.Author: Broadslord
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Majestic for 2 nights 11th & 12th March. We were upgraded to a mini suite which was much appreciated so did not see a normal room. The room itself was very comfortable with a great view of the main street and although quiet with both windows closed, as we like having a window open at night this was impossible for the traffic noise. However, there is of course the A/C but it was too cold for that. I couldn't believe that in an international hotel, there was no English speaking channels on the TV. Only when I asked reception they told me that I had to press another button to obtain English, but no one bothered to tell me this before. The reception/concierge were all helpful and spoke excellent English, but the rest of the staff did not. In fact, I don't think they really want to speak English. We asked for a hot chocolate in the bar and what came can only be descibed as Chocolate sauce. It was exactly what you would get on chocolate cake or profiteroles. Far too thick and sweet. I asked for some hot milk to go with it which they charged for and only when half the contents had been porured away was it mildly drinkable. The restaurant downstairs leaves a lot to be desired as far as ambience and decor is concerned. It's all OK for breakfast but definitely not for an evening meal. The portions although tasty, are very small. As for breakfast, as with all hotels these days, there is a buffet where one serves themselves. The only thing the staff has to do is serve tea and coffee but as ususal they're more interested in getting your room number and having private chats amongst themselves. They really didn't make you feel welcome. Not a smile was seen on any of their faces. All in all, it's a good hotel but not excellent and I don't really think it deserves 5 Star Luxe, I have stayed in far better 5 star luxe hotels at cheaper prices. Would I return? Probably purely for its location but then the Mandarin Oriental is just down the street. Would I recommend this hotel to friends? I would say that it's a choice between the Majestic and the Mandarin Oriental.

Reviews.Title: “Please read our important detailed review below ! This is a part of my letter to the managment. AVOID AT ALL COSTS!”
Reviews.Author: PUBLUNCH
Reviews.Content: On Sunday March 7th 2010, Me and my fiancée booked into what we thought was a very stylish and elegant hotel We were checked into room number 247. Then arose our first problem. The flatscreen television would not work. I immediately contacted the front reception who promptly sent an engineer up to investigate, he wiggled the wire about and it started working, BUT, then it was temperamental and I had to fix the cable another FIVE TIMES to get a clear picture. I am an avid football supporter and there was an important game in progress, therfore I was obviously not very happy. We proceeeded to go to La Ramblas, on reception we were advised to ''get a taxi'' this cost me 6 Euros (why wasn't i informed that La Ramblas was only a five minute walk away. This brings me to my second complaint/problem. The following morning (Monday March 8th 2010) we were woken at approximately 0900 hours, by very loud banging, what sounded like building work on the room above. (my fiancee was asleep and feeling unwell) looking to have a nice relaxing morning to get over the flight and the night before, only to be woken by this very loud banging, which went on for approximately one hour. Until at this point, I went to the front reception and complained. At this point I was informed that we could be re-located to the sixth floor to room number 628. Obviously, without even thinking about it, I accepted straight away. Then, we were dissapointed to find the resulting room was smaller and the bathroom was a lot smaller and not as nice as our previous room! (But at least the TV worked) Just when we thought things were getting better, exactly the same thing happened the following morning. Building work started at approximately 0900 hours. A banging (not as violently loud as the previous night) but still an audiable banging noise. So I went to the front reception to ask what was going on, to be told ''Maintenance work''. As we were quite fed up by now, we had a day out in BCN. As we had everything as we wanted it (in the room) I left a hanger on the door handle which read 'do not disturb/no need to clean room'. We arrived back on the night (Tuesday March 9th 2010) only to find that all our belongings had been re-arranged, with that thing you put on our bed EVERY NIGHT to pressure people into purchasing your very over priced breakfast. So my Fiancee went looking for her beloved night gown, we searched high and low for her night dress. Literally turned the room upside down. She was very, very upset. Low and behold, I went to the front reception to ask what the cleaner had done with her night gown. To be told that that our bed sheets were now with a '3rd party' company, therefore, there wasn't anyone could do about it!! Due to the fact that our flight departing in the early hours of Wednesday morning, I decided enough was enough and went to console my very upset fiancee. To evaluate what I have explained above. I am deeply upset in the attitude your staff have at HOTEL MAJESTIC. I am disappointed with how we have been treated (in a so called five star hotel) and it is ashame the HOTEL MAJESTIC is there to let such a lovely, wonderful city like Barcelona down. STAY AT YOUR PERIL!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was fine, location not our favorite”
Reviews.Author: DiverDown74
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a week at the Majestic in Barcelona. It was between that and Hotel 1898. Majestic won because it looked like it had a nicer gym, other reviews said the location was great, the roof bar looked great, and it sounded like the sauna/steam room were included. The verdict? It was OK. But we really wish we would have stayed at 1898 instead. Room: Decent. Smaller than rooms than in the U.S., but not bad...but should be bigger for the price. We had a standard room, which faced the back of the hotel. Bathroom had a hair dryer (i think?), a bidet, nice size tub with shower...but there was always a stench like the sewage had backed up. Nothing else really to say about the room. Bar/Restaurants: We only had coffee at the bar, and everything was twice as expensive as anywhere else you could go. Breakfast started at 23 euro/person for a very basic breakfast. Ridiculous. And, the roof bar was never open. Pretty views, but nobody was there. and the weather was too cool to use the pool. Gym: a few treadmills, a recumbent bike, upright bike, elliptical, dumb bells and a multipurpose weight machine. there were two plasma t.v.'s to watch. There was a men's and women's bathroom connected, each with a shower. The big disappointment was that I thought the sauna and steam room were connected to the gym. I looked everywhere online to figure that out, and couldn't. Spa: it never said on the website, and some reviews said they were complimentary, but you had to pay for the sauna and steam room. It was 15 euros for 30 minutes. and you had to reserve a time because it's private. there's a steam room, sauna, hot/cold stream programmable shower and a regular shower. no bathrooms, though...strange. We used this "5 star hydrotherapy" room after a massage. Wasn't anything too special, though. My massage was great...the wife's was not. Hotel 1898's spa area looked awesome, and it was complimentary. Location: the hotel is right in the middle of the high-end shopping district, which we could care less about. We wanted to experience some Barcelona culture. Everything is in walking distance if you have the time...but getting to La Rambla takes about 15-20 minutes. There are a couple of Gaudi builings a block away, which were nice to see. And lots of restaurants and cafes. But the restaurants and cafes near La Rambla were always much cheaper, the stores more authentic...and La Rambla had local artisans selling their wares (jewelry, art, food), and La Boqueria Mercat (Market) is on La Rambla and is great. Lots of fresh fruit, fish, chocolate...and a few places to sit down for a meal. We also could walk to Sagrada Familia from the hotel in a reasonable amount of time. But we took the metro up to Gaudi's Parc Guell. The metro from the airport drops you off less than a block from the hotel, which was great. We couldn't go to the airport on the metro since it doesn't start running until 5:30am and we had an earlier flight so had to take a cab for 31 euro. If you want to see the beach, it's nice - huge waves. Don't think it's a nude beach, but a guy sat down near us and dropped trou. it's a good 15 minute walk south of La Rambla Nearby restaurants: a block or two south have a couple of cafes where we had breakfast most mornings - usually 2 cafes con leche and a pastry or sandwhich...for about 5 euros. There's a great restaurant a couple of blocks away - Cerverceria Catalana: excellent tapas and cheap bottles of wine. Another one, Ciudad Condal, is just south of it, but is almost identical...just a little more expensive. just walk around and look at menus and prices to see what you want. we tried a different one every lunc and dinner...except certain lunches where we just bought a bocadillo (sandwich) and smoothie from the market. I have a lot more i could write about what not/to do, where not/to go...but i'll stop for now. Bottom line: you won't be disappointed staying here...but if you're looking for more authentic interaction with Barcelona, and nearby more than just shopping, look for places a little more south, on or near La Rambla and south of Placa Catalunya. Given that, the day before we left, the President of Portugal walked in while we were in the lobby...guess it's good enough for him!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but smell of smoking throughout the hotel was bad!”
Reviews.Author: dickstone
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel but like many Spanish hotels, still allow smoking on certain floors(1&2). I was on the 4 th floor and was litterally invaded by the smell of cigarette smoke. Couldn't figure out if it was on my floor, but you could defininely smell it. Having said this, rooms are nice but a bit pricy. Breafast at 25 euros is pushing it a bit...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: funkydread
Reviews.Content: Hotel Majestic is located right near La Rambla and it was so much fun to step out of the hotel and go walking/shopping up and down the street. Breakfast was included and the buffet was out of the world each and every morning! The rooms were very clean and the hotel itself is of 4 star quality, even though they say it's 5 star. The service was a little on the poor side but I would still stay there again......maybe it was the language barrier. Barcelona is one of my favorite European cities!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Anjanast
Reviews.Content: Perfect Location. We had a Suite so not sure about other Rooms. Very Helpful Staff. Only Problem is Dolma ( fine Dining Restaurant ) did not have any Veg Options But I would Stay here again on my next trip to Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Luxe hotel, but some of the staff and amenities were lacking.”
Reviews.Author: elliemodro
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, right in the heart of the Eixample. They bill themselves as catering to their guests, but I found that the front desk personnel were a bit on the unhelpful side. Snooty, impatient, reluctant to help out a visitor who is asking for assistance. The bell staff were friendlier and more helpful than the concierge and front desk, so I went for them for advice on a good tapas place, which they gave and it was wonderful. One thing you need to know that the front desk did not tell me, is that you can get free wifi in the business center downstairs, complementary with your stay, but if you get it in your room, you get charged A LOT (hourly or every 24 hours). I'd paid for wifi for two days before someone told me it was free in the center. I stayed in many hotels in more remote places than Barcelona, and all of them offered free wifi in the room. Every little thing cost extra here, and by extra, I mean EXTRA. With the exchange rate, it was pretty high. It was a nice hotel, but I would try a different hotel on my next visit. The service was definitely lacking.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Upscale Corporate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveller000
Reviews.Content: I have been in many hotels in Barcelona but I had never given a try to the Majestic Hotel and I have to say that I made the best choice. The location of the hotel is just unbeatable and for a business traveller the hotel represents the perfect mix that guarantees a comfortable stay at a good value for money. The rooms are very well sound proofed helping you to relax. The wifi connection works smoothly, and the staff are really friendly and with a lot of local knowledge. Did'nt have time to use the new spa but I did use the new gym every day free of charge. I was nicely surprised to see that also a grand hotel like the Majestic is a great accommodation option for business purposes. I'll come back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: Viatgerdelondon
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in central Barcelona to bring your VIP customers, amazing service and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Classic hotel, great service, AMAZING location”
Reviews.Author: munrom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 10 nights at the Majectic over Christmas and New Years this year, and it was just perfect. The location could not have been better! Just 5-6 blocks from Barcelona's central square, and the same distance to the Sagrada Famillia, on a beautiful main throughway, lined with restaurants, cafes, and upscale stores. There are fantastic local dominated tapas bars just around the corner (Tapa 24 is a MUST). Oh, and the views of the city from the rooftop deck/bar were the best we saw. The rooms are smallish, but we had one with a balcony with a great view of the streetlife. They were cleaned twice a day, which was amazing when you're back and forth on vacation. The bathrooms are modern...in all, very comfortable. And the staff were fantastic! Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “great location, AWFUL hotel”
Reviews.Author: honeymoonhelp11
Reviews.Content: The beds were awful and our hotel room was hideous! I could hear everything in the hallways and was absolutely devastated when I walked in and saw our room. It totally put a dent in our stay. The location is perfect, but I absolutely would not stay here-- if you want this location stay at Casa Fuster. The bathrooms were a joke and the staff (minus the doorman) were unhelpful.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, sophisticated and maintained privacy”
Reviews.Author: Tessa080
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very large and it was pretty full however you really did not notice. My husband and I were concerned after we read that cruise ship guests typically stay here. However, the hotel was able to maintain a quiet and calm atmosphere. The small rooftop bar and pool never felt overcrowded and always offered some peace after a day out in Barcelona. Would absolutely stay here again when in Barcelona. The staff was professional and gracious.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TorontoSmokey
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Hotel Majestic in Barcelona prior to our transatlantic cruise. The hotel and our suite were superb. From the moment we arrived at the hotel, every staff member we met were gracious, helpful and very professional - from the bellhops on arrival, to the restaurant, front desk and service staff - no exceptions. The hotel restaurants were excellent. The location was central, it was very easy to get around to various areas of the city, whether you walked, took the subway or a taxi. There was also excellent shopping and other great restaurants and tapas bars in the area. Barcelona is a beautiful city and if we are fortunate enough to visit it again we would definately stay at the Majestic Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Barcelona.....Majestic!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Joste_Inc
Reviews.Content: My wife and i went to Barcelona in late Sept '09 for our honeymoon (having taken our kids with us on a "family" honeymoon, to the Canary Islands, straight after our wedding ) We specifically chose the Majestic for its location and for the superb deal they were offering at the time. As it was our Honeymoon and the first time we had been to Barcelona, i wanted to make the trip momentous - a truly wonderful experience we would treasure for years to come...hopefully for the rest of our lives together! With this in mind - i contacted the Head of Reservations at the Majestic a few weeks in advance - explaining our circumstances - and asked that the Hotel would hopefully help me in my wish to make the Honeymoon a memorable experience. On our arrival we discovered we had booked into the Catalonian capital, quite by accident, at one of the busiest times of the year with La Merce festival running all week. As we checked in, i spoke to Emilio (concierge) and told him i had been in contact with the hotel prior to our arrival....disappointingly, he informed me that our room was not ready - and asked if we would mind waiting in the bar area while our reservation was completed - there we were treated to a complimentary coffee. A short while later, Emilio re-appeared to show us to our room. To our absolute delight he took us to an up-graded suite, with a balcony view over Paseo Gracia (one of the liveliest and best shopping streets) and informed us that our stay had also been up-graded from Room-only to Bed and Champagne Breakfast for the duration of our stay . A short time later, room service delivered fresh flowers, fresh strawberries dipped in chocolate, and complimentary bottle of vintage champagne. To say we were taken aback was an understatement! From first setting foot in the opulent foyer to finally checking out of the Majestic Hotel - i can only say, we were treated like royalty. The staff were courteous, pleasant, helpful and diligent through-out....the restaurant waiting-staff were superb (including maitre d) and the servicing and cleaning of our room was exceptional. The concierge (as already mentioned) went out of his way to liaise with us through-out our stay - and any request was met with smiles and a positive attitude which we were extremely impressed with; then promptly satisfied by the staff. The location of the Hotel Majestic is good (metro and bus-stops directly outside), the decor and surroundings were sumptuous and to find fault anywhere would be churlish in the extreme. As for Barcelona - my wife and i were totally enthralled by the beauty, vivacity, colour, spectacle and friendliness of the place. I would have no hesitation whatsoever in recommending the Majestic to a friend, nor would i have any hesitation in returning again. And (while i appreciate that our romantic interlude may have coloured the impression of our stay slightly) we intend to do just that - return again! Thank you to all the management and staff at Majestic for all you did for us!

Reviews.Title: “La Viva Majestic”
Reviews.Author: gillygreene
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a junior suite, with a huge marble bath, the suite was absolutely spotless. The towels were lovely and fluffy, the toiletries supplied were superb. Check in was smooth and friendly, and we were addressed by our names. A must is drinks on the roof top terrace, the views are magnificent. I see other reviewers had complained about the price, but this is a five star hotel with 5 star service. You get what you pay for in this world! If you want cheap, you get cheap! Location of the hotel could not be beaten, close to all the shops, and many of the tourist attractions. There really is a touch of class about this hotel. Highly recommended if you are not on a strict budget and like to splurge occasionally.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: C4times3
Reviews.Content: Location was perfect, but the room (junior suite) was only very nice and could use a little updating. Staff was efficient but not especially welcoming. For some bizarre reason, they close the business center at 11PM and no one could tell me why.

Reviews.Title: “Would never return”
Reviews.Author: Beccic
Reviews.Content: I have recently just returned from a two night stay with my partner to the Hotel Majestic in Barcelona. I found that the location and the hotel itself was amazing but the service within the hotel was poor. The staff on reception were very rude with us, especially to my partner. Nobody hardly spoke english so the language barrier became frustrating. The location was excellent as we were located right next to lots of shops such as Gucci etc. However visiting restaurants became hard work as the waiters didnt speak any english. I wouldnt recommend this hotel to anybody who isnt spanish as you will just be treated completely different to those who are. We paid £600 for two nights at this hotel and knew within the first few hours we would not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Holmegate
Reviews.Content: Just spent two nights in a triple room booked via venere.com. Having visited Barcelona many times I knew that the Majestic had a prime location on a very safe street. We checked in very quickly and had our luggage taken to our room by a very polite and helpful member of staff. He explained all about the hotel and the amenities in our room. We had a spacious, clean room with double bed and extra roll out bed. I had the roll out which was pleasantly comfortable. The room had the usual facilities ... tv, mini bar, hairdryer, safe etc. We didn't eat in the hotel although the menu did look very good. The view from the rooftop is amazing and I'm sure the pool would be very inviting in the warmer months. Turn down service was appreciated with lovely chocolates left on our pillows. My only criticism was the noise from other rooms, both sides and from above. I have not experienced this problem in other five star hotels. All in all the Majestic is a lovely hotel in an excellent location. I still prefer the Arts but would be more than happy to stay at the Majestic again.

Reviews.Title: “Majestic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amy052
Reviews.Content: Very good location for business or leisure travels... Good hotel overall...

Reviews.Title: “Get a good room”
Reviews.Author: paulhempstock
Reviews.Content: While waiting for the lift I noticed from the floor-plan that all the rooms are very different sizes. My room (514) was absolutely tiny, with no room for a desk to work at and a window looking onto a concrete wall. If I had been there for longer than one night I would have complained - it was more like a 2-star room than a 5-star. The location was good and the catering for our meeting was fine. The rooftop bar is nice but the swimming pool is tiny. They charge you for internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JMBHA
Reviews.Content: We stayed with several collegues in the Majestic Hotel in Barcelona for 5 days, 4 nights. I have never seen such clean rooms. The hotel is located in the center of Barcelona. Only the beach is to far to walk. However the taxi rates are very reasonable. Breakfast and lunch is excellent. We havend used dinner at the Hotel. Service is perfect. All of the personel is very friendly and service minded. I can recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “RESERVATION NOT HONORED- DUPLICATE CHARGES”
Reviews.Author: Anitajane75
Reviews.Content: After all day travel and touring, checked into the Majestic Sept 19th for 3 nights. At check-in we asked about the buffet breakfast which was included with the Privilege room which our TA had reserved.. This room included a separate living area and views of the magnificent street below. We were told by the desk clerk/concierge in a condescending tone that we had received a very low rate and breakfast was not included. I insisted that it was included and he finally told us he wanted to satisfy us and we could have breakfast in the hotel the next morning. We finally got to our room and saw that it was not as booked. It was definitely a DOWNGRADE. The exterior view from the one small window was of rooftops, the bathroom was tiny-barely big enough for one person to turn around and there was no separate living area. But we were tired and decided not to make waves.(This was a mistake on our part) The breakfast was nice and the bell men friendly. On check-out our problems continued. We had requested express check-out but when no bill arrived the morning of our departure, we went down to check out. The desk clerk ran our credit cards through the system 8 times because she said that .the read-out read "busy". We left without completing the check-out. Upon arriving home, we found that all eight charges had gone through. Our TA was horrified when we told him what had happened and was instrumental in getting the charges abated. He said that he was taking the hotel off of his preferred list. We have sent the hotel 3 e-mails and so far have not had the courtesy of a response. We believe that we are due an explanation and personal letter of apology from the hotel regarding the "screw-up" in rooms and the fiasco with the credit cards. Oh yes, we were charged 46.73 euros for the breakfast that the concierge said there would be no charge for. This is hardly what we expected from a purportedly five star hotel and would only recommend this hotel to our worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at strategic location among superb restaurants”
Reviews.Author: Oialt65
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel for 5 days. A warm welcome by attentive personnel, a clean and comfortable room made me feel immediately at home. Within walking distance are top restaurants and beautifull high-end shops. I can recommend this hotel to everyone who can afford it and has the ability to appreciate class.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive location on upscale shopping street, but bland room not 5 *”
Reviews.Author: AZLizzy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful, especially on the outside, and is in a great upscale shopping location.. GREAT roof top terrace (the drinks were NOT that expensive, esp for a 5 star hotel, as several reviewers on this site reported, especially considering the incredible view for getting great pictures of the city). Several famous Gaudi buildings just a block away, as well as plenty of little bars and restarants to walk to. Elegant, classy feel in the small lobby area. Double-decker city tour bus stops just a block away is convenient and the BEST WAY to see the city sites. The room COULD have been a little more luxurious - was more of the simple "minimalist" design, but still comfortable. Maybe we got one of the "bottom-level" rooms because we got a GREAT PRICE on easyclick travel.com. Major bummer was that the front desk clerk said he did NOT have a room available for us at noon when we arrived in from the USA (after seventeen hours of flying and layovers) and told us to return at the "official"check-in time of 3pm! Hard to believe that not a single room in our category (or perhaps an upgraded category) was ready. They held our luggage, but since the lobby was almost non-existant (no sofas or spacious private area to relax on), we were forced to then wander around the shopping area extremely tired and jetlagged. We grabbed a light lunch and forced ourselves to stay awake. We decided to stop back at the hotel an hour later with the hopes that a room was ready. A different front desk clerk was there, and she said a room was ready! We thought it was kind of rude for the other clerk to tell us to come back at 3pm rather than encourage us to check back in a while. Other than that, great value for $180 a night!!

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: lizzydec8
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Right in the heart of the city. The rooftop bar and pool was great, we even had a firework show we could see from the rooftop.

Reviews.Title: “The Majestic Hotel is in a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: nadomomm
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Majestic Barcelona. The staff was friendly, the rooms were not large but very comfortable. We loved the location. The subway was very close and easy to get to. Many Gaudi buildings close by. The rooftop bar and pool were a great place to hang out with friends.

Reviews.Title: “We had a very nice stay in a client en service oriented hotel in a beautifull city”
Reviews.Author: santosroermond
Reviews.Content: We stayed with a group of 14 people in Majestic for 6 days. The management and staff is very client oriented and we felt at home in this beautifull hotel and in the city. Every wish we had was full filled with a smile and we had a great time. A special adventure is dining in the star restaurant in the Majestic

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: Jamerson
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and were very disappointed by the entire experience. Our first night was in a mold filled room (black on the edge of the carpet all around the baseboards) on the 8th floor. It had no windows, only 2 small portals on the sloped ceiling. The entire night, doors slammed shut as workers entered and left the service room (labled as office) next to us. After nicely requesting a room without mold and removed from a service "office" we were moved without question to a room on the 6th floor. The bed was made of 2 singles pushed together without a bridging device. This room was more on the level of a worn suburban Marriott. Stained carpet, mold in the tile grout, scuffed walls, etc but it had a window. The same door slamming noise (and I mean enough to wake you from a sound sleep) was experienced but I believe this is due to the cheap hinges - that means any door closing near your room will result in a loud booming sound. We did not get much rest at all the entire stay. The roof top pool was a joke. It's not a pool, its an oversized soaking tub that is in the middle of an outdoor bar/lounge. We saw families come up in their robes to use the pool only to realize they were in the midst of well dressed people having $18 evening cocktails. And the view.... was not that great. There are plenty of other places around town with better views and drinks at half the price. A great number of the hotel residence were people who were waiting on cruise ships so they were probably there as part of a package deal. My wife and I have stayed at several 5 star hotels around the world and this is no where near the level of Ritz or Four Seasons. We found a smaller NH hotel around the corner that was newly decorated, had excellent rooms and friendly, quiet service for a quarter of the price of the Majestic. The Majestic needs to re-invest some of their revenue into their facilities, their staff and their attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable if a little pricey!”
Reviews.Author: Rockape63
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two night stay at the Majestic on 2nd/3rd Oct travelling on an Easy Jet package. We found the hotel in a great location, were dealt with politely and shown to our Superior room, which was smart but not exceptional. We then made our way to the Chic Roof Terrace to watch the sun go down and were slightly shocked at a cost of 10 and 7 euros for a small glass of wine and a beer respectively. We decided not to bother with the pool as it was only slightly larger than the bath in our room! In the morning we used the Gym which was fine for a 45 min work out, returned to our room and then went out for breakfast to save some money. Overall, it was an enjoyable stay, but you did think twice about even having a coffee (4 euros) as it was an expensive experience to eat and drink in the hotel. With so many Cafes around it is not a problem to explore around and find something that better suits your budget. By moving slightly off the main streets you can cut your food/drinks bill by 50% easily!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience from start to finish!”
Reviews.Author: woodyxkent
Reviews.Content: Returned yesterday after 3 nights stay at Majestic to celebrate our silver anniversay and we were so pleased that we chose the Majestic even after some of the negative reviews. On arrival we were upgraded from our junior suite to a fab suite on 6th floor with two balconies with superb views of Barcelona! The buffet breakfast was of a very high standard with lots of choice and constantly replenished by staff who were very courteous throughout our stay. The roof top pool area was really pleasant with great views and brilliant service again. On our second evening we were delighted to discover a bottle of bubbly,choc covered strawberries and special anniversary cake in our suite which was a wonderful surprise. The location is the best with everything close by especially the designer shops much to my hubbys dismay!! We got a 2 day ticket for the turistic open topped buses which had 3 different routes around the city and a jump on jump off system which was perfect for seeing the sights we chose. Obviously the only downfall is the value of the pound to euro at the moment so everything is quite pricey although if you look around many cafe/restaurants offer some great deals on tapas and drinks. We hope to visit Barcelona again in the future as there is still so much more to see and I would hope we could stay at the Majestic again money permitting!

Reviews.Title: “BAD ATTITUDE....too full of themselves”
Reviews.Author: LuLuLevine
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Majestic in Barcelona in august. Restaurant mobbed with pre and post cruises packages.....had to wait on line for breakfast....staff overtaxed and very blase....could care less about the clientelle.....checked into our junior suite, and large upgrade and had additional room for our son...someone had smoked a cigar in our room, the front desk could have cared less and claimed there were no other rooms in this 300 + room hotel...i understand that they are losing a star, and they should lose two...the rooms are nice and renovated and the location is good, but the service and attitude stinks and that makes a big difference when you are away from home....i would never stay here again....sorry we didn't stay at the ritz carlton artes hotel, for the same dollars.

Reviews.Title: “stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: bluenose777
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in an upmarket area a few minutes walk away from two famous gaudi buildings la pedrera and casa batllo. 10 minuites walk is away is Plaça Catalunya and the start of Las Ramblas. The hotel itself is very comfortable and clean and the staff are very helpful and friendly. There was a wide selection to choose from at breakfast and it was all done to a high standard. Overall i would say this hotel has all the charm and class you could wish for to make the most out of your trip to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “As good as ever”
Reviews.Author: LS2
Reviews.Content: Our return trip to the Majestic fully lived up to the standards previously set. We arrived early (9.00am) and our room was available immediately. Service was faultless and the room spacious and clean. On check out we were able to keep our room until mid afternoon without charge and our luggage was stored after that. We hope to get back to Barcelona next year and will certainly plan to stay at the Majestic again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Choice”
Reviews.Author: LoriHouston
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 5 day stay at your hotel. The room was spacious, well appointed and quiet. Our children were graciously accomodated. The couch was folded out and travel crib in room when we arrived. Housekeeping was good and the housekeepers were so nice when we passed in the hall. Breakfast buffet was really good. Concierge was a great help guiding us to a close by tapas bar that was both excellent and reasonable. Location of the Majestic Hotel is perfect, central proximity and 1 block from metro. We would stay with you again in Barcelona and recommend to others as well. Also, received email guidance on which car rental location was close to hotel, an easy walk.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Aluor
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews on the hotel before booking. We were concerned by the many allusions to tiny, dark and very run down rooms. However we had to book at Hotel Majestic because the other family we were traveling with really wanted this hotel. So we were pleasantly surprised!! First the location is absolutely perfect. In the best area, you just walk out of the hotel and you are in the center of all the action, be it to visit the city, for restaurant and bars or for shopping. Second, the check-in was very smooth. Our two non-smoking and connecting rooms were on the fifth floor. The furniture was not shabby as some of the reviewers had written. Room decor was smart and clean. Bathrooms were updated and quite nice. The only negative thing I can say is that the towels were not fluffy (smelled and felt more like those of a third or four star hotel than a 5 star establishment). Also, you can forget about the pool. It's really TINY and not very alluring!! The rooftop bar is however very nice for a drink before heading out into the Barcelona nightlife!! Third, Breakfast was included in our rate and was very decent. It was buffet style with a nice selection of breads, pastries, eggs, cold cuts, cheeses etc... Fourth, the restaurant recommendations provided by the concierge were fantastic. The bellman was extremely helpful and friendly. Would go back to this property again, mainly for its LOCATION, because it is clean and comfortable. But while it is rated 5 stars, one should not expect luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - 5* prices, but not 5* service”
Reviews.Author: Darth1977
Reviews.Content: We booked this late through Teletext, so maybe that's why we got a mediocre room and lukewarm service. I've stayed in 3* hotels in the UK of a similar standard. The location is superb and just a short walk from many attractions. From the outside, the building is very impressive. The room was clean and had a nice bathroom. The staff were courteous, but not friendly or helpful. The mini bar and other services were extortionate (in my opinion). It's probably great if you have loads of money and can afford a luxury suite and the Michelin Star restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Caveat Emptor!”
Reviews.Author: luvtraveling1950
Reviews.Content: Got a great price for what is supposed to be a five star hotel. Not exactly five stars. Needed to change rooms after one night because of overwhelming sewer smell in the bathroom. Given a smoking room despite asking for non-smoking. Given a double room after asking for twin room. Buffet breakfast featured powdered eggs. Location-terrific; cleanliness-terrific; service-average, at best; food-lousy; price-acceptable for what we got. If you stay, make sure you get a big discount because this doesn't appear to be five stars by American standards.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: barcelonabiker
Reviews.Content: We stayed in three hotels in Barcelona and this hotel was the best. It is in a great location near La Ramblas but not on La Ramblas. Good restauraunts, shopping, and near two Gaudi buildings. One block from metro station. Breakfast buffet was average or above. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. We reccomend Brown restaurant for Italian food 2 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “How did this hotel pass the 5 star test? 3 star rooms at best!!”
Reviews.Author: SydneyGunner
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with other reviewers in their assessment that this is "IT IS DEFINITELY NOT A 5 STAR HOTEL" Paying 550 Euros for a 2-day spa package I expected much more. The location was great but once we found the room, the disappointment began. The bedroom smelt of cigarettes (although we requested non smoking) and just about held two twin beds pushed together to make a double. There was barely enough room to walk around the bed. The room was very dark and the only 'view' from the window was of a wall, a few metres away. We complained about the room the next morning and the staff showed us the floor plan which showed that most of the rooms were of similar size!! They moved us to a marginally bigger room for the second night. The spa was lovely and the outside area which a 10 metre pool was very pleasant and the staff were friendly and accommodating but I can't believe that the facilities pass any 5 star tests. How this is a five star hotel, I will never know.

Reviews.Title: “A truly 'majestic' stay!!”
Reviews.Author: janyoung1954
Reviews.Content: Four of us travelled to Barcelona to stay at the Majestic. As we had 2 birthdays in the party we had upgraded to Junior Suites however on arrival we were upgraded to grand suites. They were enormous. Upon arrival in both rooms we had a bottle of Champagne and chocolate pears and pastries. The following day (the actual day of our birthdays) the hotel put a happy birthday cake in both rooms. A truly fabulous stay. Roof pool a bonus. Reception staff could not have been more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: georgianananina
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Majestic for 2 nights in late June. Found the location great, very safe and convenient. Room small but well epuipped. Reception staff seemed aloof but efficient. Rest of staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a five star hotel”
Reviews.Author: chobar
Reviews.Content: Hotel is centrally located and very close to Las Rambles we watched and when they ran a special we grabbed it . The breakfast is wonderful but very expensive if you don't have it included. The hotel was very clean and the staff very attentive. We loved our stay and would do it again!

Reviews.Title: “Majestic Hotel - Great location - Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: mparker
Reviews.Content: We booked a four night stay at the Majestic and found the service to be average to poor. After a one night stay, we decided to find a different hotel as the service here was not as we had thought it would be considering the cost. After the reviews on Tripadvisor, we thought we would give it a chance, however. The cost of the rooms are on the high side and what really was lacking was the lack of interest in getting us into a room on time, the size of the room, and the overall cost of the hotel stay. We booked a Superior room at a cost of $450. per night. There were three clerks at check-in and unfortunately, the one person that we had to deal with was very condescending, unhelpful, and inflexible. If you want internet access it will cost you $45. for the entire stay. If you take a shuttle service from the airport from this hotel, it will cost you at least $150. This hotel is situated on a busy street but with a lot of upscale shopping stores and central to other locations and close to Casa Mil.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star?!?! Definitely Not!!!”
Reviews.Author: BeachNut
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights - on May 17th and then again on May 22 - pre and post cruise. We chose this hotel based on it's 5 star rating and it's fabulous location. The hotel is located close to many tourist attractions, designer shops, and great restaurants. However, to echo many other travellers who have stayed at this hotel, IT IS DEFINITELY NOT A 5 STAR HOTEL by North American standards. Hotel rooms in Europe are know to be smaller than North American hotels, but when one pays $422 Canadian a night, one expects a lot. Unfortunately, our expectations were not met. What we paid for was the basic Classic room. Imagine what you'd have to pay to upgrade!!! Upon arrival the first night, we were shown to our room which barely held two twin beds pushed together to make a Queen, two end tables with lamps, a small desk (no dresser) and a small tv with only a few basic channels. There was barely enough room to walk around the bed, never mind space to put your suitcases. The attached marble bath was adequate but not 5 star material. It was equipped with a regular tub with rainshower showerhead, a very small wall enclosure but no shower curtain or glass door or wall. Inevitably, water would land on the marble floor making it slippery. The bathroom also contained a single marble sink, mirror and hair dryer - the toilet and bidet were in a small closet like area, separated from the rest of the bathroom by a sliding glass door. The view from the room was non-existent - it faced an exterior wall of another part of the building. When I complained that this room was not what I had asked for, I was promptly told that we had paid for a Classic (basic) room located at the back of the building and this room was an upgrade! Imagine what the Classic room must have been like! The room was also noisy. You could hear people walking and taking in the hallway, as well as the room above - not a restful place to sleep. The rooftop of the hotel held a bar where one could sit and have a drink as well as a small pool that was really too small for anyone to swim in...but the view was spectacular! A word of advice... if you are planning on staying at this hotel, don't eat or drink there. The hotel is located within walking distance of many wonderful restaurants that provide fabulous meals at a fraction of the cost that you would pay at the hotel. Imagine, basic breakfast for one ordered from Room Service was 32 Euro!! Our stay at this hotel was a major disappointment and I would not recommend it to anyone. Definitely not good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “loved the majestic”
Reviews.Author: raviessar
Reviews.Content: great location,good rooms,helpful staff,clean,swimming pool was lousy.

Reviews.Title: “you would want to come here again!”
Reviews.Author: scientist86
Reviews.Content: The size of the hotel is breathtaking! The interior was fab and the staff so classy!We got complementary champagne for no reason! I loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Five Star -NOT”
Reviews.Author: jfkDublinIreland
Reviews.Content: To rate this as a five star hotel does an ultimate disservice to all the other establishments who more than meet the Grade.The Double Superior Room needed to be navigated carefully in order not to bash into the other occupant-We asked to be moved to another room and were given a much more suitable space.Breakfast was served in a basement room which was cramped and busy. It reminded me of a cheap and cheerful cruise liner.One rather well endowed lady chose to present herself at the buffet sans foundation garments and fully dressed in pyjamas-DRESS CODE ?It completely turned me off my coco pops.! A phonecall to reception to order a taxi one evening was met with the curt response that we could hail one from outside the hotel.So much for customer relations. We found the staff at reception very cold and unfriendly so we engaged with them only when necessary. Water €6 for 200ml at the poolside bar.The glass should have been Waterford Crystal at that rate but unfortunately was plastic. I have stayed in much better three star hotels-The Majestic is sorely lacking in many essential areas-How do they manage to keep their Star Rating?

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly bare-bones”
Reviews.Author: barcatravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for six days in May, 2009, and while I had a great time in Barcelona, the hotel was not a high point of the trip. Everything is very clean, it is well kept up, and it is in a good location. However, what I realized is that you have to take everything with a grain of salt. There is a pool, but you can´t use it past 8pm. We have a room for two, but to make a queen they just pushed two singles together. There are some computers to use, but they are very old, they cost 24 euros to use, you cannot use them past 8:30pm, and only one person from a room can one {of a total four} at any time. These shut-off times are even earlier in a city where you stay up until 2am. The attitude I got from the staff was that they are trying to nickle and dime you at every step of the way. I do not mind paying for a pleasant stay, but I got a sense that the wool was being pulled over my eyes. For example, when I arrived I asked if breakfast was included. I was told that it was and thought nothing of it. Then, the next night I was told that it actually was not included, and that my account was being charged 46 euros. It was a great breakfast, but not worth 23 euros each. When I mentioned my confusion to the staff, they were far from sympathetic. I did not expect a refund, but I would have liked a little sympathy. Just keep in mind when you stay here that this sort of hotel operates by charging a lot for things that you might think would be included, like internet, breakfast, etc. If you plan on having anything more than a bare-bones stay, plan on spending another 75 to 100 euros on top of your reservation fee.

Reviews.Title: “Good. But not 5 star great.”
Reviews.Author: TheSubmariner
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 days at the hotel. Granted, we paid for a standard room but what others have echoed, it really is small and somewhat dated. The view of the car park from the windows werent pleasant either but no big deal for us anyway as we were out most of the day. The bathroom was average but not 5 star class. The real pros of the hotel was included breakfast which was excellent! The roof deck with the pool was a nice touch. If you can grab a hefty discount as we did when booking then the hotel is worth it otherwise do not pay or accept staying here anywhere near the rack rates - its just not worth it. No free wifi but they have a business centre where you can quickly check emails.

Reviews.Title: “great location but some rooms have issues ...”
Reviews.Author: fidelmaGalway
Reviews.Content: We checked in on May 21st 09. I was travelling with my friend and we had booked a "privilege" twin room. We were so disappointed with our room when we saw what can only be described as the "shabby" room we had just checked into. I could barely walk passed the end of the beds to get to the window - it was very small. When I did reach the window and turned to view the room - the marks on the walls really stood out - wear and tear but not what I expected from a 5 star hotel. There were no fab views from our window either. The bathroom was fine but not good enough to make up for the rest of the disappointment. I returned to reception where I met with complete surprise that there was anything wrong with my room but I explained this was not what I booked. As we had checked in late .. ie 10pm, there were no other rooms available on that evening but I was told by the reception staff they would do their best for me in the morning. Friday morning, we packed our bags and returned our keys to reception informing them tht we were off out for the day but our bags were packed and they could move them for us when they had a suitable room available. When we returned - we collected our new keys at reception and found ourselves with a much nicer and bigger room that somewhat represented what I had booked on-line. There were still some obvious black marks on the walls, but it was more acceptable in the bigger room. My advice would be to use the "additional info" section of the booking form - specify what your room type is .. underline it if possible. At no point did we receive an apology. Good points about hotel, great choice for breakfast, rooftop bar and pool, spa & spa staff. and LOCATION. This hotel is actually perfectly located for tours, restaurants, nightlife, shopping etc etc

Reviews.Title: “Romatic barcelona getaway”
Reviews.Author: AmyGallo
Reviews.Content: We were so glad we picked this hotel. Having never been to barcelona, we picked by searching the internet and reading reviews. We upgraded to the nicer room that included breakfast. The breakfast is definately worth it. I was more than mentioned on the internet with a variety of foods to pick from, eggs, fruit, breads, pancakes and even champagne. The only problem we has was at check in. Our room wasnt ready and when it was it was not what we expected. We complained and got a great room with the view we thought we paid for. Also, the airconditioning seemed to get turned down in the middle of the night but a call to the front desk fixed that. This hotel is in a great location, right in the middle of everthing. According to one of our friends that lives in barcelona, this hotel is known to be one of the nicest. Overall it exceeded my expectations

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: idletourist
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Majestic much more than the Casa Fuster that we also stayed in for a few nights. The location of the Majestic is excellent as other reviewers have mentioned. We also thought the roof-top bar area was nice by the standards of BCN where pools tend to be very small. Reception was also friendly and service quick. Being very close to the Passage de Gracia railway station makes it very convenient for the airport and trips to Figures / Girona / Stiges etc. Tapas 24 just around the corner from the hotel was buzzing with a good tourist / local mix and excellent (if a little pricey) tapas. Farga just up the road to Diagonal and turn left 100m is a great place to catch breakfast - they give you a sort of debit card and the eagle-eyed waiter spots the delicacies you help yourself to and they end up on the bill when you hand the card back at the end!

Reviews.Title: “Meeting Facilities is excellent”
Reviews.Author: Speedy20
Reviews.Content: The meeting facilities at this hotel is simple fantastic. the set up, food, audio/video system. The service and support of the hotel staff is strong & they are very pro-active in meeting the demands of the guest. I will recommend this hotel to companies who are looking for meeting venue.

Reviews.Title: “Best address in town, Superb location close to Las Ramblas, expensive”
Reviews.Author: dnya
Reviews.Content: Passeig de gracia is a lovely street with a lot of character the old and the modern architecture contrast, lively people walking on the street. The street has a lot of cool shops and designers such as Mandarina Duck. Hotel Majestic is opp Casa Battlo - a must visit when in Barcelona http://www.gaudiallgaudi.com/AA006.htm At walking distance is Las Ramblas and Casa Mila. The rooms are cosy and comfortable, service is impeccable. I loved the cleanliness. Hotel Majestic has a beautiful terrace with cosy seating where you can assemble in the evening and find great views of Barcelona's architecture. Being vegetarian, I found it difficult to have food at the hotel, even though the hotel staff did the best they could. I found a Mc Donald's, an ice cream shop on the same street a few blocks ahead and a vegetarian joint called Maoz at Las Ramblas. I was here on business so my company paid for the hotel. If you are backpacking.. hostel centric point actross the street will give you all this and basic rooms at about one tenth the price :-)

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: geoo
Reviews.Content: The Majestic is a good hotel but doesn´t quite make it to be a 5-star hotel. ***** Location - The Location is perfect. **** Staff - Most of the staff is really great, but there are always exceptions. **** Lobby - Small and vary when it comes to style. **** Rooms - Small (standard) and the placement of some furniture feels odd. Good size bathroom. **** Roof/Pool - Small pool, great views, nice bar. ***** Bar - Stylish bar where they play the grand piano. ? Restaurants - Never tried these. Had breakfast at a café close by. Would I stay there again? Yes I would. I can recommend two restaurants close to the hotel with good food at affordable prices. Taller de Tapas (only Tapas) and Mesón Cinco Jotas

Reviews.Title: “Everything we hoped for and more”
Reviews.Author: happyinafrica
Reviews.Content: After an exhausting 20 hours of traveling we arrived at the Majestic Hotel and were greeted by the doorman and very friendly and bilingual staff at the front desk. We quickly checked in and were escorted to our lovely and spacious room (spacious by European standards). The beds were very comfortable and even though the hotel is located on a busy street we couldn't hear a thing. Hotel is right in the middle of high end shopping (Chanel and Burberry close by) but the medium range mall is within walking distance. The location couldn't have been more centrally located for our needs. We walked to Las Ramblas and even over to the Picasso Museum although that was a good hike. There are so many cafe to stop and enjoy on the way to break up the trip. Internet access was easy through their provider. Breakfast buffet was delicious with many choices. And many nice touches - porcelain tea pots and helpful wait staff. We stayed here for 2 nights before our cruise. After our cruise we had a long day before our flight and decided to go back to the Majestic for coffee in their lobby bar. Once we arrived we realized the Majestic had felt like our home in Barcelona. It will be our home each time we go back!

Reviews.Title: “Majestic Indeed”
Reviews.Author: Betera
Reviews.Content: In the heat of August, what a pleasure to come back to the cool room and warm reception of the Majestic hotel. A beautiful and elegant property, with lovely furnishings and smart, professional and caring staff, this is a find. We so appreciate the former visitors to this site, who chose to write about it on Tripadvisor, for this is how we found the Majestic. After not being satisfied with a few rooms (one was very dark, another had not a true double bed--but two pushed together) the very helpful person at the reception desk, finally found the perfect room for us. We so appreciated his patience and understanding. It was a delightful room. Breakfast (not included, and a little pricey) was offered as a 2 for the price of 1, during our stay, so it was especially nice. The service was spectacular. At one point I was struggling to open a little jar of jam and before I knew it someone was at my table to open it for me. Seamless. Wonderfully located right on the Paseo de Gracia, the hotel is also between Gaudi's two famous buildings, Casa Milla and Casa Battlo. It was such fun to have these beautiful landmarks as daily sights, as we left and returned daily. The front desk recommended a wonderful tapas restaurant nearby, and were consistently helpful, in general, with other requests. Friendly, professional and caring is how I would characterize each person we came in contact with. I would go back to the Majestic in a minute, and you should too!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Stay There Again”
Reviews.Author: LJRVancouver
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Majestic for 3 nights June 2005 pre cruise and booked through Oceania Cruises at exorbitant prices (cruisers book your own pre & post cruise hotels) and were given tiny dark room overlooking the parking courtyard. Bathroom was nice but room was small & marginally adequate. Location is in heart of exclusive shopping district with huge boulevards - great if you like to shop but I would have preferred to be closer to the action on Las Rumblas. We did get a small credit when my husband learnt at checkout that our rate included breakfast but we had not been told nor was it specified on our reservation - no problem as we preferred having our breakfasts sitting at outdoor cafes people watching than being downstairs in the hotel's dark breakfast room. Barcelona a facinating city & highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, ideal for weekend trip”
Reviews.Author: Niall
Reviews.Content: A 3 minute walk from the train to the Hotel from Passeig de Gracia, which was direct from the airport was a good introduction to the city. Check in was very efficient and the hotel in general was superb. No complaints. Breakfast was included when I booked the hotel on its own website. Breakfast was nice, even if the Condal Restaurant was a little caught for space with alot of people. Any excess were sent upstairs the Piano Bar, which was way more relaxed.The room was very comfortable and sound proofing windows ideal too. We had a really good experience in Madrid and the hotel added to that experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Majestic”
Reviews.Author: Marie7tilly
Reviews.Content: I took my boyfriend to The Majestic for 4 days from the 20th December. I booked a standard room with breakfast. After reading reviews i was more than a little worried of what to expect from the Majestic especially after booking standard. All of this worry vanished when we arrived. The Majestic is positioned on Paseo de Gracia, the finest area to shop and dine out. The hotel is surrounded by Chanel, Louis Vuitton etc. On our arrival we were greeted by such a friendly team of staff and taken to our room. We had a lovely modern room with a great view of the city from the balcony. Also there were lovely decorations draping down the building with giant christmas baubles. The room was cleaned to perfect standards, and little touches to the room morning and night were very nice. From the rooftop there is a lovely view of the city, including most of Gaudi's work. It is in great walking distance to every attraction, the Segarda is just a block way and is a must see at night. Gauid's apartment is almost opposite the hotel. Breakfast was lovely, i was very pleased i booked this. I have stayed in Barcelona 3times before and never tasted a breakfast quite like this one. There was everything from full english to Champagne and strawberries. The service was fantastic. There was also a great atmosphere within the hotel at night, inc a nice piano bar. Although we spent a lot of the time out doing our own thing at night. Overall we both agreed that the hotel was excellent, the staff and service was of a high standard. If i visited Barcelona again i will be staying here without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Not so Majestic”
Reviews.Author: MrsCLondonUK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week with my husband over Christmas/New Year. We booked for 6 nights at 219 Euros per night. The room we were originally allocated was very small with limited facilities (no mini bar; CD player; DVD) and certainly not worth the money. There was an awful sewage smell along the corridor and in the room. We complained immediately. The manager was slow to respond at first but after we told the staff that we were thinking of moving to a different hotel they were, unsurprisingly, very helpful. We were moved to a bigger, more fragrant room, on the second floor which was much better and we were not charged any additional amount which was good. When my husband booked with the hotel he was advised that there was a CD player in each room. This is not correct. Howeevr, we were offered the loan of a CD player at a cost of 30 Euros per day - outrageous! The service generally was far below the standard I would expect of a 5 star hotel. We consider ourselves to be pretty laid back (especially on holiday) but we found that we were constantly having to chase reception/housekeeping as they were very slow in responding to our requests. It took three days to get an answer back about the CD player. The other thing we were disappointed by is that breakfast was not included in our room rate but quite frankly I would recommend going outside the hotel for breakfast as it was not worth the 25 Euros the hotel were charging for it. I have to say we were very pleased with the gym and the roof terrace and views over Barcelona are great and I imagine this would be fantastic in the summer. There is also a great spa - if a little costly. The location of the hotel is also good with great access to main sites, shopping areas and some excellent restaurants. We are accustomed to staying in smaller boutique hotels with excellent service levels (e.g. Ca Maria Adele (Venice); Carlisle Bay (Antigua); The W (New York); Hotel Du Vin (UK); Tokoriki (Fiji)) so this was very different experience for us. Some may like it - particularly the mature conservative crowd - but this not a hotel from the young (or, as in our case, the young at heart) for whom service levels are important. Not to mention contemporary styling (did I mention that the hotel is quite traditional). For those PLUs (people like us), I would suggest looking at Hotel Neri and Hotel Arts (which houses has the fantastic Arola restaurant). Mr and Mrs C

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona in Winter”
Reviews.Author: zakshah
Reviews.Content: Just back from 3 nights at the Hotel Majestic in Barcelona. I stayed in Room 425 (this is a suite). Upon arrival, greeted by doorman, up to reception, efficiently dealt with by staff. Upon entry to room, nice to find complimentary fresh fruit and bottle of water (would have preferred something stronger!). Suite consists of a guest toilet, wardrobe, bathroom with walk-in shower, bidet and toilet, another spacious wardrobe. Living room contains 32-inch LCD TV, 3-piece suite, mini hifi system, and Internet connection. Bedroom has 28-inch LCD TV, Queen-size bed, ipod/radio docking station. And a view of Passeig de Gracia that is fabulous!! The hotel also has a rooftop bar and pool with excellent view of the city. Room service was excellent, food wonderful. Staff were very helpful and I had no problems in communicating with them in English. Room was 'cleaned' twice daily (once to make the bed, etc and second time to turn the bed sheets down!). Overall, this hotel must rate as one the best I have stayed at, would definitely come back, when it is warmer!!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: blessedtwice
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 3 weeks in europe. we had heard and read mixed reviews about the hotel majestic. we decided that the location on the passeig de gracia was perfect. right in the center more or less of everything. roughly a 10 minute walk to the gothic quarter, less than 10 minutes to the start of las ramblas, 5 minutes to the turistic bus lines that take you everywhere. bars restaurants everywhere. we reserved a superior room and found it to more than adequate. i am claustrophobic and had no problem. the bathroom was modern with ample counter space. the floors were quiet although we were there thru a weekend and it was hectic on the street until 3-4 am. the price one pays to be so close to everything. the staff was friendly and helpful but we found thru out the area that catalun or spanish is really all most anyone of the locals speak. at many of the attractions there is some people who are fluently bilingual. we loved the city enjoyed the hotel accomodations and found what ever we needed they were willing to help. communications never were a problem just a bit interesting. definetly intend to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you don't Know Spanish!!!”
Reviews.Author: dubai976
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on a tip from family members that this hotel is very good 5star hotel in Barcelona, But as i discovered this hotel must be a 3 star hotel!!!! If you want only a location then this hotel is your best bet in Barcelona for a shopping and walking around location, it's in the middle of all the main shops and restaurants.... That's All.... The rest are all Negatives.... The only people who speak english in this hotel are the front desk staff and whoever in the ground floor.... when you go to the room you feel you are lost because no one speaks or understands english when you call Room Service, House Keeping or any service they have !!!! I had to contact the front desk every time i wanted to order something or ask about something !!! The Suite i stayed in had good size, but the furniture is Old Old, the T.V. has digital spanish channels but if you want to watch the other languages channels you have to use the analoge channels which are either inturrepted often or not as clear sometimes..... Concierge, NON existant at this hotel!!! your best bets is to try and hope that 1 of the front desk staff is not busy..... the hotel needs a Major Renovation for the entire hotel rooms plus an English Course for all the Staff....

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: lisamanners
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a few days at the Majestic Hotel. The location was perfect right in the shopping heart of the city. Our room, although a bit small was perfectly laid out and wonderfully furnished. We choose the least expenive room and it showed, but I am sure if you paid a bit more you could have had a larger room. There is a roof top pool where we sat around one afternoon. We got a very good rate at this hotel and hence the smaller room. The buffet breakfast was included in our rate, although not always and if not, it is very expensive. The concierge was always cordial and very helpful. Dinner one night as taken at their famed restaurant, and although expensive, well worth it as it was superb. A perfect hotel for a perfect get away.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5*”
Reviews.Author: Iulia_Ro
Reviews.Content: I just returned after a quite last minute booked weekend in Barcelona. We choused Majestic due it's location and since reviews were acceptable... we decided to try it. I'll try to be brief: - location: excellent on Passeig de Gracia, 10 minutes walk from Placa de Catalunya. - General: hotel looks like needs a little of refurbishing, small reception area, walls need in some area painting, etc. It's not terrible, but you can notice is not quite new. - Staff: friendly but let's say in some situations "doing the extra mile" is an unknown expression. Example: At 8 pm sharp (evan I was already sitting on a table for 10 minutes on the roof terrace waiting for someone to take my order), the waiter informed me that no orders can be made, program ends at 8. Although he prepares excellent mojito and sangria (we learned that previous evening, of course before 8 pm :)). Concierge services: excellent, really helpful with reservations, etc. - Rooms: well, let's say this is their wickest point. Furniture tired, small rooms. I've got the feeling that Spanish tourism board never sow the rooms I sow, otherwise they would never got 5*!We booked a standard double room for 250 euro/night. Upon check in we learned that hotel has 7 different type of rooms. We've got a small, dusty back yard room and we ask to change it if possible. First time was impossible, "hotel is full". Second time we've got to see 2 different rooms to choose from. We choused the one a bit larger (actually had the same area but different organized and had the feeling we have an extra space since there was no hall and from the door you were entering dirctly in the bedroom). After we moved in we discovered the room had a window but no view :)) I attached here 2 photos of our view! Rooms were clean but not spotless. They really need refurbishing (at least what we sow). Breakfast: excellent (various selection of cold and hot, fresh juice, etc). Loved it. Conclusions: because we decided to really enjoy our stay, we tried to make fun of the view, room, bathroom size (forgot to mention, really small) and not pay attention. Stil 250 euro/night in October is not quite a bergain. Please check exactly the type of room you are booking. From what I understood, rooms with balcony are superior, located on the main road/facade. Available normally at extra charge if you book a standard (not available during our stay).

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Standard”
Reviews.Author: CzechTourist
Reviews.Content: We have stayed on this hotel for two nights during conference of our organisation that was held in the hotel conference center. We appreciated the following things: very good location, high overall standard, room equipment, the feeling, the pricing. We were not so impressed by: mixed level of services (funny detail: I was unable to make it for the beginning of the conference due to the fact that I was waiting for my shoes to be returned back from cleaning...) Pricing: I am convinced that the charged price was adequate to the level of provided services.

Reviews.Title: “Not Good”
Reviews.Author: TaylorPeat
Reviews.Content: I was very much looking forward to my stay at the 'five star 'Hotel Majestic but from the minute I arrived I was underwhelmed. I booked directly with the hotel and paid extra for a room with a balcony. The room itself was fine, nothing special but fine, however when I went out on the balcony I was extremely disappointed. Not only was it shabby and a little bit grubby looking but there were these awful large bolts and screws exposed all along the wall, which not only looked unsightly but could also have easily caused a nasty scrape. We informed reception who came and had a look at the exposed bolts but didn't actually offer to do anything about them. The hotel's roof top terrace is tiny and only has about 7 or 8 sun loungers so unless you are up there first thing in the morning you can forget about it. The final straw came when I requested an additional sun lounger for our private balcony (as there was only one on it). The girl at reception reluctantly agreed to check 'if it was possible' and said she would call me back to let me know. I sat waiting for 30 mins with no repsonse. At this stage I had had enough. So we packed our bags, checked out and went to another hotel. When we were checking out they did apologise and offered to upgrade us to a suite but by that stage I just wanted to get out of there. However they did charge us for the one night we stayed. It is possible that we were just unlucky with the room we were given but overall I expect alot more from a 5 star standard hotel. The atmosphere in the hotel is pretty stade and the staff are not the friendliest. I wouldn't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Need EarPlugs to sleep”
Reviews.Author: xoTR
Reviews.Content: Room was too small ( be aware of 605, 505,405,305,205,105 and on) No view at all, there was a wall Clean bathroom, clean room. But you need earplugs to sleep. Shutting doors, farting neighbours Showering, flushing, tv's, "Nightmare" You will hear every little detail around your room. Like no walls. Nice breakfast for Barcelona. Very nice coffee Perfect location. Ramblas is a mess but Passage de Gracia is lovely İf only there was little more space, view and soundproof for room.
