Pay more for a room with a view but again buy earplugs. Smoke free room maybe the trick here. I wanted one...

Reviews.Title: “50TH BIRTHDAY CELEBRATIONS”
Reviews.Author: proudmumMiltonKeynes
Reviews.Content: JULY 13TH 2008 Bernadette and John, England Just returned from The Majestic, where we stayed for 5 nights to celebrate our 50th birthdays. My husband had notified the hotel in adavance about our birthday celebrations and they assured him that they would leave flowers or champagne in the room....that was not done. When we arrived we got no real welcome from the front desk staff...no explanation about where things were situated etc or asked if we needed help with anything.We had a superior room which had a balcony and was adequate..the bathroom was not cleaned very thoroughly....the food at breakfast was very good but the room and the service were very disappointing....again we were met with surly, rushed male staff. The pool is tiny, be prepared for that, and very busy at the weekends...the staff up there at the bar are however very pleasant. My husband had a sore shoulder whilst we were there and required some massage treatment, which was excellent, but the sauna, which was also recommended as being helpful by the spa staff ,was broken intermittently. Check out time is at 12 but as our flight was not until 10 30 at night we asked if there were facilities to shower before we left and were told to use the poolside shower by a very arrogant gentleman on the front desk. We finally complained to the lady at Guest Relations ( very pleasant and concerned) and she managed to get us the use of a standard ( very small) room for our last day..she also refunded the cost of 1 night 's bed and breakfast for the poor service we had received. The hotel has a great location but the staff, mostly men, seem really miserable and arrogant and most of the rooms ( public areas as well) are small and have no natural light.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great accomodations”
Reviews.Author: MeqonTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stay for four nights in a junior suite connecting to a deluxe room (for our two girls). The junior suite was very large and nicely appointed. the deluxe room was a bit small, and looked on to the back of the hotel, but was adequate and quiet for the girls. Very clean and good bathrooms. The windows looked out on to Passieg de Gracias, but they are double windows so there was very little noise. The staff was friendly, but the front desk can be overwhelmed, since they act as front desk and concierge. For most things they were very helpful, but were reluctant to recommend places to eat. The places they mentioned were very mediocre pizzerias. But its hard to find bad food around there, so no big deal. The bell staff were attentive and worked hard to get a cab that could handle four with luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: fabiolina
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Majestic. The location of the hotel is wonderful, walkable to everything (we walked to the port a couple of times and also walked to Parc Guell), but not in an area overrun with crowds. The room (a Deluxe) was wonderfully clean and well appointed. The service, typical of European hotels, was not top-notch, but still serviceable. Nice bar on the ground floor and a separate "Cigar Bar" across the hall. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel, Would Like to move it a little”
Reviews.Author: Curunina
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on a 3 night stay for St. Patrick's weekend in this hotel - 3 nights for the price of 2. An extra bonus was that we were upgraded to a Junior Suite from the Superior Room we had booked The room was beautiful, bathroom perfect, and service impeccible. The only drawback to the whole experience is that it is not quite central enough. Yes, it is on the main shopping street -and, yes, I had fun in Chanel. But realistically, we didn't go to Barcelona to shop, and it is a taxi ride to the Ramblas or the Gothic Quarter. It could be walked - but the walk isn't especially interesting, and you feel like you are wasting time you could be spending on "proper" touristy places. We also got a poor reccommendation for a local restaurant on our first night when we were tired from travelling and just wanted a quick bite - but to be fair there is not a big selection of places to eat in the immediate vicinity. These are all just tiny things, and I wouldnt hesitate to stay at the Majestic again - particularly when they have reopened the rooftop pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in central Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: SB12
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a great 3 night stay at this hotel. We had a tripple room with 2 twins and a great sofa bed. The room was quite large and very clean. The staff were very helpfull and the breakfast which was included at a great rate was good. The location is great. All in all agreat hotel - would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, good location”
Reviews.Author: ParisVicky
Reviews.Content: my husband and me did chose this hotel because the location and we did not regret!!! we took a room between the best category and the standard and we had amazing views over paseo de gracia street. the room was lightly and clean. from the hotel you can walk everywhere in Barcelona. and also you have all the shops and great restaurants in the area. if we come back to this city, definitely we will chose the majestic again.

Reviews.Title: “This should not be a five star hotel”
Reviews.Author: asloan2348
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three day stay in Barcelona. We stayed in a standard room at a cost of £198 per day - room only. The smallest five star hotel room in the world? Certainly the smallest that I have ever been in. I've never had the desire to swing a cat but I couldn't have done it in that room. The air conditioning did not work properly. As a result, we had to sleep with the window open and as we faced one of the busiest streets in the city it did not make for a relaxing night. The bathroom was the crowning glory. It was almost impossible to stand up to pee as the pan was so close to the sink. It was also pretty difficult to sit down as I struggled to get my feet on the floor between the pan and the sink. The shower had all of the power of a left handed serve from a right handed tennis player - which was just as well because there was no shower screen which then meant that the floor and the toilet pan were soaked every time the shower was used. From the smell between the lift and the room door, I think that there is a dead body somewhere on floor eight. The basement restaurant looked plastic and soul less - we gave it a body swerve. The only reason that my review stretches to two stars was that we ate at Restaurant Drolma. We had the "menu exclusive" which was wonderful - albeit at a price - dinner for two with an OK bottle of Rioja and a couple of glasses of champagne came to a whopping 485 Euros. Barcelona was superb. Drolma was superb. The Majestic was a massive disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel way past its best”
Reviews.Author: calcalino
Reviews.Content: This hotel is living in the past and on its former reputation. The reception staff are surly and unhelpful, the barmen lazy and uninterested in their work. An aroma of cigar smoke drifts into the lounge from the enclosed cigar bar. There is no daylight in the public areas except in the foyer. The pool is closed for refurbishment. (we were there in March/April 2008... don't know when it will re-open). And the bedrooms -an utter disaster, unless you take into account the bed linen and the night time chamber maid service (which was not to be relied on). The size of our bedroom did not merit a deluxe rating. It would have been more suited to as Travel Lodge or motel - so much so that we had to ask the hotel to remove some of the furniture in order to accommodate all our luggage. We had booked an upgraded room only to find that the city view was out of a window that was positioned almost above our heads and what we could see comprised sky and aerials. After complaining, they showed us other rooms, either with no window (a deluxe rating!!!), or dormer windows or again tiny. Finally we had no choice but to accept what they offered - exactly what they'd shown us in the first instance. It was overpriced, very small and not at all acceptable. By way of 'apology' (?) we were given a bowl of fruit in our room and a bottle of cheap cava. This is no way compensated for the price we had paid and the expectations we had of top class accommodation. All I can say is that despite its excellent location, the hotel does not treat its guests in the manner one would expect from a deluxe hotel. Loved Barcelona, but will never stay in the Majestic again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: eschertz49
Reviews.Content: My wife and I really enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Majestic. The hotel is very well maintained, lavishly decorated, and the rooms are very comfortable. You also really can't beat the location, I know my wife really enjoyed the proximity to all the shopping. Can't complain about the service level, definetely not the best we have received, but by no means bad.

Reviews.Title: “Review better late than never!! Great place to stay in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: lvnluxury
Reviews.Content: After noticing that I have not written a review of our stay and seeing the negative reviews, I feel compelled to state an opinion. From the time we arrived and found a "check in parking/valet" (no traffic stress) directly in front of the hotel to the departure car packed and waiting, this was a wonderful stay. The concierge even organized last minute tickets to the sold out Police concert for us! Our suite was not overly large, however completely adequate for the expectations. The bath was beautiful! Our view was just as I had hoped, directly over the Paseig de Gracia but not too noisy at all. The breakfast and drinks at the bar were expensive, but in a hotel such as this, located in a city such as this, definitely not out of line. We had breakfast in the room everyday which was very pleasurable and priced fairly. All recommendations for "locals" restaurants were right on target. On our next stay in Barcelona, we will split the time between The Majestic and something closer to the water. If you are looking for something typical "non modern" this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: kolinsky
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a '3 for the price of 2' night stay at the Majestic Hotel, Barcelona. Before we even got in the hotel we were greeted by the doormaen and our luggage was promptly taken to reception for us, where check in was quick. Despite being hours early we were shown to our room. The location is perfect. Right in the centre of all the sight seeing but also in a part of the city that is more upmarket, so you feel safer at night. The room was huge and the bathroom luxurious. Air con and heating controls were in the room, safe, mini bar, work station, TV and all the little extras you would expect. Bathrobes and slippers were provided. The bed was very comfortable as were the pillows. Breakfast was superb. One of the best selections I've encountered. Fresh fruit, cereals, pastries, breads, hams, cheeses, bacon, eggs, pancakes, tortilla and fresh coffee. Throughout the hotel we found the staff to be extremely helpful, polite and professional. The hotel was clean, quiet and had a relaxing atmosphere, which is appreciated after a days walking and sight seeing. Didn't use the pool because the weather was to cold. The only fault I can find is that there was a few cracked tiles in the bathroom, but that's me being really picky. Will use this hotel on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't Deserve It's Five-Star Rating.”
Reviews.Author: Valerie_UK
Reviews.Content: I am not someone who usually complains, but the Hotel Majestic managed to defeat even my stoic British spirit. Upon arrival, we were ignored as we repeatedly tried to get the receptionist's attention. When we were finally shown to our room on the seventh floor, it was dark, dingy, and slightly dirty in parts. The small window was directly opposite another room's window, which was a mere two metres away, and allowed minimal light through as our view was blocked by walls, drain pipes and gutters. The walls were extremely thin, meaning we could hear every noise the rather passionate couple next door to us were making. The toiletries brought my partner out in a rash, and the bathrobes were so coarse they aggravated my eczema. Our shower kept switching between scalding hot and freezing cold, and the lavatory kept blocking. We had requested a double room, but were met with two (fairly lumpy) single beds. We were told to merely 'push the beds together', and deal with it. Had I not paid over £200 a night, I probably wouldn't have minded so much, but as it was, it didn't seem appropriate 5 -Star behaviour. The final icing on the -frankly, rather rotten- cake was that the pool and sun terrace were closed. With such a major part of the hotel out of service, one would expect there to be some notification on the website, and to be reminded of this at check in. However, I have scoured the website and found no such notification, and was certainly not notified of it at reception. Instead, guests are informed of the pool's closure via a small, slightly dog-eared sign in the elevators. My advice to any potential guests of the hotel majestic is this- DON'T LET YOUR HOLIDAY BE RUINED - FIND SOMEWHERE ELSE!!!

Reviews.Title: “simply disappointed”
Reviews.Author: loungette
Reviews.Content: I'm simply disappointed. maybe Majestic's management doesn't know what a Five Stars Grand Luxe means. this hotel should be a 4 stars, and I'm generous. I paid too much for the poor room I got (a superior, not a standard), che bathroom is a joke, small and not clean as it should be (some NOVOTEL 2 stars are more comfortable). breakfast is nothing special and everything is very expensive. swimming pool is not avaliable, and we weren't informed when we booked. 5 stars GL is the maximum rate for hotels. this one surely doesn't deserve it. NOT RECCOMENDED.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Par8
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a celebration break away to The 5* Majestic Hotel. We had booked for 3 nights but only stayed the one as it was so terrible. We booked through the Hotel Website and chose this particular hotel for many reasons, the main one being for the pool facilites. While travelling in the lift to our room we noticed a small typed up note advising that the pool and spa was closed for refurbishment. Not only did they not advise us of this when we checked in but more importantly, I felt so angry that there was/is no mention of this Refurbishment on their website. After complaining to reception, who were very cold and unsympathetic, gave us a couple of free passes for a pool 3 blocks away (hardly the same!). Our room was nothing like you would expect either from a 5* hotel, plus we had booked a superior room. The bathroom was the smallest I have ever seen. We chose to check out the following morning and find a hotel that met with our requirements and luckily we found Hotel 1898 which I must say, was a lovely hotel, and only 4 star, but in my opinion far superior to the Majestic. We felt we were then able to finally enjoy our break away. On returning home I wrote a letter to the GM as I feel very strongly that they should be advising all potential customers of the fact that their facilities are closed due to refurbishment, thus giving people the option especially as they pride themselves on their 'main priority being Customer Satisfaction'. I wanted answers as to why we were not advised in the first place, but he basically avoided all of my questions, so again, I wrote to him, only to receive another letter back stating that they are improving their facilities. I found the whole experience totally appalling, how we were treated beforehand, during and after our stay. I never normally complain, but on this occassion I felt i had too. its not about the money (although it did cost us around 240 euros for experience) but the fact that people like ourselves were able to book this hotel under false advertising.

Reviews.Title: “Dear but rather good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Volodymyr
Reviews.Content: Actually i was bit dissapointed by quality of extra bed and the fact that standard double room for it's price was too tight for 3 people. But since hotel removed extra bed surcharge from the bill at the check out i have nothing to complain about. Certainly expensive but good quality accommodation in decent location.

Reviews.Title: “Service and location perfect”
Reviews.Author: ParisGolfer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel last december, booked directly. The location is perfect, walking distance for the shopping and all the key areas of Barcelona, the room was large and quiet, very clean, the staff is lovely and really helpful, breakfast is delicious. We recommend this hotel for people looking for a good 5 stars hotel in the center of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Just go.”
Reviews.Author: Sigrid66
Reviews.Content: I am dutch mum of 3 young boys. Since i really needed a break alone, my husband offered me a weekend Barcelona to do some serious sightseeing (GHAUDI!!) and even more serious shopping! I chose the Majestic based on its location, and for the fact the manager of the hotel actually made the effort to read Tripadvisor and react to negative comments. I always read everything on tripadvisor before booking any hotel or holiday as i find it the best revieuw site worldwide. This is however my first written revieuw! I booked a single classic room. Basically I paid as much as a doubleroom would cost but i still expected to get the smallest room around really. NOT true. I got a nice room, quit spacious with a large bathroom (room 242). I originally was given another room but asked if i could smoke there and that was not the case so i was given another. I must say, walking thru the hallways and seeing other rooms being cleaned, that they seemed smaller. So yes, the rooms may not be big bit its a very old building, rooms differe in size and I did book the cheapest category. So if you take a classic room then indeed you have NO vieuw, and a smaller room. I had no vieuw indeed but i did not care and did not expect it. Its not like I'd go to barcelona to look out of the window all day, is it? Now for the Hotel. I loved it. Its peacefull, classy but very friendly. I never felt out of place there tho i strolled around in jeans and Tshirt basically and i clearly look like a tired mum and not like a potential Armani customer (Armani is next door). Everybody was friendly and willing to help or answer my questions. The Hotel is very clean, looks very wel maintained and is nicely decorated. The beds are comfortable, nice big towels, slippers, TV with several ebglish spoken channels etc. Only the bathrobes.....they are kidsizes. If you are over size 14, bring your own:P That goes for the whole of Barcelona tho, loads of shops but not a chance of buying any clothing over size M (14 or so). So I shopped a lot for my kids and saved my husband some money. Breakfast is standard buffet, not many fancy things but sufficient. The breakfast restaurant is maybe the nly area of ther hotel i did not like much, its in the basement and it does not have much atmosphere. It does the trick tho, you can sit comfortably and eat enuff to last till dinner. Negatives? Hotelwise i cant think of any that would not make me look utterly picky. Servicewise, only one thing botherred me. I do not use a creditcard. I dont have one, i hate them. I pay with my bankcard in Holland and cash elsewhere. My husband obviously has some but they are in his name so i dont take them. Even tho my hotel was payed for already they wanted my creditcard at check in. I said i didnot have one. I got the weirdest look ever, as if i am a total moron for not having one. Then I had to deposit 50 euros a night, apperantly to cover damage or costs i would cause or make before running of...or so.... I basically felt like a criminal and told the guy i didnot think it was nice to display so much distrust on a guest, who already payed for her whole stay. He just shrugged. I payed the 100 euros (2 nights). When I checked out 2 days later there was another receptionist. I asked for my money back and he asked for a receipt. I never got one when i checked in and told him that. He shaked his head, started looking in the computer for a while and eventually gave me the money back. Now that made me feel a bit weird, but other than that..i loved it there. If you have doubts, just book it, location is superb, service was great as well, apart from the little incident above. Please note the swimmingpool and spa are being rebuild and are not done till about may this year. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IrishGirl15
Reviews.Content: Great location on nice shopping street. About 15 mins walk to Las Ramblas. Lots of restaurants nearby. Area feels very safe. Not much happening on the street at night as its mostly shops. Hotel was very nice. I was expecting it to be five star ie luxurious but it is really more of a 4 star. Hotel room itself was pretty small but nicely decorated and clean. There was a strange smell in the hallway at times.

Reviews.Title: “Standard rooms are not recommended”
Reviews.Author: Shalom27
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights. The standard room was very disappointing room. I was Lucky to get an upgrade to a sweet which was very nice. Breakfast is served in a basement dining room. Pool is small, open and on the roof. Location is very good. I think there are better hotels for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable, but a bit average”
Reviews.Author: SimoneP
Reviews.Content: The Majestic is in a fantastic position at the centre of Barcelona. Situated on the Passeig de Gracia it's ideally located for designer shopping while being just 25 minutes walk from the Old Town and 35 minutes from the Port. Many of the important sites are within striking distance, as are lots of restaurants and tapas bars. The hotel itself is a bit soulless, but the staff are very pleasant and extremely accommodating. We had a bit of trouble with the rooms; we'd booked a Privilege Room to ensure some private space and seating, but the two rooms we were offered were quite small and neither offered anything like the space or facilities shown on the hotel's website. On day 2 we asked to see some other rooms and chose a Superior Double which was far larger than the 2 Privilege Rooms (and of course cheaper too). The 2 Privilege Rooms had both had views over the main street, which was very pretty but really noisy - we moved to the Superior Room both for its extra space as well as peace and quiet; our view was of a car park at the back of the hotel but at least we got some sleep. Not all the superior rooms are as large - if you go ask for room 348 or indeed any room ending in ?48 - the first number denotes the floor you're on) - these are particuarly large and have a large bathroom with double was basins - another thing the Privilege Rooms didn't have. The breakfast in the lower ground restaurant was a self service and very average, but adequate. We didn't eat in the Michelin starred Drolma, preferring to eat in more Spanish restaurants. The Majestic's bar is OK - a bit busy and used as a lounge too (as there isn't an actual lounge area) so it lacked a bit of intimacy; but the service was good again. Would we stay again? Possibly if we couldn't find a better hotel with a good deal on, but the Majestic often does a 3 for 2 offer and that does give you value for money. Finally I must just add an excellent recommendation for a tapas bar just round the corner from the Majestic. Completely authentic and utterly delicious, it's the Cerveseria Catalana at 26 Carrer Mallorca. You'll have to queue and when you arrive give your name to the lady at the door who'll ensure you don't lose your place in the queue - the food is terrific, the staff helpful and English speaking and the experience is totally Spanish.

Reviews.Title: “All style and no substance.”
Reviews.Author: sunneedays
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Majestic with my boyfriend in mid-December and the hotel is beautiful and very centrally located to the Passeg de Gracia metro stop. The metro is very easy to use once you get the hang of it and we bought a 10 journey travel card with our debit card and once I had used it to go through the barrier I passed it to my boyfriend to use and it was so easy. Now the hotel itself-beautiful lobby and clean although we found the general atmosphere a bit formal and stuffy for 2 young people in our 20's and this alone would put us off returning again. We would stay in a more relaxed,welcoming hotel in future. There are no tea+coffee making facilities in the room which I have had in all hotels in various cities I have stayed in before and was a big disappointment considering the rates the hotel charges. We were in a room which must have been the smallest room I have ever stayed in you literally walked 3 paces from the bed and were in the bathroom. It was clean and comfortable but far too small for the rates they charge. The minibar as expected was absolutely extortionate and if you go to a supermarket on the Ramblas called "Carrefour" you can stock up on the same brand of water the hotel puts in the minibar. Hotel cost per bottle-4 euro carrefour cost-21 cents. You do the maths. I feel with this hotel you are simply paying for the name.

Reviews.Title: “lovely majestic”
Reviews.Author: srups
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 day break in barcelona. Location very central and handy for sightseeing. This was the first time staying 5 star and the Majestic certainly was "5 star". Check in was quick and easy and the staff were always helpful.The room was spotless and comfortable. Breakfast was also very good, juices,cerials,hot food,breads and cheeses.We got a good rate on internet and would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A Good stay at the majestic”
Reviews.Author: LCWombat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Majestic pre-cruise. The hotel was very nice, although not exceptional. The lobby was a good size, and decorations nice. Staff was efficient, no complaints. The room was small with 4 large bags on the floor, but if we didn't have them, it would have been just fine. I didn't think it was that bad, but the L-shape of the room made things a little akward. We had a corner room. Desk, chair and small table. Street noise not really an issue as we were back from the street, 6th floor. We could hear other customers enter their room, but normal in most hotels. Bathroom a good size, we weren't bumping into each other. Regular size tub. Closet was smallish, but we didn't really use it. Did have a safe. Hairdryer provided. The roof top pool was nice, but small (to be expected in roof top pools). Good for a dip but not a swim. Lovely views from the roof. A small gym also available.. Excellent location, in between 2 Gaudi houses and very near the metro, which was easy enough to take. We were there Sat/Mon. The street is much busier during the week, but not so much on the weekend. Plenty of little places to eat nearby. Overall, a nice stay. We did not eat in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Class and Comfort on the Passeig de Gracia”
Reviews.Author: ntravinsky
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Majestic while he attended a conference in Barcelona. Initially, we were booked at the Claris Hotel and we were very unhappy with the room so we switched to the Hotel Majestic the next day. Room #725 I arrived at the Hotel Majestic a few hours before the normal check-in hour (because I had checked us out of the Claris Hotel). The gentleman at the front desk was very kind and welcomed me. He said that our junior suite was not ready yet, however, for an additional 100 Euros per night, we could be upgraded to a large suite. I told him that unfortunately, I couldn't do that since my husband's company was picking up the tab. Then, he told me it was not a problem and he was going to do a complimentary upgrade so that I could go to the room. What a great way to start our experience at the Hotel Majestic. When the bellhop took me to the room I was SO happy with what I saw. It was very nice and luxurious (fresh floral arrangements in the living room adjacent to the bedroom, as well as in the master bathroom). We had 1 1/2 baths, a full king sized bed, and a separate living room with a couch and 2 very comfortable sitting chairs. Flat screen televisions were available in the living room and the main bedroom (no English tv stations but we were fine with that as we did not watch the tv). Internet access and connection speeds were excellent (as opposed to the Claris where it did not work for us in our suite). Bathroom toiletries were by Molton Brown. The concierge was extremely helpful and we ended up eating at La Cerveseria (a recommended restaurant about a block away) twice because the tapas were SO good. Pros: location, luxury of the room, location on the Passeig de Gracia, helpfulness of the concierge, room had balconies from the bedroom and the living room. champagne and fruit tray that was a welcome gift from the hotel. Cons: Strange sewer scent in the main hall in our suite. I had to keep the bedroom door and the living room doors closed to that hallway or the scent permeated the room. It appeared to come through the air conditioning vents. Also, the lights on the balconies did not get turned off until around midnight, so it was impossible to sleep with the windows cracked and the drapes open. I devised a way to leave the window cracked in the living area so we were not bothered by the lights.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: co_rich_car
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed in this hotel for one night after returning from a cruise and loved it. Our room was large, comfortable and quiet. The staff was professional and accommodating. One of the best things was that we were able to check in at 9:00 in the morning. After being on a very active cruise for twelve days and awake early that morning to disembark the ship by 8:00, it was very welcoming to have a room and safe place for our luggage. We had hoped that the hotel would store our luggage until check in time, but what a nice suprise to have a room ready. The location is ideal for sightseeing. It was so easy to use any form of transportation available in the city from this hotel and so many sights were within easy walking distance. Overall, this five star hotel was comfortable and convenient and the service was excellent without being overwhelming.

Reviews.Title: “It is okay, but not great for a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: bembridge
Reviews.Content: This was actually the 2nd time I have stayed at the Hotel Majestic in Barcelona. The first was about 3 or 4 years ago on a long weekend break. This time I was here for work. I cannot work out if I like it or not, and probably overall am indifferent and think there are much better hotels offering better value and service in the city. On the plus side, it has a great location right in the centre of the upmarket shopping area on a very wide and attractive boulevard. In addition to shops there are many great restaurants as well as being near to attractions like a Gaudi museum. There is a small but attractive roof terrace with pool with great views (closed for renovation until about April 2008). The rooms are very varied in size. This trip I had a large room which was very quiet as at the back of the hotel and not overlooking the main road. The air-conditioning is very quiet which is a boon as I hate air-conditioning noise and in most hotels have to switch it off at night no matter how hot or cold it gets! The rooms feel dated and uninspired decor wise, although they are not shabby at all. The bed and pillows were very comfortable and this combined with the quiet made for a great night sleep. There are some strange things like very limited cupboard space and no easy access to a plug for your PC (at the desk you have to reach behind the desk to try and get a plug in). The food is ok but nothing unusual. If I had a choice of coming back here or staying somewhere else for the price (as it is a 5 star), I would chose somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay! You must stay here!”
Reviews.Author: alexincali
Reviews.Content: The Majestic is superbly located. Close to Las Ramblas but no quite in the hustle and bustle of that street. It is in Passeig de Gracia -- a very 5th Ave type of street -- the store attached to our hotel was Chanel Boutique. The hotel rents roadsters for the day for 50 Euros. Great little car for a few hours. We did have a mishap with the little car -- but the hotel more than made up for it. The buffet breakfast is not amaaaazing but it's not bad either. Service is fantastic. The hotel itself is beautiful. There is a rooftop bar with DJ called Dolce Vita. This was a nice place to see the whole of Barcelona and it was a nice place to have drinks and see all the beautiful people -- although the drinks were quite expensive - i think 15 euros for one martini. But worth it. The pool is small but, really who goes to Barcelona to spend it in a pool? The Costa Brava is but a short drive away which can be done in of those little roadsters the hotel rents out. The room was small but well maintained. I felt comfortable. It was nice to come from spending the entire day at the beach in the Costa Brava, take a wonderful shower to remove the sand and sweat, cuddle under the soft robes and flip flops provided by the hotel, drink some Cava and eat cheese and membrillo! The best.

Reviews.Title: “Willing to give a second chance”
Reviews.Author: ash_stu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Majestic in November 06, The room was quite small and dark (overlooking a fire escape) for the price paid but it was very clean and the staff was very helpful. We are planning to visit the hotel again in January 08 and have book a superior room which I am hoping is a bigger and brighter room than before. We said we would give the hotel a second chance as the staff made a lasting impression on both my self and my wife We arrived around 11am and checked in straight away no problem which was great. The location is great with plenty of bars and restaurants within walking distance. Overall we enjoyed your visit which is why we have chose to stay again but would not be impressed if the room size is not greatly improved.

Reviews.Title: “There must be better value than this in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: ngman
Reviews.Content: Considering how expensive this hotel is, I don't think it really offers the best quality available in Barcelona. The hotel's location is great and (if the weather is good), the rooftop terrace is a great addition (although the pool is probably better for kids to splash in rather than trying to actually swim in). The beds are big (generally queen size) but the rooms are a tad on the small side - especially at the lower end of the hotel's scale. I was surprised to be asked to pay for a stamp when I asked the reception desk to post a letter on my behalf - hotels of this standard rarely ask for the price of a stamp. The restaurant ("Drolma") is fantastically expensive (min. €50 for a starter or main!), but I subsequently learnt it has a Michelin star and the food is incredible - well worth the experience. My tip - go for the set menu, which is good value for money. Drinks, for a restaurant of this quality were surprisingly reasonable (around €8 a glass).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gayler104
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at approximately 9 AM, however it was 3 Am for us! We were immediately offered our room. In reading prior reviews I remembered that one should first ask to view the room. We were told that the room was the smallest avaialble, but if we would wait until later in the afternoon we could get a larger room. We opted to take the small room so we could get to sleep immediately. The room was very small, but extremely immaculate. The bathroom was very modern. The view was awful, but we were never in our room long enough to have that be a problem. The breakfast buffet was adequate for us, but not as fabulous as other travelers had written. It certainly had everything we required, but if you're looking for omelet stations etc, forget it! The location was just perfect. The roof top pool area had a lovely view of the city. We would definately return to the Majestic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: malee47
Reviews.Content: Chose the Majestic due to its location and reviews on T A and was not disappointed. The rooms were available on arrival as requested and, although the view wasnt great the rooms were clean and well presented. If you were staying for longer than a city break you might want for more storage space/wardrobes Bathroom was clean and modern and, for a change, well lit! The staff were always pleasant although you could wait to be seen a reception at busy times. However the concierges where charming and v helpful. If you do go do make sure you head up to the 10th floor for the spa, deck/pool and the great views The best recommendation is that I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Not even close to 5 star service”
Reviews.Author: JB_Parrothead
Reviews.Content: This hotel has plenty to offer but falls short on many levels. Our situation was a problem for them from the beginning. The issue---we were 3 adult travelers seeking 1 room. I contacted the hotel via e-mail to request our options. The only single room option was to book a junior suite, which was 400 euros per night plus 50 euros for the extra person. So that is what I booked. We stayed 3 nights. The problem was room service and housekeeping never got their act together and provided accommodations for 3 people. We had 2 of everything from drink glasses to bath towels to bath robes to sets of bed pillows. We kept asking for more supplies, including the shampoos and each time they would bring them but the next day it went back to 2 of everything. Finally I went down to the lobby and demanded management fix the problem. The lobby manager told me to return to my room and tell housekeeping what I wanted. I told him that he should deal with housekeeping, not me. I find this unbelievable in a 5 star hotel and told him that loud and clear. Other problems we encountered were the extra bed never had the same feather pillows the king bed had; other rooms had white bath robes and black pool robes--ours only had 2 white ones; the extra bed for the first 2 nights was actually just the sofa which they made up as a bed but there was no mattress pad, just a sheet over the sofa seat; the extra bed linens were only 2 sheets, no blanket was supplied and the pillow was a 12" square throw pillow with a case on it; one day the sofa was made up as a bed all day long rather than making it up that way only in the evening so we had no place to watch TV or visit; every night only 2 of the 3 beds got turn down service. It was basically the poorest 5 star service I have ever received. There were some good things about this hotel. The location was perfect, right in the middle of things yet off The Ramblas, which all 3 of us preferred. The rooftop bar and swimming pool were both wonderful. Every night we went up to the roof for drinks and music, the view was a great end to a long day of trekking all over BCN. The breakfast was among the best we had anywhere in Spain. I realize we would not have had these problems if we were 2 to a room, but they did take our extra 50 euros and they did agree that 3 could be accommodated in 1 room so I fault the hotel entirely. The manager did give us an additional free standard room on our 3rd night, but I had to insist she do something more than her first offer which was a free breakfast on our last day. This negotiation took an hour, in the US it would have been a given. At no time did I get the impression that management would do almost anything to make it right--both managers I dealt with were really not interested in going above and beyond to assure our stay was a good one.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: rockland22
Reviews.Content: hotel majestic was a great hotel , located right on passieg de gracia, everything was in walking distance. roof top pool offered some "majestic" views!!! the junior suites bathroom was amazing as well BIG shower and separate tub.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: jbtexas
Reviews.Content: The Majestic is a very comfortable, upscale hotel located in the center of Barcelona's shopping district on the Passeig de Gracia. As such, the location puts you right in the center of shopping action, a six block walk to Placa de Catalunya, two blocks from Gaudi's Casa Mila and two blocks from a metro station and Turistic bus stop (both north and south routes). This makes the location hard to beat, and is away from the noise of Las Ramblas (Rambla de Catalunya is a block away, but it is much quieter than Las Ramblas from Placa de Catalunya to the coast). If you want a hotel central to it all, but yet away from the tourist crowds of Las Ramblas or Barri Gotic, this hotel is hard to beat. We also found the hotel rooms quite comfortable and have absolutely no complaints about our four night stay there. We arrived at the hotel after our overnight flight from the US at 9:30 am and were able to get right into our room. I don't know if this is the norm, but we were sure pleased with this! Our room was #646, which was one price notch above a standard room. We found the room very comfortable with everything in good working order. Only two small minor observations about the room. If there was a clock, we could not find it. I realize that most European hotels don't have table top clocks a la American hotels, but for a hotel in this price range, I would have expected something. Also, there were no facial wash cloths. Again, very typical for Europe, but again at this price point, I was a bit disappointed. Our room was an interior room, so we had no view, but we also heard no outside noise. From the evacuation chart on the door of the room, it appears that rooms vary considerably in size. If you want a large room, I'd suggest calling the hotel direct to make a reservation. Further, if you look very closely at the hotel photos on the hotel web site, you will see that the floors are not level. You will climb up and down sets of steps as you go from one end of the floor to the other (there are two separate elevator banks - one on the Passeig de Gracia side, and one half way down the Valencia side). If you are staying at the hotel on a US dollar bankrolled vacation, you may wish to think twice about dining at the in-house acclaimed Drolma restaurant. Even without wine, your bill will approach or exceed $300. The food was fine, and the service attentive, if a bit rushed, but for $300, I would be hard pressed to say it was worth it. If your home currency is anything other than the US dollar, I'd recommend the restaurant. The hotel has a rooftop lounge / lap pool / deck area. There are much better places to get an elevated view of Barcelona (Castell Montjuic, Tibidabo, Parc Guell for starters), but it is a pleasant place to relax. If you want to save a few euros (and for US visitors, you'll need to!), rather than patronizing the hotel restaurant (Condial) for breakfast, you may want to consider Fresh & Ready, a small cafe a block and a half south on Passeig de Gracia. You can get cereal, fruit, pastries and coffee / tea and then sit out on sidewalk tables watching people go to work - not a bad way to start a vacation day! Fresh & Ready is open all day, and sitting at a sidewalk table with a sandwich / salad / beverage makes for some great people watching.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Majestic”
Reviews.Author: LOVESVACATIONING
Reviews.Content: Majestic certainly was majestic !!! Great hotel. Nice rooms. Staff friendly. Great location. Thanks Bruno.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: tempcooler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Majestic for 3 nights in August. The location is great, on a beautiful tree lined block in the center of the shopping district, close to several Gaudi buildings and walkable to La Rambla. We got a pretty good 3 nights for the price of 2 deal via the hotel website. The service was quite good. Attentive, spoke good English. The rooms are clean and nice, and size wise about what we expected (smallish, about average by European standards). We got the superior room that added a small sitting area which probably was worth it to make the room feel a bit more spacious. The internet service is very expensive which was a drawback. The room had a funny smell each time after it was cleaned. We got used to it after a while, but it was weird. The main lobby was undergoing renovation and the temp lobby is small and can get crowded. Overall it was a nice stay. You have to be realistic with what you can get for your money in Barcelona and while the Majestic was not super luxurious it was comfortable and upscale.

Reviews.Title: “Shame about the work!”
Reviews.Author: LuluJai
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and enjoyed our time at the hotel, if we had known about the building work we probably wouldn't have booked it though! Our experience of the side entrance was not as bad as other reviews; we were greeted and checked in quickly, plenty of staff and everyone helpful. We asked about a different room and were offered one facing the main street; however it was a smoking room so stayed with our allocated classic room. After looking at the floor plan on the back of the door I think the room allocation is a bit of a lottery. We e-mailed the hotel and asked for a high floor as some reviews suggested they were bigger rooms. The design of the hotel means all rooms are different shapes and sizes, the more expensive rooms facing on to the main street are not always larger. We were lucky we had a good sized room and decent bathroom, although I can understand why some are not happy with room size. The building works started at 9am on week days, so hammering and drilling was constant, we found this frustrating as came away without our children and part of the appeal was some uninterrupted sleep and a lie-in bed in the morning! Breakfast on the Sunday was awful, the main restaurant was closed due to the decorating and breakfast was in a function room, which meant the cold food was warm and the warm food cold by the time we got to breakfast. They were also putting all the tables away around us which was frustrating as more guests arrived and they had to put some back up!!!!! The other 2 mornings were in the main restaurant which was a relief! We were disappointed about lack of tea and coffee making facilities in the room and called reception to try to get some – funnily enough this was the only time no-one could understand English and all we could get out of 3 people was the offer of coffee as room service for 5Euros each!!!! The roof terrace was fantastic and made our visit worthwhile, great way to chill at the end of the day and great views – although the coffee machine was broken there – did feel like someone was trying to keep our caffeine levels down!! The room service and mini bar is a bit expensive, the location is excellent and the shops underneath are great, including Gucci which brought my husband out in a cold sweat every time we walked past - as I fell in love with an outfit in the window. We filled out the comment card as suggested by others and did get a gift wrapped mug which was nice. On reflection we are not sorry we chose this hotel, just a shame we went at the wrong time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but too many faults”
Reviews.Author: 360traveller
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights (in Aug 30 - out Sep 4) at bargain rate of approx $200 US per night booked on line thru an internet wholesaler. Arrived very early in AM on the 30th and was told the house was full and check in time was 3PM. So, we headed for roof top pool deck and hung out and dozed on chaise for a couple of hours. Around 10AM, we headed down thru lobby and discovered our room was ready. Having read the Trip Advisor warnings, we asked to see the room before taking our luggage up. It was 310, a twin bedded room in the back overlooking a parking lot and some air-conditioning unit. The front desk said it was a quiet room with lots of light. We demurred and insisted on a different room (and overheard others get upgrades at front desk) - and so we ended up in 729, with a balcony in front of hotel and a lovely view of Passeig de Gracia. Nice, light, quiet enough despite vehicle traffic outside. It was a somewhat painful time-consuming process to obtain an okay room. The room was smallish, bathroom functional but stonework in need of sprucing up. Mattress in need of replacement or rotation - I felt I would slide off the bed because the mattress leaned towards the telephone. Bedding okay - sheets decent enough quality. Plenty of pillows of different shapes and hardness. Message light on phone stayed lit for entire stay despite our numerous calls to front desk to address it. Housekeeping excellent. Hard finding any English speaking TV stations on the lovely flat screen TV. Turn down service nice touch. No noise from hallway. Elevators (all sets of them)- pathetically slow, at times, and small and hot. Hotel lobby and fancy restaurant undergoing some sort of renovation (someone said the air conditioning system was being fixed). Breakfast (included in price) was served in a conference room on lobby level our first 3 days and then in usual location (sub-basement level) last two days. Nice buffet selection...attentive service. No complaints. Free newspapers (some in English). The hotel has a decent gym area near the pool on roof as well as sauna and steam room. The sauna and steam can be used only upon payment of fee and with reservation. Plenty of chaises and chairs on roof, from which you can see Sagrada Familia Church, port, Montjuic- etc etc. Great views. The hotel is less than one block from Passeig de Gracia metro station which is very convenient to get down to Ramblas or to Barciloneta (sic) or anywhere. We took a Renfe train from that station to Sitges this past Sunday. Hotel is okay walk (slightly downhill) to Placa Catalon, but you'll will find the slight street grade incline makes the return walk a bit more grueling. Hotel was longer walk from Placa Catalon than we would have liked. Free ice and lemon and lime flavored water available 24/7 off lobby, along with red and green apples. Concierge extremely gracious and generous with time, advice, restaurant recommendations and reservations. Last night, we had ballet tickets at Liceu and had to depart hotel before Cafe d'Academia opened and could confirm. We headed for the popular restaurant after our show ended and, sure enough, hotel had come through with sought after reservation. Kudos to Concierge Christine and her "colleagues." Despite its many features, I would be inclined to stay in a hotel in the Barri Gotic next time or, much more likely, the fabulous Hotel Arts right on the beachfront in Port Olympic, but a five minute walk from old city. We toured that hotel, and the rooms and views are impressive. I feel we got our money's worth at the Majestic, but only because we landed a terrific internet rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: gregoire90
Reviews.Content: We stayed there together with my wife and daughter. The hotel is in a very good location close to the subway and major spots to visit in Barcelona. Our room was big and we could easily stay with our daughter (14) in the room. She slept in a (comfortable) sofa bed. We had a flat screen TV. There is internet access in the room but it is not free of charge. The hotel employees are very pleasant. There is a very nice view from the 10th floor (where the pool is) and the swimming pool is quite OK (although not huge, but we are in the center of Barcelona). The breakfast was great with almost everything you can expect (including freshly squeezed orange juice). The hotel definitely deserves its 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “A 4 star hotel with 5 star pretentions”
Reviews.Author: Manacan
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel - I stay in good Barcelona hotels at least 6 times a year. The rooms are 4 star size and the bathrooms pokey (I had a "superior" room). The in-room internet, and films were not working, the general attitude of staff was functional but not particularly warm or welcoming. Apart from it's location it has very little to recommend it and in any case you can do a lot better in Barcelona for the bucks!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Room- but Noisy, Noisy!”
Reviews.Author: katy-in-california
Reviews.Content: Great location- but anyone considering stay should find out if they are still doing lobby reconstruction- the make shift lobby was crowded, overheated and in chaos-espeically around checkin and out time- when entering or leaving the hotel you were always dodging tired guests and their piles of luggage. My room, faced a court yard where the construction workers sawed and hammered starting at 9am! Good thing I was an early bird as sleeping in would have been impossible. In addition there was a parklot resurfacing project going on next door- which included a loud sander that went from 10-5 each day sort of putting a damper on the thoughts of any mid afternoon siestas. My inquiries about the noise at the front desk were met with shrugs- which I think was the most disappointing thing- since I was out of the room for the most part, I didn;t make a stink and request another room- but they did not offer any solutions as well- disappointing for a supposed 5 star hotel On the positive was the location, and the rooms themselves were clean, roomy and up to date- also the bar at the top of the hotel has a great view and is a perfect place to end the day with a drink. Because of the location and the nice rooms, I would consider staying there once construction was completed- but just thought I would give a heads-up to fellow travelers...

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: TripMeAnytime
Reviews.Content: Based on reviews & comments here we booked the Hotel Majestic for one night prior to a cruise. We booked on line via the hotel web site & exchanged a couple of emails requesting an extra bed in 2 of the 3 rooms. We arrived late due to a missed flight & all rooms were ready as requested with the extra beds. Check in was efficient. We chose to have dinner in the hotel restuarant becaue we were too tired from travel to wander. The food was good tho not cheap. Rooms were clean & comfortable. We took a city tour the next morning so had them store our bags. The only "negative" was the main lobby was under construction or cleaning & a side lobby was being used. It was very crowded & noisy. A pleasant stay all around. Location is good for walking around tho it's a little farther to Las Ramblas than I had thought.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KMichigan
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in a perfect location. Rooms were decorated very nicely, spacious, clean and very comfortable. We especially loved the rooftop lounge!! I used the travel advisor to select this hotel and I agree 100% with the positive reviews. Would definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Definatelly not a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: pafcio80
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have returned from Barcelona two days ago where we spent 6 nights at The Majestic Hotel. When I was booking this trip, I wanted the hotel to be in a great location and at least 4-5 star. I do have to say that the location is great. It's located on a street filled with expensive stores, and lots of tapas places. You can easily walk to any major tourist attraction and if you'd like to take the metro, the stop is within a block away. After looking at the pictures of what the hotel looks like, I definitely knew that it looks luxurious. However, I was wrong. First of all, they are renovating the hotel so the photos that you see on their website of their front entrance and the lobby are not accurate. The entrance is on the side of the building and the lobby is very small. We booked a Classic Room which consisted of one room and a bathroom. The room was small with one bed that supposed to be queen size but it was full size. There were marks on the walls in some spots. The quality of the furniture was definitely not 5 star. The hotel splurged on a small flat screen tv for the room but there was no iron or an alarm clock! If we wanted to get up early we had to call the lobby every time. The bathroom was small but nice. Although within the whole time we stayed there the bulb in one of the sconces on either side of the mirror was out and they have not replaced it. Other than that, the housekeeper came every day. Cleaned the room, changed the sheets and towels. Roof deck has some great views but it's not big. It also has a pool with unheated water and it's pretty small. They serve drinks on the roof deck but the prices are outrageous. I travel a lot and never had a drink for 18 euros. Also, if you want any advice on how to get somewhere, ask the ladies at the front counter. They are the most helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but ...”
Reviews.Author: pna
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from staying here for three nights. Hotel was really nice though I don't think I'd say it was a 5 star luxury hotel as described! Room very comfortable, large and clean but surprised at no turn down service at all throughout stay! Ordered tea when we arrived from room service as were on a late flight - price was pretty ridiculous! Rooftop views were excellent but again, drink prices were a bit silly. Can't comment on the food as we didn't eat at the hotel at all. Good location though and very friendly staff and probably would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay for one night.”
Reviews.Author: sixnohit
Reviews.Content: I thought that Hotel Majestic was a very beautiful and elegant hotel. That being said, I found it a little boring. Maybe it was just the area. I stayed at Hotel 1898 on La Rambla earlier in the week and I found it to be a much more lively hotel...again I'm sure it was the area. The staff was very helpful. I needed an extension cord for my CPAP machine and it was waiting for me in my room when I got back from dinner. Speaking of dinner, one of the check-in specialists suggest a fantastic tapas bar a couple of blocks away from the hotel. It was trememdous. So if you're staying at Hotel Majestic and you want fantastic tapas, ask about Cerveceria Catalana. You won't be sorry. Oh by the way, make sure you fill out a comment card. You get a free gift. I got a very pretty mug.

Reviews.Title: “5 Stars?!?! You're kidding, right?”
Reviews.Author: SupersonicFlyGirl
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying at the Hotel Majestic. I had my business travel agent book this hotel based largely on the reviews on TripAdvisor. Upon checking in, I asked about the size of the room, as I had read some reviews complaining that some rooms were quite small. (Also, as I was checking in, I overheard 2 people trying to change rooms because they weren't happy with their first rooms). I must compliment the front desk clerk who helped me check in. She was extremely nice, but when I asked her about whether my room had a view or was a nice size, she frowned and said, that yes, indeed, I had been booked in one of the smaller rooms, but a nicer, larger room was available if I was willing to pay more. Since I have been traveling on business in Europe for more than a week and desperately needed sleep, I decided the extra charge was worth it for a better room, so I took it. While the room does have an extra sitting area, I have to say that this room is NOT of 5 star quality. There are marks on the walls, the furniture upholstery is worn, and the overall qualilty is more of a 3.5 star hotel, as far as rooms are concerned. There is also the annoying LOUD sound of water rushing through pipes on the other side of the wall of the room, approximately once an hour. The lobby area is nice, and the general location of the hotel is quite good, but as a business traveler, I really want the rooms and beds to be nice and comfortable. This marginally passes those criteria, particularly for the price for this room. Also, there is no ethernet connection so I am connected to a wireless connection that is not very reliable. Location (and some good online reviews) were the deciding factors in choosing the Majestic. However, having been here one day already, I am disappointed and wish I had gone with my first inclination to stay at the Hotel Arts. I would encourage the Hotel Majestic management to update the rooms and also encourage restaurant staff to make foreign visitors feel a bit more welcome.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bazaEssex
Reviews.Content: just returned from a 3 night stay at the majestic, despite arriving 3 hours early, the hotel had our room ready in about 15 mins. the room was exactly as requested and we were very impressed with the service by the whole staff, the room was cleaned every day to a very high standard, we had breakfast every morning and it had a good selection of food it made for a terrific base to explore barcelona, we look forward to returning next year but this time for a longer stay

Reviews.Title: “For a 5 star hotel where the official ranking does not go above 4, must do bette”
Reviews.Author: dubbles
Reviews.Content: we were pleasantly surpised by this hotel - for a relatively cheap package deal we were expecting a lot, lot worse. Location was fantastic, rooftop bar and pool lovely (albeit expensive!) . Slightly annoying were the lifts that wouldn't take you up there at 11pm, despite the bar being open until 1.30am! I agree with other reviewers though that turn-down service and cleaning of rooms was erratic. Can't comment on the breakfast or the other facilities on the hotel as we didn't really make use of them. A big problem was the beds. Although very comfortable indeed, two small beds pushed together does not a romantic holiday make.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lance11
Reviews.Content: Nine nights in June. Spectacular one-bedroom suite which extraordinarily exceeded every other suite that I had during my month trip to Europe. The Majestic referred me to and outstanding English speaking well educated personal guide. Breakfast was superbly prepared and served. The roof-top pool was small but was a nice respite for cocktails and a gorgeous roof-top view of Barcelona. The cigar lounge is unparalleled.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not spectacular”
Reviews.Author: MuttonHead
Reviews.Content: Staying for 6 days. The rooms in general are typically sized for a big city, small. We upgraded when we arrived to a more expensive room because the one we were put in was among the smallest in it's range, lower floor, and smelled of smoke. I'd hate to see what the base level room looked like. Also as might be typical of Europe, although I'm not sure, there is no iron supplied in the rooms. Maybe I'm just a spoiled America. Doesn't Motel 6 have irons? Indeed the location is excellent although noisy at times. The rooms are well sound proofed but that will only go so far when it comes to a horn happy culture. It is perhaps among the best locations in Barcelona as far as access, shopping and just plain action. As for the service it was OK but not great. Turn down service seemed to have vanished after the 2nd night. Oops they must have been listening, someone just showed up while I am writing this review. Now I won't have to call for towels. Also a call for a sewing kit the other night required a second call after it the first failed. A little nerve racking when your trying to make a dinner date. The roof deck offers a great view of the city with a small pool area, well equipped fitness room, and sauna. It can get busy. Unfortunately we did not get a chance to try the restaurant but heard it is among the best in the city, and as such is difficult to get into. The included breakfast buffet is excellent. Overall it is a decent hotel but does not overachieve, I would say it is average for the price. It seems higher end hotels just keep getting more and more expensive, but the service always seems to lag if not decline. The week dollar doesn't help the perception. I'm thankful for the relatively inexpensive wine and comparable food prices because a trip to Europe these days is not for the faint of heart when it comes to affordability.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...but disappointed”
Reviews.Author: berniss
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through our cruise line and felt comfortable that our 6 star cruise line would choose a very fine hotel for our stay. First the positive: the breakfast was excellent (one of the nicest we have ever had in Europe) and the location was very close to the information center, Ramblas, the tourist bus, and the Gaudi sites. We felt very safe walking in this area, even at night. We were to receive a prestige room and were expecting a room like the one pictured on the website. Instead, it was merely a classic room (the base room) with a balcony. The room and bathroom, while tastefully done, were quite small. Other cruisers, who stayed at various four star properties in Barcelona, and visited our room, said our room was not as nice as theirs and they paid considerably less. While the room wasn't miniscule, we paid for more, according to the picture, and expected more. Additionally, there was no concierge available and when we made restaurant reservations each night with the front desk , each night the reservations were wrong. The first night, the gentleman at the desk rang the restaurant we were told no reservations were needed and to go directly to the restaurant. THere was a long line and we had to wait for 40 minutes. The next night, even though we wrote out what we needed, the time of the reservation was wrong and we found out that they made the reservation an hour earlier than we requested. There was no confirmation as we are used to in a hotel of this class. Even room service was lacking, for two days they never emptied our waste paper basket. Lastly, porterage was supposed to be included in our package, yet our porter, who was very nice, told us he was not informed of this and wanted his tip. It was very embarrassing. We have stayed at a number of four and five star hotels and were disappointed at the poor service levels and value for our money. It is certainly not what one expects of a hotel of this calibre.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but some concerns”
Reviews.Author: peachtulip
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in the beginning of June with my husband. It's located in a central location where it's easy access to many shopping areas and tourist attractions. Hotel staff are generally friendly. The roof top pool is small but it's well worth an afternoon spending up there. The breakfast was well worth too - great selection and comfortable environment. Two issues with my stay - first, the floral arrangments that were displayed throughout the hotel in the first few days of my stay were made with strong scent of lilies. Some people might be allergic to that - I personally had to cover my nose when walking in. A more thoughtful selection on the flowers might be a good idea since guests travel from all over the world and allergy is quite common in some countries. Second, we brought a periodical on the plane to read and put it in the bathroom when we got to the hotel - it's a weekly paper that my husband had collected over 15 years, not one single issue was missing. Two days before we checked out, we found that a corner of it was torned. We thought it was just an accident by the maid. Then the day before we checked out, we found it missing. So the next morning when we checked out, we notified the front desk and the staff there had us write down our resident address and said he would check with the maid. I was disappointed that no one apologized or showed any regrets about it - we are still waiting to see if it can be found and mailed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent location, expensive breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Florida_Orlando_2007
Reviews.Content: Majestic had excellent rooms, excellent location, courteous bellman and staff in general except for the front desk people which were a bit detached and not nice (a simple smile goes a long way especially in the service industry). Breakfast was $21 euros so it gets expensive with 2 children however they cut us a break for the kids and only charged half. Having said that, the breakfast was the BEST breakfast we had in Europe. The cheeses and other cold cuts were awesome. Great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: admg1963
Reviews.Content: This was my wife and my second visit to this hotel, this time with friends for the England game against Andorra in late March. We were not disappointed. We got a great deal from [--], which included a very good breakfast. The difference maker for the Majestic is definitely the location - most of the sights are easily accessible from here and you don't have the crowds and tat of Las Ramblas. There are loads of great tapas bars (Ciudad Condal at Rambla de Cataunya 18) and restaurants (El Glop, also Rambla de Cataunya) to name but two within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “4 stars hotel not more”
Reviews.Author: taftaf
Reviews.Content: We did arrived at 24h00, with 2 larges laguages and the bell boy was near by and did not come to help us . The check-in at the reception was fine but at this time we were the only guest arriving . the bad surprise was the size of the room, we did booked a superior room and get a standard one . our room was the smallest one at the hotel . I did complain twice time and no body had the courtesy to give me any answear. Only one answear " just leave a message to the general manager " by the way i still waitibng the answear . Breakfast is correct . I can tell that the hotel should be 4 stars and not 5 stars .

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Curt44Wantagh
Reviews.Content: I researched the Barcelona hotels for over a month and decided on the Majestic because of a referral from one of my wife's patients. We rented two rooms as I took my granddaughter and our neice joined us as she was just finishing a semester in an exchange program. I had read some conflicting reviews and was concerned about our future stay. I was impressed that the marketing manager took the time to answer negative responses that where posted on this site. Our rooms where as described, maid service excellent, room service excellent, buffet breakfast worth the 20 euros. My only complaint is that the hotel does not have a person to help with restaurant recommendations or tour help other than all the people work at the front desk. They try but I like someone who will spend the time and effort to help me over my stay. I still rate our 7 day stay as excellent and would stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, welcoming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pat6
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Hotel Majestic in Barcelona for a night this week. It was a wonderful stay. We reserved a regular room and when we went up to our room we were delighted to find that they put us in a junior suite with two balconies overlooking the Passeig de Gracia. Everything about the room was elegant and comfortable, from the sitting area to the beds to the large bathrrom with a jacuzzi tub/shower and another large shower. We came home to find a large fruit tray and a bottle of water in our room with a card welcoming us to the hotel. Our only, very slight, problem was when we decided to watch a movie in the room. There were no descriptions on the screen so we chose the only movie listed as a comedy (one we'd never heard of). It was actually a drama, somewhat of a thriller or action type movie. We mentioned that when we checked out and the man at the front desk immediately offered to take it off the bill (we declined since we had watched the movie). The people who work in the hotel were all very nice and very helpful and it's in a perfect location for seeing this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Highly Recommended.”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneGDerbyshire
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel, with real class and quality service. My husband and I stayed at the Majestic for three nights booking in 3rd March 2007, and from the first sight of the hotel to the last we were impressed all the way, from the look of the hotel from the outside to the well dressed doormen, amazing reception area, smart in appearance and manner are the reception staff and all very helpful and pleasant. Our room was at the front and overlooked the wonderful Passeig de Gracia, I agree with other reviews that the rooms are not large but neither are they tiny, they are very quaint but most importantly they are spotless and smart. The bed was very comfortable and it had beautiful white crisp quality bedding and there were lovely bathroom accessories which were replaced every day. We were pleasantly suprised when we were also greeted with a complimentary bottle of champagne, a lovely touch as it was my husbands birthday. We ate in the hotel on the first night in the restaurant on the ground floor, the tapas was fantastic and again the staff and service was excellent, five star plus if you ask me! We also had a drink at the bar on the roof top which does have fantastic views, and we had a drink in the bar on the ground floor listening to the wonderful tunes being played on the piano, qualtiy all around. Yes the drinks in the hotel are more than you would pay in an english bar but the views and atmosphere are well worth the price for the special occasion. I would not hesitate to recommend this to all family and friends, the hotel is immaculate, the staff are very helpful and friendly and the location is just perfect. The hotel is worth every penny, it is really worth saving up that bit extra and staying here. Thank you to all the staff at the Majestic for making our stay so special and exceeding all our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot beat the location”
Reviews.Author: anonMidlands
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very central. All the designer shops are within the same block- Chanel is actually built within the hotel! we opted for a superior room which was small- god knows how small the standard room was.... Do not eat in the restaurant unless you have alot of money..... straters are 30-50E and mains and 50-100E's!!! there are some nice restaurants off the side strreets along the Passig De Graci. Le Ramblas runs adjacent to Passig De Graci. The cathereral is just about in walking distance, although only go if you think it's a must see as it resembles a building site- full of scaffolding. The roof top pool is amazing- Cannot beat the view- we went early March and it was so hot I got sunburned! Also eat lunch on the beach next to Porto Olympic- very nice restaurants on the promenade and very reasonable. So to sum up the hotel is amazing..... staff very helpful and polite. The street is the most fancy in all of Barcelona and the location was incredible, but if you want a larger room opt for a suite. It is advisable to learn the basics in Spanish- not all the taxi drivers speak English- one didn't understand the word 'beach' Barcelona is so beautiful I will definately be going again

Reviews.Title: “The Majestic Majestic”
Reviews.Author: AndrewCromwell
Reviews.Content: I have just returned this evening from a five day stay in the Hotel Majestic on Paseo de Gracia in Barcelona and would heartily recommend it. This was my second visit to Barcelona - for the first I stayed in the Eurostars Grand Marina, but fancied something a little more central – I was not disappointed. I chose the Grand Marina because of its close proximity to the port as I was taking a cruise, however for strolling around the city it is a bit out of the way. A taxi from the airport will cost between 20-30 Euro. Pros Location, Location, Location – The Majestic is only five minutes stroll from Barcelona’s main square (Placa de Catalunya) from where you can begin to walk the Ramblas. There are two convenient Tourist Bus (19Euro for 1 day or 23Euro for Two) stops close to the hotel and this really is the best way to get around the city. Quality of Furnishings – The room was beautifully appointed and spotlessly clean. The corridors and lifts are also fresh and airy. Quality of Service – Staff were able to cope with any queries I had and I certainly never felt that they were straining to understand English. The staff serving Breakfast also have good English. The breakfast is good, well laid out and tasty – complimentary newspapers are also provided at breakfast. (Main UK newspapers are also readily available from the small newsagents situated along the main avenue). Proximity of Dining Locations – in Barcelona you cannot help but partake of Tapas. There are plenty of small to medium sized Tapas bars located within easy walking distance of the hotel (along the Paseo de Gracia). I would recommend Café Gollege (or Moulins) and Qu Qu for excellent food and service (both also have menus in English). The Majestic has two restaurants, but I did not try either of them. Cons There are very few Cons with the Hotel Majestic. But, in the interests of balance I will provide a few that I noticed: The air conditioning was not switched on in the hotel until our third night. I did ask reception on the first night when I found it didn’t work in our room but was told that they do not switch it on in winter. Coming from the UK we wouldn’t class 22° as winter! Hot plates are not provided for the breakfast buffet – heated food gets cool very quickly when placed on a cold plate! Enough with the negativity! This is neither a pro nor a con but if you prefer a near-silent night’s sleep (as I do) I would recommend taking one of the rear facing rooms in the hotel. The Paseo de Gracia is a beautiful tree lined avenue, but carries a heavy volume of traffic and I would imagine a room looking directly onto the front to be noisy. If you are thinking of holidaying in Barcelona and want a 5 Star, central location within easy walking distance of all amenities and the excellent Tourist Bus system – then choose the Hotel Majestic.

Reviews.Title: “It is exactly as it says on the tin, MAJESTIC!”
Reviews.Author: ckennedy7
Reviews.Content: Arrived at hotel at night, and were greeted by reception staff and porters who were english speaking and took our bags up to our room. The room was moderate size and the bathroom was very stylish and clean. plasma tv with english tv channels. view was of back of the hotel - parking and backs of other buildings, but we did not request front facing (would have been lovely as view is fantastic).
