The hotel is on a main street and guys beware as chanel is built into the hotel with all the BIG brands within footsteps of the hotel! dangerous when your with a spendaholic. placa catalunya is about 5/10 min walk not far at all where you can get the tour bus and walk down to la rambla! hotel is in an amazing location for these sights! We had a couple of drinks in the hotel but as youd expect paid 5* prices, lovely though and great service! We would definately recommend this hotel for a weekend stay! its nice to stay in for a novelty but if u were staying for a week then a 3/4* somewhere on the same street would be ideal

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel28
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Majestic Hotel during a long weekend to Barcelona in July. I had read some not so good reviews on Trip Advisor but after great investigation of other hotels in the area decided that the price and location was right. The hotel is very well located right on the Passeig de Gracia. This is a large boulevard filled with designer shops and restaurants as well as Gaudi architecture and frequent stops for the tourist bus. The room was nice and the bathroom large. I had upgraded to a Superior room but like other reviewers on the site I was not sure what more I got for my money. However I liked the room and we were at the end of the hall and on a quiet street. The room had all the normal amenities that you would expect of a good hotel, toiletries, bathrobe, slippers etc. – plus a comfortable bed. The TV had a good selection of satellite channels including BBC which is unusual for European cities, we usually only get the English news channels. We did not use the gym, room service or eat at any of the restaurants but we did use the pool on the rooftop. This was a great place although a bit crowded during the late afternoon when everybody wanted to get some late sun and have a quick dip. But that was ok because I knew it would be like that and prepared myself for it. I was just pleased that it had a pool as they are hard to find in city hotels. The pool area however came into its own in the evening. After a walk along Las Ramblas (which I have to say I didn’t like – a bit too rough for me) – it was wonderful to come back to the hotel and enjoy a nice glass of wine sitting up on the rooftop overlooking the lights of the city on a beautiful summer evening. Yes it was expensive – but you get what you pay for. If I had my choice between an expensive glass of wine on the roof of the Majestic or a cheap beer on Las Ramblas, I know which I would choose. Barcelona is a great city and there is a lot to do. We took the train out to Sitges and spent the day on the beach (well a few hours – it was 40 degrees) – plus we saw all that you should see in the city by using the tourist bus which allowed us to get on and off all day. If we went back to Barcelona we would have no hesitation in staying at the Majestic again – however we never tend to return to a place twice – there are too many places in the world to see.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but expensive”
Reviews.Author: Nico1611
Reviews.Content: Excellently located, just steps from "it all" in Barcelona, the Majestic is a true 4 star hotel. The rooms are quite functional, though standard rooms are a bit small (we had two, a standard and a nice superior). Service is overall impeccable, the fitness room on the rooftop a nice surprise, and so is the (unfortunately small) pool and the view from the roof. Breakfast is very generous, varied, and good. We didn't have a real chance to try the food at the hotel, for there is plenty of choice in Barcelona, but it seemed all right. On the down-side, this hotel is rather expensive, but the fact is accommodation is rather expensive in Barcelona, especially in the summer time... It is also a bit large, and it will seem impersonal to some.

Reviews.Title: “Worthy of its Name”
Reviews.Author: JDERV
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Majestic more than 1 year ago, however I feel compelled to comment on this wonderful hotel after reading numerous other reviews. My experience with the Majestic was superb from check-in to check out. I found the staff to be very helpful. My room was a Jr. Suite with nice windows which opened to the Passig de Gracia - very nice feature. The amenities in the room were worthy of a 5 star hotel. The decor was modern and the room was very clean. The hotel fitness center is quite nice as hotels go. The equipment was new and the locaton on the same roof deck as the pool made for a very enjoyable time when finished. The views of the city from the roof top are oustanding. I did not eat in the hotel restaurants - however I did have some drinks in the off-lobby bar and again the service was incredible. I have no bad comments for this hotel - which in these days of travel is a fine statement about the service and facilities available at the Hotel Majestic. Outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Sheer Class”
Reviews.Author: Kebablover
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th visit to The Majestic. Our previous trip being in March. On this occassion, we were given a fantastic room. As a last minute present for my wife at xmas, I booked 4 nights over the festive period. Reservations were kind enough to allow us to book the same room number. When we arrived, we were greeted with a very warm welcome and told our "usual" room was ready. It is no wonder that The Majestic has won a major hospitality award. If you have a few extra pounds in your budget, book a deluxe room. They are very spacious. How many times have you booked a suite and never used the lounge? This is the best of all worlds. My wife and I have stayed at some of the worlds top hotels and appriciate the nice things in life. You just know that this place works bloody hard to look after their visitors. Room number......... ah! that would be telling!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for exploring Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: KeithStanhope
Reviews.Content: In these days when "five stars" is an over-used description of hotels, how refreshing it was to discover an authentic five star hotel that offers good value for money accommodation, tip-top housekeeping, and a high standard of customer care. Sure, it's expensive to drink in the hotel bar, but you get what you pay for. Breakfast was included in our package and was the only slight disappointment - great choice but not the highest quality. The roof-top pool area is fantastic, even in winter. Good location for many attractions and excellent nearby restaurants, cafes and tapas bars.

Reviews.Title: “Very Expensive”
Reviews.Author: VHarris
Reviews.Content: Me and my Husband stayed in the Hotel Majestic in August 2006 for 3 nights. On arrival we were shown straight to our rooms without a problem. Went down to the lounge bar were we had a Vodka and Lemonade & White wine, this cost 40.00 euro's, hence to say we never drank there again. The room was clean and spacious but without the view we had booked. No Tea or Coffee in room. To order this they wanted to charge us 5.00 euro's each for the milk and 5.00 euro's each for the coffee plus the tip the room service always expect. On another note, overall the Hotel was clean, elegant and the staff friendly. The Roof terrace was to die for - Fantastic and the views were breathtaking. Would stay there again but would research area a bit more instead of getting ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Majestic”
Reviews.Author: Wickedone64
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 day trip to Barcelona. Stayed in the Majestic - wonderful hotel, excellent location, excellent service. Lovely city, easy to get round - the hop on hop off bus tour service was brillant. Never mind that we didn't speak a word of spanish as long as we could say gracias, buenas dias, hola and a few others we were fine. The room we were given was lovely - comfortable and clean. We dined in the restaurants, had room service, used the gym, had a massage. Everything was just wonderful. The views from the top were absolutely fantastic. If it was warmer would have used the swimming pool. The best thing about this hotel is the staff - they were wonderful -couldn't fault the service - nothing was too much trouble. Will definitely stay here again. Have pnly one tiny suggestion for the manager - don't know if it will be feasible - it would have been wonderful if there had been a choice of face, hand and feet treatments as well as massage.

Reviews.Title: “The most horrendous service i ever had to endure”
Reviews.Author: u2thousand
Reviews.Content: In a 4-day stay, not ONCE did housekeeping answer the phone. That is NOT an exaggeration. i called 3-4 times a day only to hear it ring incessantly. Occasionaly the Front Desk would answer the phone and then you had a 33% chance of getting a towel. Room 143 was very noisy (mechanical noises) at certain times of the night. Room was clean and nicely decorated.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: lw83
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the majestic last summer with my boyfriend for ten nights and it was absolutely brilliant. it is in a perfect location for sightseeing, being a short walk from las ramblas and from a lot of gaudi sights which i particularly loved. check in was swift and our luggage was taken up to our room very promptly. our room was lovely, it was not a suite but i believe it was the next up from a standard, the bathroom was small but it was nicely decorated and had everything you would want. we also were very fortunate to have our own small balcony as our room was situated just on the corner of passeig de gracia. on our first night there, we came back from the terrace to find we had been left a massive complemetary fruit platter and a bottle of champagne in our room which was really appreciated. the terrace was beautiful, especially at night as it has amazing views of the city. the pool is very small but then it is just a rooftop pool and was good enough to step into when it got too hot. the staff were on the whole very helpful and polite although certain reception staff were sometimes a little off hand with us. I would definately reccomend the hotel to everyone and will hopefully be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “No customer attention! Overrated!”
Reviews.Author: T.A.User123
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, we cannot recommend this hotel at all. We booked the hotel upon research on tripadvisor for a leisure trip to Barcelona and booked an offer package online on their homepage. This offer included breakfast and a "Barcelona-Bus-Ticket". Upon arrival we were advised that for whatsoever reasons this package was not available, and the price of the room stated on the page for the package is, therefore, merely for the room, i.e. excluding breakfast and ticket. After discussion with the reservation departement, we addressed this disappointment to the manager ("Mr. Bruno Chiaruttini" who also comments on the reviews on this page) who then claimed that the package was not even booked by us. We explained how the booking on their own (!) website ("Offers/Packages") was proceeded and that if he indeed dares to argue that the package was, in fact, not booked, their system is not only misleading but, in fact, fraudulent. The "complimentary" offer of Bruno to solve the obviously unsatisfying situation was rather ridiculous: the breakfast was offered on € 29 net p.p./per day, which meant, in fact, a reduction of appr. € 4 compared to the regular price - and, as a matter of fact, excluding the ticket contained in the original offer!!! Further and even more embarrassing, the staff at reception etc. were quite rude and unhelpful. An urgent document sent by email to be forwarded to us as the guests in the hotel was not pro-vided to our room or handed out to us. We were not even noticed, it was only handed out reluc-tantly upon explicit request at the reception. Service is the least which you can expect and require in such a hotel! For us, the service and customer attention was a disgrace and, therefore, we would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Apple
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Majestic is an imposing building in Barcelona - absolutely beautiful inside and out. As we travelled to Barcelona in December, the city already had a festive feel to it, but the hotel was tastefully decorated with white lights - so luckily we could always spot our hotel if we thought we had got lost. Our room wasn't cheap but I think we did had a budget room - although it was still very plush. We did have an internal wall on the other side or our window, but that did mean there was no street noise. The hotel was perfectly located for transport and walking around the city. I would definitely recommend this hotel. The view from the top floor (where incidently there is a small roof top pool) is amazing, including all the fantastic sites of the city. Great to see at night time.

Reviews.Title: “nice but expensive”
Reviews.Author: jay101
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for 2 nites, and thought it was really nice. But it is insanly expensive.. €8 for a bottle of beer in the hotel - ok i wasnt paying (thank u boss) for anything so didnt have to worry :) the roof top bar has a pool and a fab view !! but the bar staff there are soooo slow.. i think they are told to work in a certain way and thats that - no deviation allowed. Rooms are nice, nice comfy bed, power shower. its in a good location metro v near. staff that i had contact with were friendly and helpful. we had dinner in the restraunt which was ok i though (its has a michelin star ) but others thought otherwise and went to mcdonalds a few mins away after ;) all in all, nice hotel, but i certainly couldnt afford it. (again thank u boss.. :) !

Reviews.Title: “Great roof bar”
Reviews.Author: kulov
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the middel of the city, the rooms were ok, but what really makes this hotel is the roof garden, pool and bar. During the day and night you can see right into the heart of the city. Unfortanely the hotel lacks the glamour of the Arts. Be sure to ask for Steve the head bar man on the roof bar makes great cocktails.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pantani
Reviews.Content: Myself and a group of friends stayed for 3 nights over a weekend. All of the staff were very helpful, speaking excellent English. The location is excellent, within 150m of 2 Gaudi buildings and perhaps a mile from the Sagrada Familila, it is a very stylish part of town. The gym is more than adequate, with bikes, treadmills, stairclimbers, some free weights and a multi gym. The rooftop pool is small, more of a plunge pool than anything to swim in, but perfect to cool down in. I thought our twin room (504) was small, the beds were cosily close together !! but the room is otherwise well appointed. The walls must be thin, as I could hear the taps running in 503. The TV had Sky News, BBC 1&2 and ITV, plus a number of other European channels. Didn't eat in the hotel. We went to the indoor Cart racing track, it's about a Euro 25 cab ride away, I'd never done it before and thought it was great fun, if you're going, prepare to get sweaty. Clearly for any sport fans the Camp Nou is an experience not to be missed and it is easily accessible from this hotel on the Metro (which is very easy to use) or in a taxi. Taxis are cheap in Barca, but I do live in London !!!

Reviews.Title: “Most beautiful hotel in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: Kitt_J
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Majestic for two nights prior to going on a cruise. We loved it from the moment we walked into the beautiful lobby. The staff was very professional and treated us very well. They all spoke excellent english. We chose this hotel because it was an older hotel that had been renovated. Therefore, it maintains its stately charm, but still allowing us all of the modern conveniences. The breakfast buffet was wonderful. It was within walking distance of Las Ramblas and just a couple of blocks from the subway, which took us to other beautiful sights in Barcelona. Our vacation was a trip of a lifetime and we will probably not get the opportunity to get over to that part of the world again. Hotel Majestic certainly added to the magic of our dream vacation.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay again at the Majestic”
Reviews.Author: Keung
Reviews.Content: Another great short break stay at the Majestic. This is a very good hotel, we had stayed there a few times before and knew what to expect. We booked a junior suite which was modern, clean, spacious, and necessarily cool with the air con. We had also paid for the buffet breakfast in advance which was very good. Great location for doing most of the touristy stuff with a Metro station located a very short walk from the hotel entrance. Do not fear the Barcelona Metro - it is generally, quick, efficient, clean, and all the trains have air con. Our suite had 2 showers in the bathroom area and jacuzzi. The seperate seating and dining area had plasma tv just off the bedroom area. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will be returning to the Majestic next Summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: quicktravel
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in the Hotel Majestic. We booked a double privileged room after I read the feedback on the classic rooms. We were upgraded to a junior suite since I had requested twin beds and they only had a double bed queen size. It was a cozy room and we enjoyed it even though it did not face the Paseig de Gracia. Try the Citrus and the Attic restaurants for a good dinner at reasonable rates. The location was super , close to La Rambla. We had an offer on breakfast 10 euros per person, it was a good deal. Would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Never judge a book by it's cover”
Reviews.Author: BarnetB
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Majestic in August 2006 for 2 days. I had been to Barcelona previouusly and thought the Majestic looked beautiul from the outside and liked the location so I booked it by myself through the hotel. I found the front desk extremely unhelpful in offering any assistance upon our early arrival. I also asked them to please make a dinner reservation for us that evening and they neglected to call until late in the day at which point it was totally booked. However, they lied and said the restaurant was closed for the month of August. I sensed the lie and I called the restaurant from my room and found that the restaurant was open but fully booked. I also was very disappointed in my room. I would never go back to this hotel again. H. Seltzer (NYC)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Pool”
Reviews.Author: wilson1208
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. The room was large, very clean, beautifuly decorated, "large" bathroom. The views from the rooftop pool were amazing. The concierge was great on attractions, however, on dining, one of the places recomended was Bice -which is wonderful, but we can go there in NYC or Vegas, or such. However, overall experience there was excellent. It is a larger hotel, and on return trip I would want to try a smaller place -however, that might mean not having that amazing pool...

Reviews.Title: “Pricey & Excellent - First Class Eoropean City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tagoladad
Reviews.Content: Ok…here we go…We left JFK airport on Thursday afternoon July 13. We had a 5:40 PM flight that arrived in Barcelona at 7:45 AM on Friday. Although JFK was a little disorganized, Delta was just great. The flight was smooth as can be. When we arrived at BCN (Barcelona airport) we waited on a very short line (maybe five minutes) to pass through customs and immigration. Our bags were waiting on the carousel and we grabbed a luggage cart (there are no sky caps at the Barcelona airport and the luggage carts are free to use, just walk to the side of the carousel and grab one) and proceeded to the taxi stand. There was a long line of taxis waiting. We knew from these boards that the fare for the cab to the Majestic Hotel should have been around 25 Euros and it was exactly that price. We arrived at the Majestic about 9:00 AM. Great Hotel. As this was our first time in Europe we had nothing to compare it to, but we have stayed in the Plaza Hotel (not so great) the Waldorf Astoria (very nice) The United Nation Plaza (very nice) in New York, The Fairmont in San Francisco (best bed we ever slept in) as well The Princess in Acapulco (beautiful grounds) so even though we’ve never been to Europe we’ve been to a couple of nice hotels and the Majestic was certainly nice. We had room #701, a junior suite overlooking the Passeig De Gracia, the hotel is situated between two Gaudi buildings, the Batllo and La Pedrera. The hotel is just a few blocks from the top of Las Ramblas (there are definitely hotels a lot closer to Las Ramblas) and is on both the RED and BLUE line of Bus Turistic. The staff and concierge at the hotel were excellent. Everyone speaks English, the hotel was immaculate, the staff very friendly, and the room huge. We freshened up and hit the streets. When my DW and I talked about jet lag with our friends, everyone advised us “not to go to sleep” so we didn’t. Even though we hadn’t slept the entire evening (save for a few winks on the plane) we forged ahead and went for a walk and breakfast on the Passeig De Gracia. After a nice omelet at an outdoor café we bought tickets for the Bus Turistic and made the Sagrada Familia our first stop. The church is quite impressive from the outside so we decided to go inside as well. The line in front of the bus stop was huge so my DW and I figured that we would just walk around the church, see the whole thing take a few pictures and get back on the bus. As we circled the block we found another ticket window around the corner that had absolutely no line, so we bought tickets and went inside. There is an elevator that goes to the top, but the line was very long and we didn’t want to wait. We asked if there were stairs but we were told that there weren’t, so we just walked around for a little bit and left. My DW then walked through the small, limited gift shop but didn’t get anything. Across the street from the church was a great gift shop that had some really beautiful things. We went to a local supermarket in the neighborhood, walked around a little bit and then got back on the bus and made the Parc Guell our next stop. The bus stops on at the bottom of the hill several blocks from the parc. It is a long uphill climb on a very narrow street to get up to Parc Guell. It was very hot (the middle of the afternoon in the middle of July) but the views from the Parc were well worth it. The parc has a beautiful entrance (mosaic dragons and lizards line the steps) and the columns, corridors, open spaces and buildings are really incredible. The panorama overlooks all of Barcelona. Just an incredible view. There is a small snack stand with shaded umbrellas at the top where we enjoyed some ices. We then took the outside path of the parc down to the main street, which led us back down the hill to the bus stop. By now it was about 4:30 or 5:00 PM. We took the bus back to the Hotel Majestic (seeing quite a bit of the city along the way) and took a short nap and got ready for dinner at 9:00. The concierge recommended a restaurant called Botafumiero. It is a seafood restaurant that had great fish and Paella. With wine and tip, dinner for 2 was 100 Euros. Certainly not cheap, but we loved it. When we arrived at the restaurant at 9:00 PM we were one of the only diners in the restaurant. When we left at about 11:30 the place was packed. We took a cab back to the hotel to get ready for tomorrow. We woke up Saturday morning and my wife asked me to look at her watch to see what time it was. I asked her if she had changed her watch to Barcelona time. She said she had, and I said “well, then it’s 12:15 PM. She made some comment about my age and my ability to see small numbers so I checked her cell phone and sure enough, it was 12:15. We felt great but we had slept for about 11 hours. We thought it was a small concession to the travel and the time change, went down to the internet café at the hotel (20 Euros for the duration of your stay), did our business and then I went out to get us some coffee and rolls. We are both big coffee drinkers so we didn’t mind the espresso that they serve in Spain. Got dressed and then took a cab down to the Plaza Catalunya, so that we could walk down Las Ramblas. After a few blocks of the human statues, the bird salesman and postcard kiosks, we took a left hand turn and entered the Barri Gotic (the Gothic Quarter). We found ourselves in front of a beautiful church and sat down at a café (Estruch) for pizza and salad. The plaza was a beautiful place to have lunch and watch the action. After lunch we began our search for the Picasso Museum. We only had the map from the Bus turistic (and because the museum is not one of their stops, it’s not on the map) so we really weren’t sure where it was. We saw some signs pointing in the general direction of the museum and we gladly followed. The time that we spent lost (there is no other word for it. We didn’t know where we were or where we were going) in the Barri Gotic was magical. We loved it. We found wine shops (you can bring wine on the ship, but I’ll talk about that later), alleyways, incredible architecture, friendly people and eventually the Picasso Museum. The line was about 25 minutes and the entrance fee about 8 or 10 Euros. My wife loved the museum and all of Picasso’s works. I’m not as sophisticated as she is, so she tolerated my opinions for the 45 minutes we toured the museum. After we left we walked toward Port Vell. It was a pretty good walk to the port, but we were there to see Barcelona so we didn’t mind. The port is fantastic. I’m not sure which part was old and which parts were built for the 1992 Olympics, but the cool breeze, open space and views of the Marina were beautiful. We walked all the way down (and it was a pretty long walk) to the bus stop for the Bus Turistic. By now it was 8:00 PM (although it seemed like the middle of the day) so we took the bus back to the Batllo (the stop closest to our hotel) and got ready for dinner. We wanted to visit an acquaintance in Barcelona so we asked the concierge to change our dinner reservation at Aqua to 10:30 PM. By the time we finished our visit and got down to Agua (a great restaurant on the beach) it was after 11:00 PM. The hostess wasn’t too happy that we were so late for our reservation so she made us wait till 11:30 for our table. We sat at the table closest to the Mediterranean and settled in. By the time our food came it was midnight and the restaurant was still packed. I guess it’s true…they have dinner at midnight in Barcelona. Food was very good (service just OK). Wife had fish, I had chicken. With wine and tip, about 65 Euros. Grabbed a cab back to the hotel about 1:30 AM to get ready to board the Jewel in the morning. I guess that since we were doing a pre-cruise, we should have packed our luggage with that in mind. I would definitely recommend packing a bag for your pre-cruise and then packing bags for your cruise. We spent a lot of time on Sunday morning having to repack all of our luggage. On Sunday morning, again, I went down to the Fresh and Ready (that was the name) to get coffee and croissants. After breakfast and packing we left our bags with the hotel to do a little last minute sightseeing. We stopped in the Casa Batllo (a famous Gaudi building on the Passeig De Gracia) for only a moment. From the brief glimpse we had it was great. We bought a few souvenirs, took a stroll around the neighborhood (everything was closed on Sunday morning. The streets were deserted) and then went back to the hotel We didn't eat at the hotel nor did we order room service. The staff was incredible. Very friendly. Very Helpful. Always interested. Never seemed like they were too good to help us. Rooftop pool area is really cool. Great views of the city. Nice gym. The Hotel was immaculate. Bed was tremendous. There is a 3 for 2 night special so make sure you take advantage of it. Three nights at the hotel were 800 Euros. Location was incredible. Nicest section of city. For any questions email me at Tagoladad@aol.com and put BARCELONA QUESTION in the subject line

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms”
Reviews.Author: LAT10258
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in July and thoroughly enjoyed the hotel. We booked a junior suite which was superb, with a fantastic bathroom. Hotel was very clean. We had booked "room only" but on check-in were offered breakfast at 2 for 1 - good deal if you get it. Did have a look at the rooftop pool but it was very crowded. Some of the reception staff could have been a bit more helpful but dining room staff were excellent and very attentive. Drinks in the bar were expensive. Good location and we would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Majestic!”
Reviews.Author: BonnieGo
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 3 who stayed in a suite at the Majestic 3 nights precruise. The suite was huge! It was like staying in your own apartment. The suite was very nicely decorated with one bedroom with a comfortable king bed, balcony, and plasma tv, livingroom with plasma tv, 2 bathrooms, small oval office with desk and comfortable chairs surrounded with sliding windows that looked out over Passeig de Gracia. There was a large entranceway with lots of closet space. There were double doors to block out noise. My son slept in a roll away bed that wasn't too comfortable. One suggestion that I would like to make is that this room should have a convertable couch which turns into a bed. If it had this kind of couch then this suite would sleep 5 which is hard to find in Barcelona. The staff were wonderful. We had lost luggage and at my request they frequently called the airlines to check on the status. They reassured me and delivered my luggage promptly when it arrived the next morning. We opted not to do the breakfast plan because it was too expensive. There was a wonderful cafe across the street where they had great pastries, coffee, and fresh squeezed orange juice. The rooftop area was beautiful with a great view, but the drinks were very expensive. A soda cost $9 euros. Great location near hop on/hop off bus, and many restaurants. From reading other reviews I think that if you stay in a jr suite or suite then the Majestic is a positive experience, a standard or deluxe room is less satisifying. I didn't see a deluxe or standard room so can't comment on them. Would stay here again if they keep the stay 3 pay for 2 nights special.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time !!!”
Reviews.Author: jools483
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of the hotel offer of pay for 2 nights and get the third free. We found the hotel to be excellently located in the busy designer shopped area of the city. The hotel itself was smartly presented with a smooth and friendly check in. The rooms were spacious and were equipped with air con, comfortable good sized bed and bath/shower. I was a little worried by potential noise as our room was located at the rear of the hotel near to, presumably, the hotel air con outlet. The double glazed windows and 'black out' curtains made for an extremely quiet and peaceful stay. The breakfast was excellent with a good selection to satisfy the most discerning guest. The bar at the hotel we visted was everything you'd expect with a lounge suited piano player and a good selection of cocktails, beers and wines. The hotel is efficient and friendly and is a good base for exploring the city. I'd stay again so I guess that is recommendation enough.

Reviews.Title: “Majestic was perfect for extended stay in BCN”
Reviews.Author: stuben
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Majestic for 8 nites and loved it. It's location is perfect for exploring all of BCN. The rooftop and pool were great! All in all , I would highly recommend this hotel and absolutely loved Barcelona. It has evrything. Great Architecture Museums, Food, Shopping, Beach. I hope to return someday!

Reviews.Title: “Take A Pass”
Reviews.Author: Stasch
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for five days on business/pleasure. Location is excellent, hotel is clean, but that's about all the place has going for it. --Service was indifferent, lots ot attitude from the older staff who seem to have lost interest in doing their jobs --Electronic room keys, recently installed, did not work at all. Came back once to find the room of my door open! (Fortunately nothing stolen). Several times I had to return to the desk to have them re-keyed. --Caught the bartender swapping wines on me, pouring a cheaper wine than the one we had ordered. He claimed it was an honest mistake but the reason I was watching him was because he had been doing it all week. --A car service that was supposed to pick me up at the airport never arrived. The hotel charged me for it anyway, because my flight was late. Apparently car services are unable to get the relevant information from the airports. --Construction was going on right next to my room--awoke every morning around 8 to the sound of hammers and electric saws. Requested a room change and was told the hotel was full. It's a straight up, intentional rip-off, not just poor service, so I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “peaceful elegance”
Reviews.Author: durhamsue
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Majestic for 3nights july 2006, we had been fortunate to book through an easyhotels special offer and received a comfortable discount which included breakfast. We certainly recommend breakfast plenty of choice and all very fresh. After reading various reports on tripadvisor we arrived open minded. The entrance and main rooms and staff of the hotel are 5 star but the bedrooms are more 4 star. As it was a very hot week, we were pleased to be at the back of the hotel (no view but very quiet) in an air-conditioned room which had large very comfortable bed and small seating area, flat screen tv with full uk channels. Decor of the room could have been more opulent but was fine for the price we paid, more crown plaza than intercontinental! However, the staff were very courteous and helpful. The view from the rooftop terrace at night is fantastic, because the drink prices include small pre-dinner snacks they are pricy however we paid the same for a beer (9euro) on the Ramblas, no comparison, the wine and cocktail prices might be a little steep for some pockets.e.g. (20 euro) The hotel is next to a metro and many of the cultural attractions. We would recommend the official barcelona bus 18 euro for 1 day 22euro for 2 days, fantastic value as we went from each attraction, waiting no more than 2 mins for next bus, being able to see sights of Barcelona as we travelled. Taxi from airport was 25euro but after meeting friends we returned from place catalunya (5 mins from hotel) on airport bus (regular) 2.75 euro. driver was not as scary! We stay in many city hotels and would certainly return to the Majestic.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great area”
Reviews.Author: sharonarn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Majestic from July 5-9, just returned today. The room was very pleasant and spacious. The buffet breakfast included everything one could want. This is very centrally located for walking to many sites. We definately would return again. The rooftop pool, though small is a nice touch. Just beware of the cost of drinks there. We had a drink rooftop before going out to dinner and it was quite steep but the view is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in the world.......”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have had the pleasure of staying at the Majestic Hotel in Barcelona twice now. In terms of sheer quality, comfort and customer service you will be hard pressed to find many hotels that can match it. The location is excellent for a nice stroll into the town centre and is also near to the metro. Rooms are absolutely spotlessly clean with effective air conditioning and blackout curtains. The breakfast buffet is simply vast and totally delicious. They will also look after your bags after you check out until you are ready to head off to the airport which is a very useful service. The roof terrace has spectacular 360 degree views of Barcelona, with a bar and small pool. I had my wedding ceremony on this roof terrace in June 2006 which the Majestic helped to organise along with a superb cocktail reception. If you want to stay in style and luxury then the Majestic is well worth splashing out on. All staff are very friendly, helpful and polite and there is a really nice cool and calm atmosphere about the place. In my opinion it is the best hotel in the world!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: telis
Reviews.Content: very good hotel above average. the lobby is very stylish and the room was large with a very large bathroom (bidet and toilet was in a separate area. service is excellent and breakfast amazing. the bar is a very nice place to relax in an elegant enviroment with live piano music at night. the roof top pool was the only thing that was dissapointing-very small. the views from the roof-top pool are fantastic. overall i can say this hotel gives you a majestic feeling afterall!

Reviews.Title: “Not Majestic At All (Awful Hotel)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My experience with this hotel was terrible; I've booked and paid a superior room and they assigned me a classic room which is extremely smaller than superior room and when I spoke to the front desk personnel he replied to me with a silly answer that superior rooms has some bigger rooms and other rooms are smaller! How deceive someone can be! Relating to their treatment; the Hotel front desk was rude, inhospitable and unfriendly. Finally, I don't recommend anyone to stay at the Majestic Hotel because of its overpriced rate and don't be deceived by the luxurious looks of the lobby because their rooms are really awful.

Reviews.Title: “Majestic by name...”
Reviews.Author: saracen777
Reviews.Content: Our four day stay at the hotel was literally fantastic. We had booked a Junior Suite because it was our anniversary and we wanted to push the boat out. When we arrived there was champagne and fruit in the room. I tried to connect my laptop to the hotels free internet service but had problems and reception arranged for two engineers to come to my room to resolve it. The room itself was great, fabulous bathroom, walk in shower, nice toiletries. The room was right on the Passeig de Gracia but you wouldn't know it until you opened the door and stepped out onto the balcony. The hotel was very expensive but it is a five star hotel and in a fabulous location. The buffet breakfast was another highlight but we only ate there once preferring to eat out in Barcelona where the locals ate. Each night the turn down service placed chocolates on our pillows and serviced our room which was a very nice touch. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, unfortunate city”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in mini suite... worth extra expense, judging from poor experience of those in "classic" rooms. Our room(s) were cleaned well, somewhat spacious, furnished acceptably. The King bed was two sep beds cobbled together and one could tell that, but it was ok... perhaps too hard for our taste. We found staff to be very helpful and upbeat. They really were a major plus of our stay at Hotel. The bar and food service were acceptable and accomodating. Food prep was quite good if not the best. We were not disappointed with our stay, and might well use Hotel again, because of its location and its staff. In no less than a mini suite however. We found the city of Barcelona to smell (sewerage) almost every other block. The city is not a clean city. It has a kind of dog eared quality to it that must have shined brightly at one point but is definitely over the hill now. Whole city needs housekeeping. Ramblas et al is ok, but same commercial greenway situation is found in a number of cities. Streets, walks chronically crowded. Signage is desparately unhelpful and I can't think of any attraction that does not have a superior conterpart in other cities and locations (beach, mouuntain park, cathedrals, winding "old town" alleyways, as charming as can be, full of folks wishing to sell you something). We caught some ladies in process of lifting our wallets in street. But this can happen anywhere. Nice town, but not unique. The grubbiness of the city overwhelms what ever charm it maintains (and there really is some). This city has amazingly good PR. But we cannot recommend it. Won't be back. Wish the Majestic existed in different city.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a Majestic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: threeoaks
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Majestic for 3 nights in April and have nothing but positive things to stay about our time there. We booked the hotel having read good reviews on this site but became concerend closer to the time of our trip due to some more recent bad reviews about the hotel - our fears were misplaced. We made use of the 3 nights for the price of 2 offer and decided to book the best room we could afford so chose a superiour double rather than the classic room. We were not disappointed. Upon arrival we were greeted from our taxi and our luggage was taken care of for us. We had a large room on the 7th floor (721 if you want to ask for it!) with a huge, comforatble bed, a well appointed bathroom and most impressive of all was the balcony and views over the Passeig de Gracia. We felt quite spoilt. Throughout our stay we found staff to be friendly and helpful and nothing seemed to be too much trouble. We were lucky with the weather and did enjoy a relaxing drink at the pool bar one afternoon and, although expensive, thoroughly enjoyed pre dinner drinks at the piano bar one evening. We did NOT eat breakfast at the hotel as this was rather expensive but found a wondeful cafe right opposite where we ate toast and te each morning. The name of the cafe/restauant was Sumam and it was lovely. we also ate there one evening and would certainly reccommend it. Bareclona is a wonderful city and out time there was enhanced further by a wonderful stay at the Majestic.

Reviews.Title: “Majestic Arrogance”
Reviews.Author: Shant
Reviews.Content: I travel to Barcelona very regularly, and I chose to stay at the Majestic recently, only down to its location and promised services...... and also a curiosity from having passed the hotel on several occasions. I would say that the hotel is very average in every way. It is an old hotel, hence you cannot expect huge functional rooms. Their website tells you classic rooms are 20 sq metres...they do not hide the fact that their classic rooms are tiny, however, images on their website are not representative of the actual rooms, for instance, the bathroom in the image under classic room is not the bathroom you will receive; the bathroom will actually be very small and will require the agility of a gymnast to navigate. When I brought this up, the point was ignored. Wireless internet was also advertised.....could I get reception? Only by holding my laptop in the air at a strange angle, in a strange position! For a 5 star hotel, the bar is reasonably priced. The food may perhaps be decent....they will tell you that Drolma has a Michelin star, however, when hot food is served very cold after a very long wait, it is difficult to ascertain quality (and no apologies made either). 5 star? Well, yes and no. In Spain, stars are awarded convincingly on facilities, not quality. I have not often experienced such average 5 star facilities with tacky unimaginative decor, but they do what they do and they do it well enough to run a ‘successful’ hotel. Having had a look at the better rooms, I would suggest only staying here if you were prepared to pay the extra for an upgraded room. I would suggest staying elsewhere rather than a classic room unless you are supremely interested in location and you are not bothered by impolite staff and ineffective service, though the classic rooms are very cheap, so this may sway you. If you want good service and a good all round experience, stay elsewhere. I would perhaps make some suggestions to the hotel, however, I have read some of the responses made to other reviewers on this website, and I find these to be rude, unhelpful and argumentative.... similar to the attitude when face to face with the front desk staff. I would rather just move on to a different hotel than waste any more time with this hotel. Barcelona is a lovely, bustling city, so the Majestic will not really have a problem filling beds, however, some time in the future, they may need to rethink things.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gwen88
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the strength of its website, which you really have to check out, especially the location part. We were treated like royalty from the staff of the hotel. For example, they helped us book a great Flamenco show and got us front row seats. The rooms were beautifully appointed and so comfortable. There is a fabulous bed with a duvet and feather pillows and black out drapes that really worked to darken the room. Even our location on the street was dead quiet thanks to double paned windows. The hotel is in a great location, in the more upscale part of downtown but within easy walking distance of everything. The tourist bus stop was a block up the street and was the crossing of the two main lines. If they are running a 3 for 2 nights special like we got, you can enjoy a real five star hotel for a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, staff in all departments excellent. Couldn't recommend it highl”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I arranged a conference for 100 sales people from all over Europe to this hotel, and bearing in mind that many could not speak English, I couldn't have wished for a better venue. all the staff were excellent, very kind , and very courteous.Everything was spotlessly clean, and the food brilliant. Rooms were very tastefully furnished, and beds comfortable with wonderful smooth soft sheets .The location is fantastic, within walking distance of all the main attractions, in the best part of Barcelona. I just want to be able to go back soon, and this time to be on holiday!

Reviews.Title: “avoid "classic" rooms”
Reviews.Author: Zuerich
Reviews.Content: We left that property with very mixed emotions. The reason for booking it was the exceptional location: close to everything within walking distance there is no better choice under that point of view. But apart from that I think that there is no reason to stay there. My wife arrived a day before me, being a young, single travelling women. Was it a coincidence that she was given the room next to the elevator, courtyard facing with a very strange, convoluted layout with a small window in the corner between the bathroom and the wall, so it was like a room without a window? Of course somebody has to take the bad rooms, but why allocate it to somebody who has booked for 5 days and not to somebody who just spends there one night? So we were given another room. As we opened the door, a wave of very bad, acidic smell came out. We called the front desk and the person who came round wrinkled his nose and admitted, that there was a terrible smell, assuming that it was the new carpet of the remodelled room. Well, if their new carpets smell like this, I dont want to know about the old ones … Room number three, not expecting much anymore, was very small too. Between the bed and the bathroom there was the desk with a minibar, a small table with two chairs and the closet with a rack for a small suitcase. Furnished like this, there was no space for putting a regular suitcase on the floor leaving space for walking around it so that we either had to close it and put it uprigth or climb over it when we wanted to go to the bathroom. Truly exciting when you have to get up at night. Now we definitiely were ready for a drink. But the minibar/refrigerator was not working. As we do not like warm drinks we called for ice cubes (no ice-machines in the corridor) and maintenance. The electrician arrived before the waiter and fixed it. Than the ice-bucket came and we were informed, that we had to pay 5 Euros for it. For a bucket we needed, because the fridge was broken and the drinks were too warm? In a 5 star property? Come on, that’s realy bad style and cheesy. Beeing very small, the air in the room was sticky. Usually we like to leave the windows open. But in this case we preferred not to, because the fire stairs were crossing the window. So we switched on the A/C. There was air coming out of the outlet but it was warm. We put the thermostat to the minimum, but still only warm air. We asked several times for reparation at the front desk, but nothing happened. Why not offer to have another room with a working A/C? The best thing about the room was the housekeeping. Very efficient and immaculatly clean all the time. The toilet was tucked between the washbasin and the wall so that one had to squeeze himself diagonally on it. The lobby, bar and restaurant were very stylish and arranged tastefully. The breakfast room is located in the basement (no windows). The food-quality was very good and the service very efficient. On our visits the breakfast room was crowded and the acoustics were quiet bad so that the overall experience was not very pleasant. The female front-desk staff were very nice and helpful, whereas male stuff were rather presumptuos. Example? We were asking for directions one morning, when suddenly the employee turned away from us starting a conversation with somebody more interesting than us. Probably the stay would have been better, if we had booked a de luxe room (130 Euros more per night). But how could we know before? When booking in a 5-Star property one can expect a certain size and standard even in the least expensive room. But the „classic“ rooms in my opinion are definitely substandard in terms of size, layout and location. Of course in the hotels website it’s noticed that they are only „approximately 20 square meters“ (they should add, that they are dark and the samll window only gives a view in a grim courtyard) what would be barely acceptable if of regluar shape. But in such a tubular or strange layout, it's much worse and clearly not acceptable. In my opinion, the very narrow rooms I have seen, should only be furnished with a small bed and sold as single rooms only, as for two persons they defintively are unreasonable in a 5-Star property. Next time in Barcelona we will go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Choice: Hotel Majestic”
Reviews.Author: Boscobel28
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 days at the Hotel Majestic in March,06: room, breakfast and location were excellent. Would upgrade from Classic Double next trip, as double bed is not too large. Staff very professional; roof top pool/bar is very relaxing after a day of experiencing this wonderful city. Best restaurant finds: La Tertulia(Les Corts area)and Tragaluz(Eixample).

Reviews.Title: “An OK hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: lohit
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 24-27 February, the weekend after the 3GSM conference, which is probably why we were able to pay for 2 nights and get the 3rd night for free via hotel.com. I have stayed in a lot of hotels - from 5 star to really basic, and for this place, overall, we had mixed feelings about the hotel. On a positive side.... - great location, right outside a metro station, beautiful vantage point on a corner, really close to Las Ramblas - really beautiful facade, lovely lobby, friendly staff However, on the negative side... - our room was average - 3rd floor, it was 'courtyard' facing and on the third floow - we had a double bed, the bathroom was ok/nice, but we were definitely expecting more given the impressive facade of the hotel - the funishings were again, ok/nice, but we were expecting a lot more - I chatted to reception to see if we could move to a better room, but the additional cost was prohibitive - my impression was that they werent that busy, given it was just after the 3GSM conference, so a goodwill upgrade would have been appreciated, but I guess we didnt want to pay any more than we already had, so I decided not to push it. As per the previous review... - we didnt notice any issues with the traffic or neighbouring rooms - we didnt eat at the hotel at all - we had breakfast at the little cafe across the road which was really affordable and nice - there are lots of nice tapas places on the neighbouring side streets which are cheap and fun When we go back to Barcelona, I dont think I would stay here again - it has a good location, but I feel I would be able to get more value for money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Pad0303
Reviews.Content: We stayed in January as part of a 'special' break for my wife. As per a lot of the other reviews, the Hotel has a superb location however the rooms are small and not that well appointed. We paid for a Junior Suite - I had intended to stay at Hotel Arts (as this was a special occasion) but in the end decided to stay in the city centre (shame cause the wife is still disappointed). The room was small by any standard (after reading managements reply to another such comment), when we checked in we were only looking to relax, we decided to try the more casual on-site option - the same place as breakfast is served - it can only be described as a badly converted conference room, having said that the food was good and service spot -on. We went to our rooms looking to order a movie and relax - alas the pay TV system was not working, after approx 10 enquiries over the coming 2 days it was eventually fixed for our final evening - imagine the disgust after dining early on that evening when we sat down to realise the most recent film was over 3 years old (in a 5* hotel!!!!!!!). Great location, overpriced rooms, very poor attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for shopping”
Reviews.Author: Harpesharp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Majestic for 3 nights from 19th Jan 2006. We booked a junior suite for 385 Euros per night directly with hotel using the 3 nights for price of 2 nights offer. Managed to get Breakfast thrown aswell which is not cheap. The hotel is excellently position on one of the upmarket streets of Barcelona called Passeig de Gracia. This is prime shopping belt and the flagship Zara store did very well after my wife had been sales shopping there. Also close to a Gaudi building which you can view inside and not far from Metro if you don't want to walk too far. Taxi's are not too expensive either. Top of Ramblas are is a 10 minutes walk. The hotel was nice, but not as opulent as that of the one in Rome that we stayed at. The Drolma restaurant was excellent but very expensive and only recommend if it is a special occasion. We also went to other excellent restaurants like the Fernandez (5 minutes from hotel), Barcelonetta (in marina area), and Tapas Tapas. We were well looked after and had good advice from Guest Relations. The room was spacious and had good views of the main road (make sure you ask for a room with this view). Air conditioning was not great more of a heater and did not pump out cold air. Bring a travel iron as they don't have them, they did kindly supply a steam iron - but this kept tripping the electricity supply! Bathroom great for this room type, great shower and also an additional bath with hydrojets to relax after much walking. Worth it if for a special occasion, beware the temptation of too much shopping, lucky we had a spare suitcase.

Reviews.Title: “A class act”
Reviews.Author: Peter&Ann
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Majestic for 4 nights in January 2006, paying €180 per night for a “Classic” room + breakfast. It’s a top-class hotel and we’d be happy to return. The Classic room size was fine, though I note some previous reviewers found rooms too small. All staff we encountered were excellent - highly professional, helpful and friendly, without being intrusive. The breakfast buffet was excellent, with too much choice for those of us with expanding waistlines. We didn’t try the hotel restaurants or the bar (too quiet). Eating out: Our preference is for lively, bistro-type restaurants, rather than hushed temples of haut cuisine. If you prefer the latter then ignore the following: On C. d’Enrique Grandos, Flamant and La Polpa were enjoyable as was La Rita on C. d’Arago. La Rita was unbelievably cheap but I recommend you avoid any dessert “smothered in chocolate”. Citrus, above TapaTapa (avoid), on P. de Gracia was also fine. From a visit last year, the hard to find Café de l’Academia, off C. de Jaume 1, is worth finding and Senyor Parellada on C. de la Argentaria was also enjoyable. La Crema Canela off Placa Reial was fine, though lunch at the adjacent Les Quinze Nits was disappointing. If you’re one of the “Beautiful People” or simply a “Grade A Poser“, then the restaurant for you is Moo at Hotel Omm, a couple of blocks further up P. de Gracia. If only I was 20 years younger and 20 kilos lighter…. We booked with alpharooms[-] but nearer the date the hotel's own website offered the best value available online.

Reviews.Title: “Not the luxury you are promised!”
Reviews.Author: NAT_LEEDS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Majestic just before Christmas, for our first stay in Barcelona. On arrival, the hotel had mixed up our booking and booked us 2 rooms instead of one - and tried to charge us for the mix-up. After getting a 5am flight from Manchester, this is not the best start to our trip. I finally produce my booking letter confirming their mistake. Further more, i ask for a room with good views - the attendant smirked and replied - "Your are in the Deluxe Room, that does not get you a good view - this is a 5* hotel!" Wonderful! The room was really poky, that you catch yourselves on picture frames walking to the bathroom as the bedroom room is narrow. Pros Location is good Brakfast is of a good quality and good selection Cons Rude reception staff poky rooms Not worth the money - there are better 5* hotels for less money Cheap complimentary toiletries - for a 5* hotel, there was a poor selection.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: KyleWeeks
Reviews.Content: Despite what they say on their website, this is not a 5 star hotel. That aside this is a nice European hotel. The location is great. Only a 10 minute wlak to las Ramblas, lots of shops and restaurants just outside the door. Room sizes are average by Eurpoean standards (small by American standards) but very functional. Some nice touches, they provide a robe, slippers and turn down service. On the down side they room was rather warm, the only way to cool it down was to open a window. Unfortunately, the street was noisy, so you could not have the window open while sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Tighter space than a ducks ---”
Reviews.Author: Big-Penguin
Reviews.Content: 5 star hotel i don´t think so.... ªRoom was the size of a rabbit hutch and the service at check in was average for a travel lodge! The whole point of a five star hotel is to feal spoiled but all we felt was ripped off, a bit like all fur and no knickers!! Location is too far out compared with the Gothic quarter, the view from the roof top pool was great but unless your can swim in 2 inches of water dont expect to go too deep in the roof top pool

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: benjaminmelton
Reviews.Content: stayed for our honeymoon. basically the best hotel we have ever stayed in. location was amazing, room was beautiful, hotel was gorgeous, swimming pool on the roof!!! what more can we say. also a bargain!!!!!! loved loved loved loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, Refined Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RobinLloyd
Reviews.Content: We are just wrapping up a delightful long weekend at the Hotel Majestic. They are running a 3rd night free special, so we opted for the Junior Suite. It is gorgeous, large and modern, with views overlooking Passeig de Gracia. The location could not be better, just a couple of blocks from La Padrera and an easy walk to most sights. The lobby is quiet, and it's easy to slip in and out without having to deal with a bustling tourist scene. We have not tried the restaurants or room service. Per the earlier reviews, they are prohibitively expensive. With so many cost-effective options right outside the door, there's no need to splurge. I cannot comment on the standard rooms or other features (no need for the pool or rooftop deck in winter), but we have truly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hands-down a fantastic place!”
Reviews.Author: RebyGeneve84
Reviews.Content: The image of Dali’s drooping clock never felt more poignant than my recent visit to Spain. With many miles traveled - San Francisco to London to Paris, my final stop was Barcelona, a spiritual home, where the locals have a convivial knack of extending time. Admittedly, I did not go to Barcelona to sleep – yet I could not have stayed at a better hotel. The Majestic combines style and grace with extraordinary comfort. The staff was excellent and attentive. When I asked the concierge for an opinion of the best places to drink wine, eat tapas, enjoy music, I was delighted to receive prized recommendations – secrets that most locals might selfishly guard. The Majestic is wonderfully located. For luxurious retail, the hotel is in the heart of it all. For a pleasant walk, Las Ramblas is only a block away, and it conveniently slants toward to sea coaxing one’s stride along a street of sumptuous sights and experiences. Street entertainers, outdoor cafes, architecture and people elevate the soul. Barcelona is a place not only to observe art, but to experience it. From the time you get up in the morning until the wee hours of the night, the city rewards those who subscribe to whole-hearted living. Enjoy it all. And know that when your body tires long before your spirit, that your room at the Majestic awaits you. Your bed will be turned down - its arms open wide. Your pillow will cradle you, your blanket embrace you. By morning you will be restored. And if you are lucky enough to have an extended stay, you can enjoy another day and night of extending the best of time. A majestically-invigorated traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic - Truely Majestic!”
Reviews.Author: Laurasaurus
Reviews.Content: Returned a week ago from a long weekend in Barcelona staying at the Hotel Majestic, we didn't want to go home! I've stayed in a few 5 star hotels including New York and London but none beat the Majestic. It was a special birthday for my fiance and we had booked a superior room but we were upgraded to a junior suite on arrival. The room was absolutely fantastic, a huge room with a sperate seatng area and a large bathroom including a walk in shower and jacuzzi bath. The room was at the front of the hotel and there were two sets of double doors with two small balconies overlooking the passeig de gracia, the view was incredible. A bottle of cava and fruit were delivered to us on arrival which was such a nice touch. Everything about the hotel was luxurious and elegant and the staff were so helpful, they couldn't do enough for us. The hotel is in an excellent location, walking distance away from all the major sights and right in the middle of the action. The tourist bus stop is just across the road and is the best way to do your sightseeing. We didn't visit the Drolma restaurant but it looks really nice, we did visit the other restaurant downstairs in the hotel for our evening meal one night and the food was lovely. Breakfast is held in this restaurant each morning aswell and is brilliant and well worth the 20 euros which I have heard some people on trip advisor complain about, there is so much choice and something for everyone even my fiance who is a fussy eater enjoyed it. The bar is really nice and the cocktails are delicious! We loved to relax in there after a busy day. The 10th floor is the rooftop pool area and has a breathtaking panoramic view of the city. We went up there on our last night before our evening meal and sat and watched the city lit up at night. I'm sure there's more things I've forgotten to mention but all in all we had such a happy and memorable stay, I would definately recommend the Hotel Majestic to anyone and we can't wait to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I last stayed in this hotel over 40 years go and have longed to go back and my husband and I finally made it this year. We stayed from 1-5 October and had a truly wonderful time. The hotel has obviously changed since then but the staff and management did everything to make our stay special as it was also my birthday. We stayed in a classic room which is not as small as people have been complaining about. It is a very nice room; there was more than enough space for two people and the bathroom was very nice too. We ate breakfast at the hotel and that was very nice also as you had an excellent choice of foods to enjoy. Majestic Hotel is centrally located for all sightseeing and shopping and is in a beautiful and very safe location and walking distance to many sights. This is a wonderful hotel. We'll definitly be back - sooner rather than later.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: Misschic
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in April with my boyfriend. After reading the reviews we were a little concerned as it is not cheap. We soon found out we need not have worried. The hotel was in the best possible location. Our room was at the front of the hotel with a balcony. Although this looked out onto the main road, noise was not an issue. The room was average size (don’t forget this is a city centre hotel). There are plenty of café’s just outside the door where you can sit outside and get breakfast or refreshment. The roof top terrace has wonderful views and a very small pool. We used the sauna which you hire for private use; this was a wonderful way to relax after a busy day. Our room was spotless as is all public area's. Staff are all friendly and courteous. Hopefully visiting Barcelona again and I really don't think I could stay anywhere else. We had a look around some other areas – The Marina & Las Ramblas but they really didn’t compare to the Majestic and its fantastic location. I hope to be back soon

Reviews.Title: “Nice but nothing extraordinary”
Reviews.Author: Ricardfred
Reviews.Content: Having read some great reviews on Tripadvisor I decided to stay at the Majestic. Here are my views. First the good points. The hotel is in a great location. Near a Metro stop and underground rail station. Very safe location. Great shops nearby and stunning architecture. Turistic bus stops outside. When we arrived I was impressed with the professionalism of the desk staff. I had booked the Discovery pack which included a Classic room, breakfast and tickets for the turistic bus for not much more than room only price. They had my pack ready when I arrived and also upgraded my room to one with a side street view, a nice touch. The room was immaculate and the hotel as a whole was very peaceful. Things I didn’t like. I would consider the room small. The easy chairs for example were not very comfortable, so you would not be spending time lounging in the room. This was fine as the city is great and you are out all the time. My big disappointment was the bar. It’s tucked at the back of the lobby with no windows. The prices for drinks there are over the top. About $16 for a Bacardi and Coke! Therefore we drank there once only and learnt our lesson. Drinks are a third of the price at a next door cafe and you can also watch the passing show. Breakfast is no great shakes. Poor choice and lukewarm coffee. The lobby is boring. I like to sit and watch people come and go. The lobby area is small and you can’t really sit about. The roof was nice but small so sun loungers were taken all day. Its also very hot up there and no shade. Overall, although above average,I found the hotel very expensive for what it offered. Its very nice and a quiet oasis but I think I would try out another hotel the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfecto!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff and especially Paula Castillo, have been absolutely amazing. Nothing was too much for them even though we changed a lot during the course of the week. The hotel itself is gorgeous and we were glad we picked this hotel to hold our EMEA Leadership conference. If we ever deceide to come back to Barcelona, it will definately be in Hotel Majestic!

Reviews.Title: “High prices at the Majestic.”
Reviews.Author: pj270744
Reviews.Content: We were recommended to the Majestic Hotel by a Barcelona native but found our stay was affected by the very high prices both for food and for the bar. We suspect, that as the hotel is used by the business crowd, the two restaurants and bar are geared towards people on expense accounts. The price for the buffet breakfast is a very high 20+ euros and the prices for the Drolma restaurant are as much as 40+ euroes for a main course. The bar prices were also very high and a small bottle of diet coke was 6 euros. Having said that the room was very comfortable and very quiet. The staff were friendly and helpful. My wife and I found that the best option was to simply walk a few yards to one of several cafes where we could get breakfast and that we ate dinner either at one of several good restaurants in the area or took the metro down the the port area. Sumsum, opposite the hotel is recommended.

Reviews.Title: “This is a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TonyWoking
Reviews.Content: Just come back having booked for a couple of nights as a Wedding Anniversary treat This was an exellent hotel, room was great (we had the Classic) with plenty of room (no view though), breakfast was first class and the staff were terrific. I lost count how many times they changed the towels. We didn't eat in for lunch or dinner as it was just so cheap to go elsewhere as the hotel was in such a great location. Would recommend. Few Tips - Book directly with the hotel (hotelmajestic) especially their Discovery Barcelona packs as this includes breakfast and free Turistic Bus tickets (worth €17). The prices beat anything else I could find and didn't always get offered the pack. - The Aerobus from the Airport is probably the best way (and cheapest) to get to the hotel as it is straight outside arrivals takes about 30mins and cost €3.60. Don't do like we did and get off at teh Place de Catulunya as the stop after it gives a much shorter walk (100m) to the hotel. - Don't buy a beer from the cafe's in La Rambla as they rip you off....0.5litre cost €8.75 which they don't mention when you buy their food (which is reasonable).

Reviews.Title: “Still the grandest of them all”
Reviews.Author: Everton
Reviews.Content: Hotel Majestic has recently emerged from a thorough overhaul to retake its crown as the city's finest 5 star, in my view. Everything's tip-top, as you'd expect, but best of all are the bar staff in the guests' lounge: friendly, professional and allowed to use their initiative (thanks for the free drinks, guys!). Just remember: if you want to claim a lounger for the day on the rooftop terrace you've got to be up early. Worth it for the stunning views. One final top tip: make sure you book Sunday brunch at the Gran Hotel La Florida on top of Tibidabo - the best value 50 euros you'll ever spend. We were served bubbly until we popped - 4 bottles, and still the waiting staff returned! Knockout views, great food, great service: it's a must do.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: francisjon
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just returned from a nine-day stay at this hotel and we were extremely pleased with all aspects of the Majestgic. The service is excellent and the staff very friendly and helpful. Somewone did complain that breakfasts were expensive but there are so many great little cafes in the vicinity that it was no problem finding a place to eat. John and Chris

Reviews.Title: “15 in my group had a lovely time at the Majestic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'll keep this as short and succinct as possible.................Why we liked staying at The Majestic (The M from here on in) for my stag weekend: 1. The M is not where you would typically choose to stay for a stag weekend - it is a plush 5 star relaxed and quiet hotel and we were a respectful lot, all in our late 30's and early 40's. it is ideal for couples who want a quiet romantic time just as it is ideal for leisure and business groups 2. Staff were all friendly and helpful - much more so than many other 5 star hotels, ordering us cabs willingly, advising us of good night spots and cultural tours and giving us prompt and friendly roof top and room service 3. The rooftop pool is a perfect place to unwind, regroup, re-energise, get some sun, take a dip, order an ice cool drink or a tasty snack, all with a beautiful view of Gaudi's Sagrada Familia a couple of blocks away and right in the heart of the Paseo de Gracia (the most majestic of Barcelona avenues), the posh shopping district and a hop, skip & a jump from the Ramblas 4. "Superior" rooms have lovely views of the City, and you can block out all the noise with their double doors or open them wide to let the sunshine and Barcelona atmosphere in to your room. The Privilege rooms are even nicer with balconies. 5. The friendly front desk man, Tim, ordered us a comfortable and air conditioned coach service at a very reasonable price from and to Barcelona International airport - about a 35 min journey each way 6. All my correspondence with The Majestic booking staff (Natacha in particular, and Bruno) was carried out promptly and in a very friendly business-like manner - very helpful and patient staff 10 out of 10 and quite a few of us will definitely be using The Majestic again, next time with our loved ones, and in my case, with my loved one, my wife to be.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: art3007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Majestic on a three for two offer in a double room.(5th 8th sep 2005) i was anxious initially as i had read that these rooms were small. I didn't find this to be the case. There is room for a table and two chairs the tv and the bureau it sits on. The bathroom was spacious and beautifully kitted out. With an excelent hairdryer, very important for us females!!. I would certainly book a double room again.We didn't have any views but to be honest we were up and out in the morning and didn't return until 8ish before heading back out for dinner so it didn't concern us. I didn't use the restuarant as i read on this site that it was expensive and there are loads of places to eat nearby. What i would say is avoid any of the touristy restuarants on the ramblas we used one and the food was awful. Okay for sitting with a jug of Sangria and people watching though.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: jbw64
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 nights at the majestic. We consider the hotel to be in an excellent location (5-6 mins walk from plaza catalunya and 1-2 mins from a tourist bus stop) and also in a nice shopping area. the room was a decent size, located at the back of the hotel (so no noise). The lobby was nice but the bar appeared to be very quiet. We did not eat or drink there except for breakfast once which was very costly at €20 pp + vat. There are nice cafes & bars nearby which are a lot cheaper. Overall, We enjoyed our stay there and would go back again, for the location alone.

Reviews.Title: “Midweek treat at Majestic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned to UK after a stay at the Majestic and thoroughly enjoyed the place! We were on a bit of a budget and got a 3 for price of 2 night room rate and at a shade over £300, room only, for our stay. I'd say it was fair value for a 5 star break. Hotel was spotless, room a good size, even with a rollaway bed for our 5 year old daughter. Had to ring them direct as online booking wouldn't allow 3 to a room but it was no problem and cost no extra. View was of the wall of an adjoining property but so what? You get what you pay for I guess. On the plus side a quick trip to the rooftop decking and pool gave us all the views we could wish for! That said, pool was barely 3m x 5m and chilly despite the blazing temperatures. Spent a fair amount of time up there though. Staff were exceptionally helpful and they really did know their stuff about local sights and eateries. The Olympic marina has now got loads of restaurants from your basic to the top end and Tim at the hotel ensured we had a memorable meal at one he recommended to us. Thanks Tim. We skipped the very pricey hotel menus and bar and savoured lots of nearby cafes for breakfast. Would definately go again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Honkycat
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 nights in The Majestic. I must say I was extremely impressed with the hotel and it's service. The room we asked for was a "privelege" one which is a couple of notches up from the basic. I wouldn't recommend going any lower than this as our room was just about ideally sized (some people have complained about the size of the basic rooms). The room was beautiful... tastefully decorated, very clean and with a huge comfortable bed. There was a little balcony with fabulous views down the Passeig De Gracia which is a great and posh road to be on. We had Cava and sat at the balcony before going out each night... very civilised. The pool on the roof is small, but is just really used to cool off when you've been lying on one of the lougers enjoying the stunning view. The location is ideal.... 10 minutes walk from La Rambla (although personally I didn't like it) and the main square. The tourist buses pass the hotel. We didn't eat in the hotel (it IS quite expensive for food and drink... but hey, it's 5 star) but there are loads of excellent Tapas Bars and restaurants nearby. There's a great restaurant just acrooss the street and right a little called Costa Galicia... excellent, and another to the opposite and to the left calle Tenorio...also excellent. A couple of reviewers have also mentioned the staff being unfriendly. This wasn't our experience at all. We never passed a member of staff from check-in staff to cleaners without them saying hello and smiling (and we WERE asked if we had a nice stay as we checked out. So, it's quite expensive, but we'd do it again... becouse we're worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at The Majestic, Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weeks stay at The Majestic and we have had a wonderful time. The hotel location is ideal for sight seeing, shopping and for both port vell and port olympic where all the seafood resturants are and any livelier nightlife you might want to participate in. The hotel is well maintained and the service is both attentive and friendly without being imposing. The pool though small has plenty of decking and loungers and has great views over the city. one of the things that really make this hotel stand out from some others is the service and the room maintainance.
