We were very rarely bothered by housekeeping yet the room was made up twice daily, once in the morning and then a simple change of towels and bathroom lookover once you had left for the evening so that everything was fresh upon return. Barcelona is an amazing city and even if you are returning there after visiting previously there are plenty of things to do and see. If you really want to make the stay really relaxing and carefree choose this hotel and you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: magdonnelly
Reviews.Content: This hotel, for a four/five star hotel is very disappointing. The only good thing about this hotel is the location. The lobby is disappointing, the bar is disappointing (and very expensive) and the room was only average...not big, crap view (building across the street about 20ft away), and the roof top pool is a joke. Would not stay there again, and wouldn't recommend anyone to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and above average hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Majestic for ten days in July and were very pleased with the location as it is central to most of the shopping, cultural centres, art galleries, museums and restaurants. It is only a short walk to the metro which makes most attractions accessible in no time at all. We had booked a deluxe room and on our arrival the people manning the reception desk were most helpful and courteous. Our room was spacious, well-appointed, and quiet. The bathroom and the dressing area are bright and modern with a powerful shower. It has a large balcony which we hardly used as we were out most of the time. The TV is fairly standard and a port is available for connecting a laptop to the internet at high speed. We were provided with a cable to hook to our laptop and paid only 15 euros for the whole duration of our stay. With the heat in Barcelona at this time of the year in the high 30, we were very pleased to have a very efficient air-conditioning system. However, conveniences that are standard in most hotels - in-room coffee maker, cups, sugar, spoons and coffee - are not provided. Nor is an ironing board and iron provided, perhaps not to undermine the system in place, as the charges for having your clothes pressed are extravagant, especially for same day service. We actually checked to find out why this room service is not provided and we were told "for security reasons". We asked what was meant by it but we could not get a plausible answer. We had problems with the TV and the broadband service but one call and maintenance was there to fix them immediately. Our general impression of the hotel was one of indifference; rarely were we greeted with a hello or a smile or any interest shown in whether our stay was agreeable or not. At check out, we paid the bills and still no one asked whether our stay was a pleasant one and whether we had enjoyed Barcelona. We paid and we left... With the right room, one can have a very pleasant stay at this hotel as its location is really wonderful but it has a lot of work to do in terms of personal relations. If it manages to improve its PR and succeeds in making its guests welcome, we would rate it as an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dont be fooled by appearances!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a trip to Barca to see U2. First choice hotel was booked for the first night of our stay so booked the Majestic for the one night, and thank goodness that was all! from the outside this hotel looks fabulous, sadly, once inside it is a completely different story.Our room was a converted broom cupboard I think! Tiny window allowing hardly any light and no view. Had to manoevre furniture to access cupboards and not very clean. Couldn't wait to check out and get to somewhere decent! Friendly concierge though. If u must stay there ask to view room beforehand to avoid disappiontment!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Majestic!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived to the moment we sadly left, the Majestic lived up to expectations and more. We booked the hotel based on views expressed here and were certainly glad we'd listened! Although not the cheapest of stays (why should it be for such quality) we felt we has full value for money. Check in was easy and swift, even though we arrived two hours before normal checking in time, the room was fabulous, with plenty of room for the three of us (myself, my partner and child). The staff were always courteous and helpful, the bar staff in particular, making all of us feel welcome and important. Breakfast was equally good, with plenty of choice and a high quality of foods available (and those pictures on the walls certainly led to some interesting breakfast time discussions!). The area around the hotel was also lovely, with a variety of shops, restaurants ands bars and vary handy for the tour bus. All in all we can thoroughly recommend the Majestic as a home away from home and an all round excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “Warning - don't book a classic room!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked a 4 night stay at the Majestic based on the excellent reviews received on Tripadvisor. Having re read the reviews - everybody that raved about the rooms appeared to have booked a junior suite (or certainly NOT a classic room!). We booked a classic room and having looked on the hotel website it looked great. On arriving that the hotel (on the plus side - the location was great) the receptionist, on seeing that we had booked a classic room, immediately suggested that we upgrade to a "bigger and lighter room" for a mere extra 60 euros per night. This started to ring alarm bells and when we got to the room, we understood why! The furniture was good and the room as fair size BUT the room was extremely dark with practically no natural light (even in the middle of the day, all lights had to be turned on to see in the room). We immediately called down to reception and asked if we could be allocated a classic room with natural daylight only to be told (very curtly) by reception that all classic rooms are the same. To sum up - the hotel is generally very nice, the roof top area is lovely, mysteriously, the doorman don't appear to be there to open doors (when they are around), the receptionists range from helpful to rude (as previous reviewer said - when booking out - the staff studiously avoided asking us how the room was or whether we enjoyed our stay!). A bit of advise - if you have already booked a classic room - upgrade before you go - otherwise it will cost an arm and a leg to do so when you get there!

Reviews.Title: “Beware the Majestic! Preview your room if you must stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ok, so after reading all the glowing reviews on TripAdvisor, my wife and I booked into this hotel. I am sorry to say we were deeply disappointed. Room 822. I write this, so as to give other potential clients of the hotel fair warning. Firstly the Good: Location is fantastic, on the Passeig de Gracia an easy walk to the Rambla and a block from the Metro station. The reception and entrance is grand; flowers, marble, efficient staff The porter service, very sharp and friendly. The Bad: I think this may all have been the unfortunate (intentional or not) allocation of a terrible room. - The room was tiny, even by European standards (We have traveled a lot). The small table and chair infringed on the cupboard, so if one wanted to access the cupboard, you had to move the furniture. - The bathroom was even smaller, my wife and I could not be in this room together. The toilet is right next to the bath/shower, so getting out the shower was a challenge, and some dexterity was required to stand in the available space. Also mildew abounded in the shower - The bed creaked and squeaked. This was partially corrected by housekeeping. - Our room on the 8th floor was underneath the top floor restaurant, so every night at midnight the sound of dragging furniture woke us up. Calling the reception to complain got a quizzical response and the promise to send someone up to investigate – I never received a response to this. - The air-conditioning system is archaic. Every time the thermostat kicked in, the air turned on loudly, and when cool, turned off, loudly again, keeping up awake. - Upon checkout, they were very efficient at billing us, but not once were we asked about our stay. I did complete a survey, and wonder if anyone will see this? So in general, it was a disaster. This is certainly NOT a 5 star hotel. The glossy exterior belies what is inside. At 225 Euros per night, it is certainly not cheap either and I am sure better value can be found elsewhere. Suggestion: If you insist on staying, view your room beforehand!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: borntotravel068
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Barcelona staying 3 nights at the Majestic .. What a fabulous hotel! Before going to Barcelona I was unsure as to whether or not I should have booked The Arts, I'm so glad I didn't. The location of the Majestic is perfect, within walking distance to all the major tourist attractions. If we had stayed at The Arts we would have needed to spend a lot more on transport just to get around Barcelona as it really is out of the way. Everyone at the hotel is friendly and the service is great. The room was adequate - we had booked a superior and I'm not quite sure what we got for the extra we paid - but as we were out all day sightseeing and only came back to change or to sleep it didn't matter. Having the outdoor rooftop pool was also a great advantage after a day walking round Barcelona! My only criticism was that breakfast seemed expensive, but again that didn't matter as we walked to a nearby pavement cafe to have breakfast there and watch the world go by. All in all, a fabulous hotel with what I would have thought to be the best location in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Captain_Caveman
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night. This is a really nice hotel in a good location in which to explore the city and the added bonus of being on the tourist bus route. If you book a room here ask for one on the front of the hotel with a balcony as one of our rooms ended up at the back and looked out onto a carpark. Good value for money if you shop around for a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Both stately and up-to-date”
Reviews.Author: 118Martha
Reviews.Content: A friend and I recently stayed at The Majestic, which is located in the stunning EIXAMPLE section of Barcelona. We loved the location because we were within walking distance of many places we wanted to vist. Just up the street was Gaudi's La Pedrera (Casa Mila) and in the other direction Placa de Catalunya, the Gothic quarter with the magnificent Cathedral and Palau de la Musica. We had wonderful stores and small restaurants and tapas bars in all directions. We stayed in a junior suite, which was extremely comfortable. The seating area had plush chairs and a sofa, which enabled us to relax after sightseeing. Although we were on the second floor overlooking the Passeig de Gracia, the room was quiet. From our windows we could look across the street at some of the area's beautiful Modernista buildings. The breakfast buffet in a window-less but comfortable lower level was sumptous and got us started for the day. There were such typical Spanish dishes as Serrano ham and tortillas (made with potatoes). There were many kinds of pastries. I even had a fried egg because of the gorgeous organge yolks. Then I added a small baked potato half (topped with olive oil), something I have never had for breakfast. Once we stopped in the lobby lounge for coffee and another time for a light supper. We didn't get to try the expensive and very elegant restaurant Drolma. Access to a computer in the business center really worked for me. For Euros 15, I could use the internet as much as I wanted during my stay. It was great not looking at the clock when sending e-mails. The 24-hour rooms service certainly responded for us at 4:30am when I called for coffee and tea before our early morning departure. Another time when I needed a doctor, the front desk had an English-speaking doctor at my door within 20 minutes. This is a fine hotel with rates that are fair.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mustardmindy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Majestic for May 23 - 27th. We booked a Jr. Suite through Expedia (based largely on the reviews on this website) and the room was wonderful, on the 5th floor facing the Gran Via (main street). It was on the southeastern side of the building (room 504?) and had two sets of double doors with 2 beautiful small wrought iron balconies overlooking the street. The room and bathroom were spacious and there were double doors that could be closed between the bedroom and sofa area. Everyone who worked at the hotel spoke very good english and the roof top pool and view couldn't be beat - great partial view of Sagrada Familia. The fitness room was very nice - treadmills with t.v.s on them with CNN. Our friends were staying in the Claris (1 block away) and even though they had "the nicest room" there, it was dark and smaller and the rooftop did not have near as nice a view (although their restaurant on top had great - but pricey - food) Room service was always pleasant - they sent someone to fix our t.v. at 1am! And the location could not have been beaten. Overall a great experience. As an aside, after the first 2 days there was banging in the room above us. We complained and the manager moved us to another Jr. Suite, this time on the 6th floor - room 611. The balconies were not as nice but the room was the same. Right after we moved, there was banging from the other side of the building. We called the manager back and he put us in a large suite which was VERY nice. The room was near the southeastern corner facing the main street, room 602 I think. So if you experience problems, ask for an upgrade and they might give it to you! Or book the main suite - well worth it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Find another hotel, this is at best a three star hotel with 5 star price”
Reviews.Author: mentor
Reviews.Content: I ordered a superior room for three nights in late May 2005, at the Majestic, assuming this hotel really was a 5 star hotel. Arriving at this hotel from another 5 star hotel near by we expected at least the same service, quality and professional staff. But NOT. After complaining we got a upgrade to a premier room (712) , not nearby 5 star hotel quality at several hotels I have visited before. The facts: Price: We paid about 400 Euro for a small, stinky room, with a small bathroom. Poor quality furniture, but it had a good view from the balcony. A lot of traffic noise from 0530 in the morning. We had to have the window open since the smell from the air condition system was really terrible. Since the hotel was prepaid they even refused to let us get anything back if we moved from the hotel after check-in, even if we complained promtly. We asked for a refound for at least 1 night, but the refused even this. Faced with a bill at about 1200 Euro for three nights, we felt like we had to stay there. So; If you are looking for a 5 star hotel experience, this is not the place. The only 5 star about it is the price. So my message is clear: Stay away from the Majestic, this is a rip-off with their Majestic fantasy prices, arrogant staff and stinky rooms. We came from the Casa fuster 5 star hotel 500 m away (a real 5 star hotel). This hotel was compared with the Majestic absolutely fantastic. Cheaper, better and the service and friendlyness of the staff was superb. T.Ellefsen, Norway

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Majestic is THE PLACE to stay.......”
Reviews.Author: kc15
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a six day stay in Barcelona (our first time there) and needless to say, did NOT want to come back to New York. Barcelona was a place that we always wanted to see, and after reading the many reviews here, we decided to stay at the HOTEL MAJESTIC and were very glad that we did. This hotel is certainly worthy of a five star rating in EVERY respect. My wife and I, and my brother and his wife were celebrating anniversaries (my brother's was a very special one-30 YEARS!!!! Upon arrival we were greeted by a very friendly, professional and efficient staff. "Emilio" was at the front desk and personally showed us the various types of rooms (we had reserved suites for each couple.) Emilio then called Mr.Oscar Lucas (hotel manager) who came out and introduced himself to us and invited us to sit at the lounge for some champagne. This was very impressive and was a very nice, genuine gesture of hospitality. The hotel has nine floors of rooms and on the tenth floor is a pool with a breathtaking view of the city. From the minute you walk throught the doors of this hotel there is a feeling of elegance and warmth, which is reinforced by the warm and friendly staff who are always willing to assist you. Contrary to what some reviewers have mentioned-the rooms are NOT small nor is the hotel lobby full of busloads of tour groups. As far as the location-you can not ask for a better location. Everything is within walking distance, and there is plenty to see. On Sunday we took the train to Sitges, which is a beautiful beach, and a twenty minute train ride. You can not get a bad meal in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “The Majestic Experiene”
Reviews.Author: Blank&Gold
Reviews.Content: Barcelona was a very pleasant surprise and the Majestic was a great place to stay for our first visit. Room was nice and comfortable. Bathroom excellent. Swimming Pool on Roof a nice touch. Staff was courteous and professional. One has to love the generous drinks at the bar. Location, location, location. Perfect. A bit pricey but very enjoyable stay. When told King Juan Carlos and Queen Sofia stayed there recently, I replied, "If good enough for your King, it is good enough for me." And we all smiled.

Reviews.Title: “Majestic marvelous”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you want the best location in Barcelona as well as friendly, professional service - you must stay at the Majestic! Rooms are spacious and comfortably decorated. The bar is inviting and the restaurant outstanding. We loved the "buzz" on the street, but were happy the windows were double glazed so we didn't hear all the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have been to the Hotel twice now (the previous time was Aug. 2004) and have enjoyed excellent service on both occasions - helpful staff, more than adequate rooms for our needs and a pleasant atmosphere during the length of both trips. The Hotel's location on Passaig de Gracia makes it ideal for exploring the city (an easy stroll to Placa de Catalunya and Las Ramblas etc) but the lower floor rooms that face the street can suffer from some traffic noise - get a higher floor room and it's not a problem. Altogether, a top class hotel that fully justifies it's 5 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Majestic in every way.”
Reviews.Author: GeGa
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Majestic for 4 nights - April 16th to 20th in a wonderful suite -825. From the moment we got out of the taxi on arrival at the hotel we knew we had made the right choice. The staff were very helpful and efficent in their work (in particular the porters and doormen) from the reception desk staff to the bar staff. Breakfast was served until the civilised time of 11a.m. (when relaxing in the wonderful city of Barcelona one gets tired and needs to be able to sleep a bit late!!!) The suite was decorated in contemporary style, it was comfortable and warm with all the latest technology, which the modern traveller requires, it was the perfect place to return to after a day of wandering in this great city. The quality of service was exemplary. When I could not open the safe in my room it was sorted out immediately. When I requested an extra pillow, it arrived within 5 minutes. When I needed to send a large item home by courier, it was handled most efficently by the staff. I left the Hotel Majestic knowing that I will most certainly be back. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 3 nights (from 19/4/2005 to 22/4/2005) to celebrate my 60th birthday. We found the hotel well situated, the junior suite was first class as was the cuisine and the freindly, helpful and very professional staff. Nothing was too much trouble and we even recieved a complimentary bottle of champayne to start our celebration! This is an excellent 5 star hotel with a deserved reputation. John & Janet Penman Rochdale England.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hara1000
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Majestic 26/3-30/3 and liked it very much!! Booked a junior suite, and it was very very nice. Loved the jacuzzi bath, used it up to 3 times a day :-D The botle of cava and the truffles in our room at arrival where a very nice touch. We had some problems with the aircondition. Couldn't get it to work first, but that was fixed imediatly when we told the reception about it. When we got to our room in the afternoons it was nice and cold, but when the evening came, it didn't seem to have the power enough to chill the room (and we had it on the lowest). One afternoon/evening, our room wasn't cleaned until 18:30, which was a bit too late I think. But this was a sunday, and I guess it was a busy day for the staff. During our stay, we called housekeeping once, and they helped us very quickly, so very happy with their service otherwise. Breakfast: Yes, it was prizy, but it was also hugh and very nice! Reception: Very good service!! Location: Top!! Took us 1 minute to walk to the trainstation when we where taking the train to the Dalí-museum. 10 minutes walk to Las Ramblas. A warning, that has NOTHING to do with the hotel: Never EVER eat at Fernandez!! It's on the same street as the hotell, nr 116 I think. I wont go into all the details, but it was kaos from start to the end! After having corrected the bill 4 times (!!) we finaly got out of the restaurant. The hotel recomended it for my fiancés 35th birthday, but only because it was a big bank-holiday and most of the other restaurants where closed. I asked the hotel never to recomend this to any other of their guests. Other restaurants that the hotel recomended was very good!! We had great days in Barcelona, and if you are looking for a fancy place to stay, Majestic is the place! Thank you for a great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Majestic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Majestic Easter weekend 2005. The hotel is in a great location in the city center of Barcelona. The hotel was very clean and our junior suite room was large. The bathroom was huge by European standards. The staff were extremely helpful and knowledgable. Everyone in the city spoke English making it very easy for us gringos to get around. I would recommend trying to get breakfast included with your room because at 20 euros per person it is very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great service !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Loved the Hotel majestic ! Location is perfect, service is wonderful. We enjoyed a very nice 5 day stay in this beautiful hotel. The room was always very clean, service always prompt and efficient and staff very polite and friendly. Thank you to all the staff at Hotel Majestic for this wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Majestic”
Reviews.Author: marebear19
Reviews.Content: We spent March 10-13 at the Majestic. Booked on the hotels web site and found some good prices. We were planning a romantic weekend so went for the Jr suite. My husband and I thought this hotel was just great. The room was large and nicely decorated. Bathroom was great. Bottle of Cava on ice waiting for our arrival. We thought the hotel staff were fabulous. It is a busy place but we were treated with great respect by all the staff. No problem with getting luggage, getting a cab, etc. Celine the concierge is just a doll. She was the most helpful, friendlist person and spoke at least 3 languages. She made dinner reservations for us at two great spots on very short notice. She is a real asset to the hotel. Breakfast buffet was pricey but food was fine...many options. We had breakfast there one morning and then opted for one of the many cafes on Passage de Gracis. The location of the hotel is fantastic. Excellent shopping and restaurants nearby, tour bus stop 2 blocks away and short walk to Las Ramblas. Suggest everyone take the tourist bus (hop on/hop off) and also take a tour of Casa Batilla (near hotel) visit the Picasso Museum and stroll down Las Ramblas. Barcelona and the Majestic were both perfect!

Reviews.Title: “First class service, beautiful views, perfect holiday”
Reviews.Author: Sweetheartlikeyou
Reviews.Content: As a seasoned traveler, I am often critical of hotels - whilst trying not to be. 5 years in Dubai (where 7 star service and hotels are the norm) and the luxury of experiencing some true hotel stars (Soneva Fushi, Madives; Lanesborough & Mandarin Oriental Park Lane) means that I'm probably too critical. I was surprised then to love the Majestic - for service it is up there with the world's best. Arriving (and leaving the hotel) the friendliness of reception and porterage was impeccable - nothing was too much trouble from looking after luggage well beyong check out, to welcoming us with a warmth that will stay with us a long time (we had advised of our anniversary on booking). We stayed in Room 321 (I think) with a beautiful balcony overlooking the Passage de Gracias. Room service was very fast (Club Sandwich wonderful, though vegetable soup needed more flavour). Breakfast was not perfect for Brits (but for most Europeans our desire for toast and English sausages is probably incomprehensible (have suggested Twynings English Breakfast Tea too to management). In the end we opted for the continental breakfast which had the most gorgeous cakes we experienced in Barcelona - one with creme de Catalan. This was our first trip to Barcelona and we opted for the Majestic pack including tourist bus ticket (cannot recommend this highly enough). On arrival at the hotel we were greeted with a beautiful book on the Passsage de Gracia as a present and a lovely bottle of Vintage Cava. The message said simly "welcome home." The room may not have been the prettiest or most luxurious we have stayed in, there may not have been in-room tea and coffee facilities, but the service, attention to detail, view and wonderful staff made these insignificant. Oh and it has the best location of any hotel in Barcelona, no question. For a perfect visit to Barcelona - and to find a home away from home, we recommend the Majestic highly

Reviews.Title: “Good location, not really deluxe 5* though”
Reviews.Author: onthetrail
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 days in Barcelona, staying at the Majestic. I usually stay in Crowne Plaza hotels which are rated 4* and I found the Majestic to be sadly lacking in the home comforts provided by lesser graded hotels, e.g. no tea/coffee making facilities in room and when I tried to order a coffee from room service, I was told it would take 20 mins!! Newspapers not available in lobby, although there was a machine (satellite kiosk) whereby you install your credit card and choose your newspaper. This puzzled me as having taken heed of the guidebooks, I stored my credit cards in my room safe, was I supposed to return to my room for my card, buy my paper, and then back to my room to store my card? Very cheap for a 5*. Breakfast was a hefty 24 euro each, so I was quite pleased to read about the complimentary coffee available in the hotel lobby for guests not wanting to take full american brekkie. That was until I read it was only available between 6 and 7am, after that you paid!!!! We did enjoy a meal in the restaurant of the hotel (not the Drolma - 48euro for soup!!!!) and the service was good, not a bad price either, coming to 73euro for two. Wonderful art in the lobby of the hotel and nice reception staff and concierge but it was the little things that were lacking - a kind of penny pinching type feeling which you don't expect when you are paying 200 euro a night. All in all, I did enjoy Barcelona and the Majestic does have a prime location but I did expect more from a 5* and would definetly take a chance on booking a less expensive hotel now that I have visited this lovely city.

Reviews.Title: “Greta service, great location and quiet”
Reviews.Author: DJDB
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Majestic for 3 nights for the Chelsea Barcelona game. Was a little concerned by some of the negative comments regarding the service and standard of rooms, but shouldnt have worried. The 3 for 2 offer is an absoloute steal, and while some may find the Superior room i stayed in a touch small, especially the bathroom, the cleanliness and general facilities were fine for the price paid, and it had a small balcony too. Had b'fast delivered to the room spot on time, and very good too, really set me up for the day. The bar staff, far from being sulky, were speedy and attentive, and as we were there for a fair few hours became more and more generous with the measures. I didnt catch their names, but would like to extend a special thanks to the guys (and girls) who were so accomodating to us. The business centre was very friendly and easy to use, 15 euros to use the internet for the duration of the stay at the hotel. Last word must go to the gorgeous concierge girl, who bounces around the place smiling at everyone irrespective of their status (and they have some seriously well heeled guests) and is a real joy to deal with. Thanks for a great stay guys.

Reviews.Title: “Superb accommodation & Location”
Reviews.Author: Valjf5
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from a four night stay at the Majestic Hotel on the occasion of my husbands 60th Birthday. I must congratulate the whole Team at the Majestic Hotel for a most happy and memorable stay! On arrival we were greeted with a friendly smile and "Welcome to the Majestic Hotel" from both the Reception and Porter who showed us to our "Junior Suite". The accommodation was superb with "luxurious" furnishings throughout. An extra large double bed (with single firm mattresses per person thus ensuring a most comfortable sleep with no sag at all in the middle which can happen!) Large Double doors opened into the lounge area with a comfy sofa and armchairs to relax in, a fully enquipped desk and even a cd player as well as two TVs (one in the bedroom). The modern chrome and cream marble bathroom had a seperate large walk in powerful Shower, and even more welcome, a jacuzzi bath which was devine after walking ones feet off seeing the amazing sights! Lovely complimentary toiletries were numerous including razor and mousse, touthpaste and brush, moisturiser, fluffy dressing gowns, slippers etc etc. The Suite was located overlooking the busy Avenue de Gracia with two small balconies, once the double glazing doors were closed it must have been the most quietest acommodation we have ever stayed in. Brilliant ! On our second evening we returned to find an iced bottle of "Cava" sparkling wine, mineral water, and a delicious decorated arrangement of fresh fruit including Pineapple,strawberries,chinese gooseberries,passion fruit,grapes etc etc. What a lovely and most welcome gesture. The fruit and mineral water was even replaced on our 3rd night! Thats what I call service! The Majestic Hotel has a brilliant brilliant location, between two of the Gaudi "Must see" buildings, with a huge choice of restaurants and shops to wander by on the 10 minute stroll to the "Ramblas". The Metro is just outside and also the "Tourist Bus" Stop for seeing all the sights is only a minute away. Details/info available from Reception (3 euro with the balance payable to the Bus Courier making it the same price as paying the Tourist Bus Courier)enabling you to preplan your sightseeing, rather that trying to figure it out on the bus. Excellent discount coupons too for museum entries etc make it the best way to sightsee) On our departure at 7.15am in the morning a swift check out together with a taxi supplied in seconds ensured a good start to our journey home. If you want a Hotel "with that something special feel" this really is the Hotel to choose. A Hotel with the "Wow factor" Can`t wait to go back, truly a memorable stay in a wonderful City! Thank you so so very much Bruno,and all the Team, on ensuring such a fabulous stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel great location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located, yet quiet and exclusive. It is within walking distance of Placa Catalunya, Las Ramblas, Sagrada Familia and many other places of interest. We recently spent three nights (Dec.'04) at the Majestic and since it was my husband's birthday, we upgraded to a junior suite which, with the three for two night offer, was excellent value. The complimentary Cava (on ice) and nibbles which awaited our return on the first night were especially appreciated. The accommodation was superb and the staff couldn't have been more friendly or eager to please. As often mentioned, the view from the rooftop is amazing. We had a wonderful time in Barcelona and the standard and location of the hotel certainly added to our enjoyment. I would have no hesitation in recommending the Majestic and hope to return there myself as soon as possible. M.Murphy, N.Ireland

Reviews.Title: “A huge disappointment - very poor value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed for thee nights at the Hotel "Majestic" - what a misnomer! We booked through Lastminute (efficient) and paid approximately 1,000 Euros for the three nights (breakfast not included - see below) for a superior room. The location, on the Paseo de Gracia, is superb, especially as we were doing the "tourist bit" - it is close to many sites, and to the metro and the Barcelona tour bus stops. After that, with the notable exception of the front-desk staff, who were extremely helpful, everything was downhill .......... The problems centred around the room itself, and the (in) competency of the staff and their (poor) attitude. I don't think we've ever paid so much for such a small, poorly equipped room. We had requested a King bed - we got two singles pushed together. The windows are tiny, and the bathroom not much bigger. Room cleaning was perfunctory at best. However, the biggest issue with the room was (lack of) air-conditioning. During our stay in Barcelona, it was relatively warm, exacerbated by the heating in the room being on full when we arrived. We turned this off but, during the whole of our stay, we could never get the room cool enough to sleep in comfortably. When we complained, we were told that the air-conditioning was turned off in the winter in favour of heating, and nothing could be done (remember, this is a 5* hotel). Opening the window was no good - not only was it too small to make much difference, the hotel's location meant that there was always traffic noise. We could just about have lived with the room, had the service been great .......... Four examples - - on our first night, we had booked a restaurant outside the hotel. We asked the concierge to hail us a taxi, which he did. We inadvertently forgot to tip him so, on our return, my wife specifically sought him out and did tip him, with apologies. Yet the next three times we asked the concierge staff to hail a taxi, they clearly and deliberately ignored us, such that we had to do it ourselves, - the bar staff in the main bar on the ground floor seemed obsessed by tips. Having had poor service the first night (waiting 25 minutes for a simple order of drinks), we did not tip the waiter - on succeeding nights, we simply could not get the waiters to pay any attention to us - as I said earlier, breakfast is not included. We tried the breakfast buffet in the basement (no windows). Everything about breakfast was chaotic and disorganised - it took several minues to get seated, and then an eternity to get the tea we had ordered which, when it arrived, was lukewarm. Hoping for better things with room service the next day, we were sorely disappointed - wrong order, food that was barely warm, and this time the tea was almost cold!! At over 20 euros, the cost for waht you get is exorbitant. - last straw - on departure, we had an early morning flight to catch at Barcelona airport, travelling through the rush hour. Fifteen minutes after requesting a porter, no-one had appeared, so I called again - a further ten minutes elapsed with no show. My wife and I gathered up our luggage, and headed downstairs. When we hit the lobby, I'm sure you can guess by now what happened ..... three porters, no less, wishing to help us to a taxi, and "earn" the magic tip - we declined despite their evident disapproval. My summary - despite its wonderful location, the facilities of this hotel represent vary poor value for money (suggest you try the Hotel des Arts) - by no stretch of the imagination do they equate to five star. This is exacerbated by the approach and attitude of the staff - with the notable exception of the front desk, they seem driven by one motive - a tip. I could and would not recommend this hotel to anyone. David Shaw

Reviews.Title: “Great management like it should be in every 5 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was the lucky winner of a contest held in Belgium last autumn (3days/2 nights). When I arrived it seemed that the hotel management had upgraded me to one of their fabulous suites! The suite was gorgeous, plasma TV, a great bed, etc etc etc We had one day free use of the courtesy car, a Smart Roadster, loved to drive through Barcelona with that car! When we came in the suite in the evening we found a bottle Cava, a bottle of fine water and an enormous package of fresh fruits.. Really attentful of the management!!! To keep the review short and to the point: This 5 star hotel is perfectly located. Do not expect a 5 star hotel like IC or others. No, here you get the real service you can expect of a 5 star hotel. The management ( and all the employers!!!) does everything to make your stay comfortable. This hotel at least tries to proof they are 5 stars worth! Thanks to B.C. and the whole hotel management for our great stay!! Thanks a lot! Keep on giving this service to people, we will never forget our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from taking my mother to Barcelona to celebrate her 70th birthday. Lots of research before booking Majestic which I chose for its star rating, position (so well placed for all you could wish to do)and a 3 for 2 night offer made it even more attractive! Contact with Senor Chiaruttini assured me that our room would be comfortable and well appointed and I was overwhelmed to find that on our arrival we had been upgraded to a Junior suite complete with all the luxuries of champagne on ice etc that gave the start to our trip a real wow factor. The staff were all courteous and helpful - nothing seemed too much trouble. At the last minute in rush hour a 24hr taxi strike threatened to prevent us catching our return flight but helpful staff at the front desk located a private car which got us to the airport with time to spare. In short a wonderful trip at a great hotel - looking forward to returning later in the year with my husband!

Reviews.Title: “Indead great location, however not a four star....”
Reviews.Author: anonymous01
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in October 2004. We travel a lot to Spain (4 / 5 times a year). In our opinion this is not a four star hotel. Maybe to Spanish standards. As mentioned in other reviews, the rooms are not big, and our bathroom was far too small. Everything is packed and too basic. We thought the room does not reach a four star standard. The lobby and restaurant do. The beds are OK, staff is nice, bathroom definitely below average. The only positive thing is the location, which is right in the best shopping area of Barcelona. Our conclusion is that, although Spanish hotels are mostly below our expectations, the price/quality of Majestic is unsatisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional location and first class service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Majestic for six nights in December. As a female traveling alone to a new city, I felt quite at ease. The hotel is situated on one of the most luxurious streets in Barcelona and is in walking distance to elegant shops and other five star establishments. The Majestic exemplifies first class service and elegance with absolutuely no attitude. Everyone at the hotel from the concierge to the housekeeping staff was smiling and helpful at all times. I simply inquired about a Thai restaurant in the neighborhood and the concierge was on the phone in a matter of seconds securing a dinner reservation. The chic pool area at the top of the hotel provided some of the most romantic and stunning evening views of the city and a nightcap at their sumptuous piano lounge is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Julia007
Reviews.Content: After reviewing several 4-5* hotels in different areas of Barcelona, I'm glad I booked the Majestic. Location - superb for sightseeing, transport links, and shops. I felt safer staying near the Paseo de Gracia at night than other areas such as Las Ramblas and Bario de Gothico. Rooftop views stunning. Classical double room adequate, clean with a comfortable bed. Would have liked tea/coffee making facilities to have been provided. Quality breakfast with good choice of food (if you're after a full-English breakfast, don't eat here). Interior decor very tastefully furnished. Leisure facilities a little disappointing - pool very small - hot-tub would be nice. If you're looking for a central hotel with that special something, then I recommend the Majestic.

Reviews.Title: “Up on the roof with the Artful Dodger”
Reviews.Author: Bedwas
Reviews.Content: Just got back. Gaudis Batllo, Museu de Perfum, Metro and Aerobus (at Placa Catlunya) all nearby. Excellent service at front desk. Basic rooms clean and spatious however more akin to a 4*. 3x2 offer made the stay good value. Appreciated the Hotels efforts with the Xmas lights. Rooftop sundeck: well equiped gym, small bar, stunning views over the city - great start to a days sightseeing. One word of warning - pickpocketing is a reality. I got stung by two old ladies selling Carnations in the Montjuic area :-( Fortunately I kept cards/passport in hotel safe and only carry small amounts of cash with me. However, it still took the shine off an otherwise good trip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: BurscoughPhil
Reviews.Content: Myself, wife and daughters stayed here in July 04 and thought it was fabulous. The service was impeccable and a fault on our room air conditioning was rectified within minutes of reporting it. The roof top terrace and pool area with views over the city is a must see. Room service, mini-bar, pool bar and breakfast are all on the expensive side.... but so what, you're on holiday. It's in the best and most convenient part of the city with bars and restaurants in abundance. Turn left out the door towards the Hotel Claris and the side streets have all the cheap local tapas bars. Cross over the Graicia one block to Rambla Catalunya and you will find up market bars etc, even a late night Hagen Daas ice cream parlour that serves beer and has a street cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great, the rooms stink!”
Reviews.Author: jtcnacm
Reviews.Content: An average hotel at best with an above average price. The rooms are clean but small and on par with a Best Western. Two poor twin beds pushed together is not a king bed. Staff were nice, and the bar was great. Location cant be beat - but if your looking for a nice rest - look for a Heavenly Bed - or just stay at the Arts.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel really went all out, superior!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Majestic is wonderful, another hotel lost our reservation (Duquesa de Cardona) and could have cared less. The whole city was sold out because of a big convention. I called Majestic and explained our situation, what wonderful ambassadors for Barcelona, they stepped up to the plate and found us a room. The room was delightful, but bath was very cramped. Because of this they also gave us discounted rate. What goodwill. I can not say enough about quality of service, and Hotel. There is a reason that they are five star!

Reviews.Title: “Poor value”
Reviews.Author: Justine1974_11
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to Barcelona, so with that in mind we decided to splash out. Was it value for money? I think not! Was the location great? Oh yes!!! I have mixed views on the majestic, the hotel room was small, We had booked a Superior room at a cost of 760euros for 3 nights so not exactly budget but certainly small, offering few room extras, poor view and 2 single beds. The rooms that face on to the main street with balcony, are an additional 170euros per night......!! so dont think when you book you will end up overlooking Barcelona city, you will instead be facing the appartments across the street. The service was poor, inparticular the restaraunt. I found the staff brash quite abrupt and slow to serve. I ordered coffee only to be served tea, complained, was served hot water instead before finally getting coffee. Wait for it......the waiter then poured the coffee into my cup which he had half filled with tea earlier is that quality or what?This level of service was a not a one of it seemed to migrate through to the cleaning staff. The location is fantastic but with so many other hotels offering more in terms of room size etc an extra 5 minute walk from another hotel is worth considering. Here is a wee tip for you as well.....to order 2 glasses of wine on the roof terrace is 12euros to order a bottle is 13euros!!!!!!!!! Work that one out. All that said we had a nice time but would not go back to the Majestic, best you make up your own mind.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, great service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel. It is obvious that there is a real tradition of hospitality in this hotel. The staff were universally polite and helpful. The location is excellent, right on the Gracia, within close walking distance of high-end shopping and restaurants. The only negative is that we don't think that all the rooms are equally nice. We were shown a first room which clearly was inferior to what we ended up with. So make sure to ask for a higher end room.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: kaycoisa
Reviews.Content: The Majestic is well run, the rooms are nice, the staff is efficient and best of all - it has a roof top pool. The location on Passeig de Gracia near shops, the Barrio Gotica, the Gaudi buildings etc. makes it very convenient for women alone or families. Our stay in August for 4 days was a bargain. (August is always cheap in Spanish Cities). Our 3 day stay in early October was more expensive but still great. It is also far far safer than the Ramblas. We spend 3 months of every year in Girona one hour north of Barcelona. This is our favorite hotel. One complaint - The dining room - nice - but there is never anyone there. We prefer to dine at Citron nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat Dissapointing.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Majestic for 10 nights in September, and overall we found it to be a reasonably pleasant hotel but certainly overpriced/overated. On arrival we found out that because of the length of our stay, we had been upgraded to a "superior" room at no extra cost. Although this seemed like a nice gesture, we found the room to be very dissapointing and of a lower standard than we would have expected from the "basic" room we had paid for. It was very small, and not very well equiped considering that it was in a 5* hotel - there wasn't even a trouser press! The biggest disappointment with our room was the poor and erratic nature of the maid service. Some days our room wasn't cleaned at all, other days it was half cleaned, on two occasions the cleaner took all the towels but didn't replace them, and although after I complained at the front desk, towels were sent up and reassurances given that it wouldn't happen again, the following day the cleaner took all the pillow cases and didn't replace them! The bathroom wasn't cleaned properly during our entire stay - the sticky label from a previous guests shampoo bottle was stuck to the outside of the bath when we arrived, and it was still there when we left! As we suspected that the bathroom wasn't being cleaned other than around the sink, we deliberately placed small lengths of cotton thread on the toilet and bidet to see if they got cleaned off - they didn't!! Another negative point was the roof terrace - although it had good views, the swimming pool up there was tiny and should really be described as a dip pool instead. The roof top bar closed very early as well, which was a shame as it would have been nice to sit up there in the evenings. The hotel piano bar, on the other hand, was certainly a plus point - very friendly and attentive staff, together with a nice ambience. Location wise as well, the hotel is perfect with plenty of tapas bars, and good eateries in the area. It's also quite close to some of Barcelona's tourist attractions etc. Having stayed at other hotels in Barcelona (This was our 8th trip to the city), our opinion of the Majestic is that it just isn't worth the money as there are much nicer places to stay that cost far less.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment!!! The lobby and the staff were good, but the rooms were BIG BIG disappointment - small, Motel 6 furnishings for 5 star hotel prices. Some rooms did not have a window. The pillows and towels were 1/2 sized. To get to the toilet, my broad shouldered husband had to turn sideways. The only good feature of the hotel was its location - across the street from Gaudi's Casa Bastilo and 2 blocks from Casa Meri and in the middle of the nice shopping area. The location was a good walk from Las Ramblas, which is chancy for the late night, unless you are in a group and with someone who knows their way around and speaks Catalon Spanish. Next time - somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: hazel2
Reviews.Content: beautiful hotel. had been a little concerned after reading reviews on this website, but the manager and staff did everything to make us happy and comfortable (both concierge and front desk are very friendly and helpful). wonderful views from the room, and phenomenal buffet breakfast. probably no better view of barcelona from the rooftop terrace with pool (which is great). will definitely stay at majestic again when is barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just returned from 4 nights at the Majestic. We obtained a great deal for a junior suite direct with the hotel. When we arrived at 2 pm our suite was not ready but the staff could not have been more apologetic. We were escorted to the bar/lounge and told to order a drink on the house. This suited us as we were planning on going straight for a drink anyway. All the while we were kept informed of the progress of our suite. We decided to have a light lunch while we were waiting, for which we were fully expecting to pay, but that also was on the house. We were then taken to our suite by the PR girl, and given her personal extension number to call if we needed anything more. The suite was delightful in every way, with a wonderful view over the Passeig de Gracia. All of the staff were extremely friendly and helpful, and the hotel is in one of the best areas and within walking distance of all the main attractions. We found the Ramblas area to be too noisy and tacky, and were very glad we hadn't stayed in that area. Overall a wonderful trip, and would thoroughly recommend staying at the Majestic.

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: buffgirl73
Reviews.Content: I had read some of the reviews of the Majestic before going but after booking and was a little concerned. I had also heard from a couple of friends that the standard rooms were small, so we booked a Junior Suite and it was fantastic. The recent renovations seem to have benefited these rooms hugely. Excellent fixtures and fittings (apart from one of the slightly temperamental TVs in the bedroom!), down to the bathrobes and slippers. The service was discreet and yet incredibly attentive just as it should be. The district is fab if you like shopping and within walking distance to pretty much everywhere except the Olympic Port which we found overly touristy and pretty lacking in atmosphere. It's also quieter than around Las Ramblas but with plenty going on. The only downside to this hotel that we found was the room service. The menu after 11pm was pretty limited and the quality of the food was pretty poor (in relation to what you'd expect from a 5* hotel). A small thing really but I think it would help them gulf the gap that they been attempting between a 4* and 5* establishment. All in all it was a great stay for great value, the prices seem to be about 2/3rds the price of the other 5* in the City.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment in many ways”
Reviews.Author: ehelgason
Reviews.Content: The Majestic has a wonderful location at the Paseig Gracia avenue in the most fashionable district of Barcelona. The building in itself is a landmark, surrounded by famous buildings, some by Gaudi himself. But - in a way I found they have damaged their position on the celebrated street. The ground floor of the hotel has been rented or sold to high fashion stores, so not much remains of the common area of the hotel except the reception and the bar - giving the impression of a narrow corridor. The hotel has two restaurants, one in a low basement, the other, more expensive, on the second floor - in spaces that are rather crammed. We decided on dinner in the cheaper restaurant, in the basement. This was one of the worst restaurant experiences I´ve ever had. We had to ask three times for water. No bread arrived on the table. At long last I got the hors d'ouvre, a mediocre gaspachio. After one and an half hour the main course had not arrived. Then we decided to revolt and left. Other guests in the restaurant almost applauded us as we did so. The hotel staff had the good sense not to bill us for this nonexistant meal. We had some lovely tapas in a great place across the street, with very efficient service. More complaints. I asked for our bags to be sent down from our rooms, which is normal procedure in a five star establishment. They had not arrived in 45 minutes, despite my having repeated the request, so I went and got them myself. The room was rather small, but admittedly the bed was comfortable. Most of the hotel staff were also quite nice, exepting the wooden waiters in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Majestic”
Reviews.Author: lansingisland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Majestic in late June for 2 nights. We were very pleased with this hotel. The service was polite and helpful, location was perfect, and the rooftop pool was great for views. I think all hotels that host a lot of Americans should have some sort of coffee service available. I recommend this hotel, especially for it's central, safe, quiet location.

Reviews.Title: “Much Better Hotels exist in Same Price Range with Better Service in BCN”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a total of 3 times and this last stay was the worst. For a 5 star hotel, they sure dont act like one. Their reception staff is rude and unaccomodating, particularly to Americans I have noticed over my 3 trips there. The Junior Suite was small for the price (349 Euros). And beware of the packages you purchase. I purchased a "Majestic SUite" Package and only received the free bottle of Champagne... hotel promised champagne, chocolate truffles and some type of gift on arrival day and I only got the champagne because I called reception. reception also did not answer the internal telephone so i resorted to calling an outside line and of course they pick up right away -- they obviosuly don't consider their existing guests a high enough priority! All in all, I would avoid this hotel. I plan to stay at a better hotel next time in Barcelona. I think Majestic doesnt deserve more than 4 stars, and that is being too generous!

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast. Pity about the room.”
Reviews.Author: JJc 300
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at the hotel I was advised that the type of room requested was not available. For 1 night I was given a smoking room instead and no balcony. Next 3 nights was given supposedly as a gesture of goodwill a smaller non smoking room with a minute balcony overlooking Gracia, a very busy road. On our last evening following discussion with Bruno the marketing Director we were given a comp bottle of CAVA. Too little Too Late. Advise any potential visitors to inspect the room before acceptance as the hotel's idea of a superior room fluctuates. Great location. Great breakfast. Jim.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience! Barcelona's Best Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Strongly recommend this hotel. Location is unique on the shopping avenue of Barcelona. We were there during the sales and it is worthwhile. Hotel staff makes you feel like at home and the overall services are great. The room was large and we were positively surprised that they are not outdated as some of tripadvisors reviewers have said. The rooftop pool is a must and the view unbeatable. You are walking distance from any major attractions: plaza de catalonia, Ramblas or Rambla de Catalonia and you are also 1 block away from 2 Gaudi masterpieces. We had a great deal on their website with a 2=3 in July and found to be a fantastic value for money. As some said: MAJESTIC is FANTASTIC

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel, located on a beautiful avenue in a beautiful city!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: this hotel is tops! we had a great room with a princess balcony that looked down onto the avenue , where the sea was in one direction and the mountains in the other. the rooms were very comfortable and spacious. the staff was friendly and courteous, we always had help hailing a taxi when we needed one. the roof/pool area was great with a fantastic view. the bar was very nice, dark paneling and interesting art work.I enjoyed checking out the women and their bags after a day of shopping. we stayed here only for a weekend, and i would certainly stay at the Majestic again. Barcelona is a wonderful place to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Problems with Website”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have not stayed at the hotel, but did make an online reservation through the hotel's official website. This has proven impossible to cancel online. The hotels cancellation web-page is non-responsive and my hotel-issued booking number is too many digits to fit in the dialog box. I was especially concerned about this when I noted the other reviewer's comments on this site which indicates that he was charged even when he e-mailed his cancellation. Obviously this hotel has problems.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelonas Best”
Reviews.Author: ket6920
Reviews.Content: Although it has been eight months since my wife and I have stayed at this hotel I would just like to add my opinion of this fine establishment. It has one of the friendliest and most considerate staffs we have come across in all our trips throughout europe. As has been said, some of the rooms may need improvement but if you don't like the first room you are given it is up to you to request another one. We also would like to compliment the wait staff at the bar for their friendliness and courtesy. All these people made our stay in Barcelona much more pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Four Nights in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just completed a four night stay from May 1st to the 5th... The hotel was great. First of all it was in the best location in the city. You are in the center of the nicest area, and within walking distance of most of the major attractions. At night, La Rumbas can a little scary, so if you want to walk around at night, this is the area for you. Out of a 5 scale, I would give the room a 3. It was perfectly ok, but not to the level of a 5-star rating. The rest of the hotel did meet 5-star standards. The front desk and staff get a five!... They were always helpfull, had great dinning suggestions and made us feel very welcome and at home. After using this site to select this hotel, I was happy with the selection and would stay here on my next visit.
